author: {'steamid': '76561198117623819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1709045644}
review:
Una excelente aplicación de un gran juego de mesa, ojalá GMT se pusiera en vías de hacer cosas similares para otros de sus juegos de mesa: si bien los juegos de mesa brillan en su formato original, está bueno tener la opción de jugarlos en pc con amigos que están lejos o si simplemente antoja, y además los juegos del género de guerra son particularmente aptos a ser adaptados a este medio.

No voy a ponerme a explicar aquí qué es un "card driven wargame", pero para el que al verlo sienta curiosidad, sepa que este esta considerado de forma unánime el mejor, o mínimo un top 5 de los cientos que existen. Gran juego como tal que además hace gala de su setting.

review: This is a great adaptation of the board game. Twilight Struggle itself seems dense at first, but once you get the mechanics, and there's a great tutorial in the game, really is one of the best interpretations of a theme I've ever played in a board game. You feel the tension and the backhandedness of the US and USSR during the Cold War. Plus you feel smart playing it because its all the cards are based off historical events. Highly tactical, highly underrated, highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027517707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1709093826}
review: The computer game is very good.  The problem is the game itself.  I always compare card based war games to Paths of Glory, which IMO is one of the best games.  Same concept of using cards in multiple ways (events, operations, etc), but whereas Paths of Glory is incredibly balanced game, regardless of card draws, Twilight Struggle is heavily weighted towards the USSR in the beginning.  So much so, that some very bad initial draws by the US Player can put the US into a huge hole early in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124926619', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1708211337}
review:
One of my favourite board games that really ever gets to hit the table for complexity and player count reasons. This does an excellent job of simulating the board game and keeping track of permenant cards for you. Perfect on PC, pretty good on mobile (separate paid game but a port) with one flaw, pros and cons below. 

Pros:
-Great game for two friends
-Highly replayable, and has cheap DLC that adds even more variety if wanted. Changing sides and learning strategies is fun and engaging.
-Controls are really smooth and makes it easier to zoom out the map to see the whole board and also close up on an important area
-Keeps track of permenant cards on left and right (hover over to read them)
-Has a handicap system
-Challenging and fun AI
-Online play with friends (email sign-up required)
-Great OST and the atmospheric excerpts from political speeches really adds to immersion and doesn't feel intrusive even after playing for a while (I only have a few hours on Steam as I play mobile too)
-Game gives a warning when you will do a play that will lose you the game (Defcon going to 1)

Cons:
-Would be nice to have an option to have set cards just to help teach people the game for the first time
-Handicap system only helps so much to a newer player as influence only helps so much when you're not sure where to play it
-Though the AI is great, it's kind of too good if you're blind. There are no difficulty settings, only way is to keep playing and maybe give yourself a handicap
-If you buy the also great app online, be aware that seeing permanent cards is extremely difficult
-Rulebook is poor and misses some key information, but tutorial is pretty decent. WIsh there was a better quick guide for new players

Hope this helps you decide if it is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027005470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 9304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1059, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1712488623}
review:
Twilight Struggle is a card-based 1v1 tabletop strategy game. Is is a very deep game themed in the Cold War, and probably one of the best tabletop games ever made. This adaptation is good enough to play online games, and the automation is nice.

The Good:
+Functioning Online Multiplayer
+Decent AI to play against
+The interface is fairly intuitive
+It got confirmation to all your plays so you don't lose to a missclick
+A handicap system to modify the balance at your taste

The Bad:
-No unranked online multiplayer
-No dificulty settings for the AI

author: {'steamid': '76561198382671052', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 132, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1712224086}
review: 战火过去，却是另一种形式的角逐。这款游戏适合每一个了解冷战和对它感兴趣的人，在这款游戏里你可以重写历史，完成前人没有完成的事，重组政变 太空竞赛，你可以用各种手段与你的对手争夺话语权，游戏中随时播放的领导人谈话更是让人身临其境，置身庞大的冷战棋局，你也许是里根，也许是勃列日涅夫，但无论你是谁，都为了自己理想的世界而战斗。总体而言，这部游戏非常有代入感，太空竞赛及核危机系统非常有趣，大量卡牌既丰富了游戏内容，也让人们了解到历史知识，背景音效更是生动渲染出紧张的气氛，唯一的缺点就在于战争系统太过简单，带有很大的运气成分，没办法生动刻画出战争的场面。但是仍然不妨碍我推荐给大家

review:
过分好玩了！！！ 英国冷战时期就和美勾结啊，这下对于前几年的脱欧更深入理解了。还有以色列和美的勾当，南北韩朝小日子的背后势力，中国的强大和和平立场，到现在结构都没变。
这种边玩边学历史太好了，想入坑兵棋了，虽然据说ts不算兵棋。
平衡方面根据知乎看的苏联让美国2点影响力大数据苏52%胜，很舒服。

author: {'steamid': '76561198068456911', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3287, 'last_played': 1711089545}
review:
Товарищи! В докладе ЦК партии на XX съезде и в ряде выступлений
делегатов на съезд, как и прежде на Пленуме ЦК КПСС.
заседаниях Коммунистической партии Советского Союза довольно много говорилось о культе личности.
и о его пагубных последствиях.
После смерти Сталина ЦК начал проводить политику краткого и краткого объяснения.
последовательно, что недопустимо и чуждо духу марксизма-ленинизма возвышение одного человека,
превратить его в сверхчеловека, обладающего сверхъестественными характеристиками, сродни характеристикам бога. Такой
человек якобы все знает, все видит, думает за всех, все может, непогрешим в
его поведение.
Такое убеждение о человеке, и конкретно о Сталине, культивировалось у нас многие годы.
Целью настоящего доклада не является тщательная оценка жизни и деятельности Сталина. Касательно
Сталина, в России уже было написано вполне достаточное количество книг, брошюр и исследований.
его жизнь. Роль Сталина в подготовке и осуществлении Социалистической революции, в
Гражданская война и борьба за строительство социализма в нашей стране общеизвестны.
Все это хорошо знают.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033602286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1705104458}
review: Well done implementation of a classic game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991633121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 25, 'playtime_at_review': 2369, 'last_played': 1712004960}
review: Never before have I lost a turn based strategy game to a computer so many times in a row. But, that just means how good it will be once you learn how to play it right. Step one is learning to avoid thermonuclear suicide. Step two is learning to avoid by trying scoring cards that will again trigger game over suicide. Step 3 is the joy of crushing the stupid AI and creatively armchair generaling your way into winning the Cold War.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372953888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1705319018}
review:
之前一直玩中文学习版，赶上打折就入手了，18元真不贵。还是正版感觉好，dlc内容都解锁了，字体排版也更美观，虽然是英文。
这个游戏目前最新版不支持社区的中文补丁了，打上补丁后会黑屏。只能用老版游戏打补丁。
玩着时，有些卡牌效果不明白，还要开学习版的卡牌一览表，确认卡牌效果。
就是和AI打太单调，堪比虐小学生，加10点都不难赢，可我也不想和人玩，希望能有个更给力的地狱级AI。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102774748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1600, 'last_played': 1704165722}

This game has a lot of issues with the actual doing of the moment to moment plays. Going back and forth is fidgety, some features aren't apparent, the warnings/prompts are sometimes insufficient or not there.  I really don't see how they sell this game for 10 dollars with how like unpolished it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115714464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9169, 'last_played': 1707569068}
review:
Un excellent jeu sur la guerre froide, de 1947 à 1991. La portabilité sur Steam est excellente.
Un regret en jeu multijoueurs : il est impossible d'imposer le fuseau horaire d'un adversaire potentiel. Les parties sont en durée limitées. Par exemple si un joueur new-yorkais joue à 10h00 heure locale et qu'en France vous ne pouvez jouer en semaine qu'à partir de 19h00, heure française, vous prenez 17h00 de délai sur votre compteur, et vous pouvez perdre au juste au compteur.
Mais je recommande très fortement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158671876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1509036432}
review:
Strengths:
Deep strategic gameplay: Twilight Struggle offers a surprisingly deep and layered experience despite its seemingly simple card-driven mechanics. Each card plays multiple roles, and the interplay between events, coups, and scoring opportunities creates a constant puzzle to solve.
Historical accuracy and immersion: The game is meticulously researched and reflects real-world events and figures of the Cold War. The cards, artwork, and mechanics effectively convey the period's tension and paranoia, drawing players into the historical setting.
High replayability: With a large deck of cards and multiple scoring conditions, each game of Twilight Struggle plays differently. The variable setup and hidden information within the deck ensure you'll face new challenges and surprises every time.
Balanced asymmetry: Though both players have different goals and abilities, the game feels remarkably balanced. Each superpower presents unique challenges and strengths, forcing players to adapt their strategies accordingly.
Rewarding for skilled play: While luck plays a role, good decision-making, card management, and reading your opponent's moves are ultimately what lead to victory. Mastering the game's systems and intricacies feels immensely rewarding.

Weaknesses:
Steep learning curve: Twilight Struggle can be daunting for newcomers with its numerous cards, icons, and unfamiliar historical references. The rulebook is thorough, but mastering the game takes time and dedication.
Long playing time: Games can last anywhere from 1 to 3 hours, depending on player experience and decision speed. This might not be suitable for players who prefer quicker or lighter games.
High reliance on player interaction: The game thrives on direct interaction between players, bluffing, and reading your opponent's moves. For players who prefer less confrontational or more solo-friendly experiences, Twilight Struggle might not be a good fit.
Can be frustrating for non-history buffs: While not essential, historical knowledge can give players an edge in understanding card effects and strategizing effectively. This might disadvantage players unfamiliar with the Cold War era.
Limited replayability for casual players: While hardcore fans can endlessly explore strategy nuances, casual players might find the core gameplay loop repetitive after a certain number of games.

Overall:
Twilight Struggle is a thought-provoking, strategically deep, and historically immersive game that rewards careful planning, skillful play, and reading your opponent. However, its steep learning curve, long playing time, and focus on player interaction might not be for everyone. If you enjoy strategic card games, historical simulations, and tense head-to-head battles, Twilight Struggle is definitely worth checking out. But be prepared to invest time and effort into learning and mastering its intricacies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163685364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1703498283}
review: This game feels a bit dated. The UI is very unclear and lacks basic UI qualities that modern digital games have, such as tooltips. It's often not clear to see what you're supposed to be doing or what the effect of an action is going to be. It's painfully slow to browse the cards in your hand. The AI is also really slow but at the same time it's hard to see what the AI is doing. The whole process of cardplay should be the most fun part of the game, but you just can't see what's going on half the time. My conclusion: to be able to even play this you need a full understanding of the boardgame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030209613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1523, 'last_played': 1703453799}
review:
This is a great and solid implementation of the board game. Doesn't seem to have any bugs. However, the ambient sounds feel obnoxiously excessive and unnecessary, and the AI play is annoying because it makes you wait 30 seconds (which feels like an eternity) for the AI to select an action but then plays it extremely fast and quickly making it difficult to read/see what it did. 
But I do not recommend this game unless you already know and like the game. This game is frustrating and the opposite of fun, imo. Of course, many disagree with that, but those people aren't looking at reviews anyway. This game is very difficult, slow, and opaque to new players. You have to possess a very deep understanding of the game's rules and all the cards in the decks if you want to actually play competently and not get destroyed --even then, I am still not sure if you'll enjoy the game. 
Would you like a more complicated and more punishing version of Chess based on the Cold War as a card-board game? Do you have a lot of patience during play and during the learning process? Do you want to spend days and many dozens of games losing before you understand what's happening? Then this game is for you. (I'd rather spend time elsewhere; I think even grand-epic-strategy games are easier to get into than this game.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198000213457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1985, 'last_played': 1700593118}
review:
The PC version of the classic boardgame is an excellent game. 

The game design is good and I like the way scoring balance is displayed which makes it easy to see where you lag behind in influence. The graphics is crisp and clear and the music and SFX are good and creates a proper cold war ambience for your games. I think the game log could have been a little better implemented.

Something I think could have been better is the online play. You should be able to better filter available games and set more parameters for your games, for example their ranking. I also would prefer the possibility to get a certain amount of time (say 24 hours) for each turn instead of having a fixed amount of time for all my turns.

Very recommended both as one of the best  board games ever  and for the steam version! 

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198147888059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1700313916}
review:
桌游很好玩，移植也很棒。但作为一个对抗游戏，总得和人对抗对吧？多人模式遇到的都是大佬，自己和Ai玩，AI对手的水平又太弱了，我遇到过好多ai把自己蠢死的情况，比如：
1. 美国ai，在没有3点牌和有欧洲记分牌的情况下打出封锁，将西德送给我，然后在我控制欧洲后打出欧洲记分牌让我获得胜利。
2. 苏联ai，在DEFCON2的时候打出CIA，我政变战场国，让我直接获胜。
3. 苏联ai，在我领先18分的情况下打出厨房辩论，让我直接获胜。
.....
这种情况还有很多，5/6的对局ai都会自己蠢到输掉游戏，能打到终局计分的情况我只有玩到过一把，给ai让10点也可以轻松获胜，真无语了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198334787359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1704732150}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969527574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1702851651}
review:
Probably the best of Playdek's interpretations of GMT's board games, much more accessible than Labyrinth and Fort Sumter. The AI is an unforgiving opponent to learn the game against, but once you recognise it's patterns and you have a little deck knowledge your odds improve considerably. Theming and background sound are bang on; if a little repetitive after a few plays.

The back catalogue of GMT games is exceedingly large I would love to see someone take on some of the tougher projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095257819', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 8813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 78, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1711746623}
review:
S

전략 갓겜.

한글패치가 있긴 한데, 멀티플레이가 불가능해서 영어공부가 필수다.
룰 익힐겸 처음엔 한글패치로 컴퓨터랑 플레아하다가,
https://twilightstrategy.com/card-list/ 여기에 카드리스트 공부해서 온라인 게임할 것을 적극추천.
Ai는 자기가 갖고 있는 점수카드를 맹신하여 손해만 계속보는 멍청한 플레이를 하는데,
사람이랑 하면 그 압박감이 장난아니다.
바둑같은 게임이다. 꿀잼꿀잼.

Setting and buy Tip

애니메이션 속도 패스트로 바꿔주자.

게임 종료후 GG WP 하면 예의바르게 보인다. 서로 두시간동안 고생했으니 격려해주자.
굿 게임 웰 플레이드.


Play tip

0.중요한건 도미네이션을 가져오는 플레이냐 깨는 플레이냐

1.데프콘 자살 카드가 손에 한장이라도 있다면 자살할바에야 헤드라인 때털기
Cia , 대곡물수출(패줄여서 데프콘 자살 유도.(상대카드면 뺏은뒤 우주로보내기도함.), 커버 앤 덕,  티얼 다운 디스 월, 칼기 격추, 스타워즈
오르테가(쿠바 프리쿱)
위 윌 버리 유, 론 건맨
올림픽 (보이콧)
미사일 엔비 (상대카드에서 내 이벤트 데프콘 뽑았을때) 
섬밋(내가냈는데 상대가합더높으면 데프콘 조정시켜서 패배)

2.데프콘2나 아프리카 쿠데타 싸움시 들어간 레바논은 개꿀이다. 데프콘3에서 쿠데타 받을일이 없어서 굉장히 안정적.


3.프랑스는과보호되어야한다.
(드골,좋은 관계,트루먼독트린)

4.상대에게 중국이있거나 있을 예정이라면 아시아 전장국가들은 과보호되어야한다.

5.중반 이후 전장국가들은 과보호되어야한다.

6.상대에게 좋은 쿠데타 거리를 만들어주지 않는다. (데프콘3이 아니면 아시아에 진출하지 않는 이유)

7.이집트는 소련이 먹었다가 미국이 먹는식이다. 이집트에 과한 투자는 금물

7.닉슨은 중국카드를 뒤집어서 가져오고 문화대혁명은 앞으로가져온다. 이것을 유념해야할건 10턴으로, 미국이 중국을 가져가도 사용할순없다. 소련은 다르지만

8.이란과 태국은 중요하다. 태국은 점수 두 번 계산하고 이란은 인도파키스탄 접근권이 생긴다.

9.전장국가를 먼저 먹으면 금방 랭크가 오른다. 상대 이벤트가 있더라도 초기 접근을 두려워하지말자. (프랑스,이집트,파키스탄,인도)

10.곡물로 상대카드뺏어온뒤 UN을쓰면 효과적용된다.

11.디스탈린주의는 첫 더미 끝나면 우주로보내는식. 초반에 버리면 남미가 너무 쉽게 뚫림.
이게 싫은 소련은 일부러 베를린 봉쇄를 내기도 하며 

12. 3턴까지 파나마2 멕시코2정도 둬야한다. 쿠바찌르기 위해 옆으로 두는 경우도있음.
아프리카도 뻗어나가면 좋은데, 자이르 옆 비전장국가를 먹는방법도 괜찮다.
군사 무기 협정으로 
소련은 탈스탈린, 오펙, 이슬람혁명, 고르바초프 등을 가져가고
미국은 보이스 오브 아메리카, 에스크 낫, 곡물수출, 동유럽 불안(후기) 등을 가져간다.

13.디콜 전에 인도네시아는 먹어야 한다.

14.사우디로 가는 길은 요르단보다는 이라크에 하나 놓는게 낫다.
여차하면 이라크도 먹을 수 있고, 이란을 비집고 들어갈 수도 있으며,
상대가 먹는다 해도 op를 하나 더 투자하기 때문이다.
이스라엘은 깨름직한 곳이라 마지막에 먹는 편이다. 

15.한국전쟁이 안터졌는데 한국을 먹겠다면 한국을 일단 먹은다음에 
한국전쟁은 3턴 이후에 우주로 쐈다면 따라가도 된다, 그 사이에 일본 이벤트가 뜰수도있고
백퍼센트는 아니기 때문이다.

16.상대 점령중인 국가 찌르는 플레이.
특히 미국이라면 해줘야한다. 소련이 일반적으로 쿠데타로 이득본다면
이쪽은 전장국가를 하나 취할수가있다.



소련
1.<트루먼 독트린> 유럽에서 항상 주의해야한다. 미국이 마지막 라운드떄 조종걸고 쇼부거는 경우가 있어서 유럽의 전장국가들은 항상 과보호되어야하며, 특히 프랑스는 좋은관계로 인해 언제든 영향력 2개가 날아올 수 있어서 +2 과보호되어야한다.

2.abm  준타들고있으면 헤드라인으로 abm내자.
괜히 미사일엔비에뺏길수있다

3.소련의10턴마지막라운드에 미국에게 공격해서
도미를 깨는식이어야 최선의 방어로 게임을 마칠수있다. 

미국
1.<블락케이드> 나오기 전까지 '3' 이상 들고있어야 하며
 레드스케어 콤보 맞으면 봉쇄정책 이벤트로 쓰던가 4짜리 들고있던가 더 주의해야한다.

2.<마지막 라운드는 상대를 골탕맥이자> 미국의 마지막 라운드에 무엇을 하느냐에따라 
소련이 쿠데타로 손쉽게 이득을 얻거나, 미국이 쿠데타 기회를 잡거나 다른 전장국가를 먹기도 한다. (조종깨뜨려서)

3.1턴 HL로 마셜플랜 말고 망명자들로도 서독,프랑스,이탈리아를 먹을 수 있다.

4.초반 이집트 2개 들어가는거 겁내지말자 나세르 나와도 바로 안먹히며, 리비야를 먹을수있고, 사다트축출시 영향력이 하나는 있어야 먹을 수 있다. 따라서 이집트를 먼저 먹어야한다.

5.불안한 이스라엘 보다는 사우디가 더 나음

6.우수리,보이스 오브 아메리카 등 공격은 상대가 대응 불가능한 지역에 하는게 좋다.

7.아시아는 과보호되어야한다. 



어이없는 상황
미사일 엔비 썼는데 상대방이 핵폐기금지 냄. 그걸로 데프콘5되고, 난 서독 하나 있었는데
재조정으로 털림. 이거 맞냐..

author: {'steamid': '76561197972996364', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 20165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20165, 'last_played': 1675569397}
review:
One of the best board games of all time as far as I'm concerned.  Essentially you're trying to gain more control over the globe compared to your opponent while you experience historical events of the Cold War. 
 The game flow, strategy, and tactics here are some of the best I've experienced in a modern board game.  It also evokes its Cold War theme better than most board games ever will.  The sound effects this Steam version supplies enhances this theme very well.

Multiplayer community is also active and challenging.  Some people are really good at this game and are able to make good moves quickly.  I'm definitely not that much of an expert, with a 1.5 hr time limit per person being my minimum threshold without risking timing out.  You can also play this as a correspondence game if that's your cup of tea, and it also works great.

Biggest complaint is the achievements are bugged.  I would definitely be trying to 100% this game were it not for these bugs.  Years after purchase this is still not fixed, so the developers must not care about maintaining this game any more.

author: {'steamid': '76561199016848953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1698583207}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002524352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 102360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102275, 'last_played': 1708285895}
review:
A fine digital adaptation of one of the best physical boardgames out there. It is not without its flaws, mind you. The AI is very poor and there are some weird rule implementation decisions, such as turning ties into US victories. 

But there is reasonably-sized community of players for online matches, both live and turn-based, so the AI doesn't matter much. Of course it hasn't the same tactile feeling of battling the Cold War over an epic board. But it is the next best thing if you are short of time and/or players for a face-to-face game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047630351', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1710584361}
review:
냉전을 기반으로 만들어진 카드게임

냉전당시의 유명한 사건사고를 많이 알아야 더 유리하다(카드의 버프 디버프가 이걸 따라가기떄문에)

응애뉴비는 컴퓨터랑 하는것보다 똑같은 응애뉴비 붙잡고 1대1로 하는게 더 나을수도있다
사람은 실수를 하는데 컴퓨타는 내 패를 읽는거같다...

재미?

배경에서 공허한 배경음과 함께 어떻게해야 영향력을 높이지란 생각을 하고있으면 시간이 없어진다.
냉전과 보드게임 둘중하나를 좋아한다면 사서 해보자 
실제 보드게임도 현실에 있으니까 이거 사기 싫은 친구있는 인싸는 
보드게임카페가서 이거 달라고해서 하면 될듯합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010010051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32064, 'last_played': 1701786817}
review:
This version keeps the game spirit and allow faster game play while limiting error of play.

The asynchronous multiplayer system is nice too. One move or 2 day on a few games, that's it.
The AI is of course a bit below the average player but decent enough to learn the system before challenging expert players.

Good design, good GMT game and good digital adaptation !

author: {'steamid': '76561198118884047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1708052114}
review: I am a big fan of the board game, and after seeing the digital version on sale, I decided to pick it up. Having some bonus card packs is nice compared to the board game, but the experience is not even remotely the same. The lack of difficulty setting is irritating (there is a handicap for starting influence, though). My starting hands are almost always mediocre at best, whereas my AI opponent ALWAYS starts with a stellar hand. The AI ignores features of the game that real life players enjoy (especially the space race track). While this version of the game may ultimately be appealing to some, the real life board game with one or more friends is a vastly better experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057538972', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1690546123}
review: Too luck dependent to be a strategy game - the whole game is just who got better cards and who rolls dice better. Especially since you're on a computer, you might as well play an actual strategy game like HOI4. Honestly, War is a better card game; it's the same amount of skill, but it doesn't take 2 hours to play a single game. Don't buy this online, and burn it if you own the physical game, but keep the dice: The heat from the smoldering ashes will be worth more than the game itself, and you still have the dice, so you can just roll those 10 times to decide who would've won the game anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561199199374600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1709135855}
review:
So, this is a beautiful game. The learning curve is huge, the game is tense. I have the Apple APP for many years and now I have purchased the Steam Version hoping fo a better version of the AI.

If you want to spend some casual time playing against the "AI" (supposedly) you may be very frustrated because it cheats big time (yes, I have done the statistics of dice rolling), the "AI" just have the gift to double guess your Headline cards. Anyway, I know it is childish to want an AI for a game developed 6 or 7 years ago but the algorith of dice rolling just spoils your fun, You can see Vietnam Revolts sweeping your 4 influences off in Italy in a coup but your US/Japan Mutual Defense Pact can´t get Iran back to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028764380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1693590679}
review: Studená válka (Twilight Struggle) je bez nadsázky jedna z nejlepších strategických deskových her, jaké jsem kdy hrál (ne-li nejlepší)! V podstatě se jedná o modernější a sofistikovanější variantu šachů, neboť i zde je třeba protivníka udolat nevybíravým postupem, protože v okamžiku sebemenšího zaváhání jste v háji a ujede vám vlak. Pokud budete najednou nuceni přejít z útoku do obrany, může se vám klidně stát, že už po zbytek hry nebo aspoň na dlouho budete muset neustále ustupovat nebo pokulhávat za nepřítelem. Takže celou dobu balancujete mezi tím, abyste špatnou kartu odehráli pro vás co možná nejšetrnějším způsobem a naopak dobrou kartu odehráli co nejúčinněji a nevyplýtvali ji na nějakou blbost. Už od prvního kola budete v napětí, zda vás protivník (AI nebo cizí hráč) nevyklepne nějakým ukrutným způsobem nebo zda si hru sami nějakým nedopatřením nepohnojíte sami. Herní mechanismy jsou perfektně vybalancované, využijete do mrtě všechno, co hra nabízí (k dokonalosti snad chybí pouze to, že hra nenabízí herní variantu, kdy DEFCON omezuje pouze převraty/coup, avšak nikoli změnu orientace/realignment - po vzoru deskové hry - souboje by tak byly ke konci hry ještě dramatičtější). Počítačová verze hezky drží basu s deskovou verzí hry, nic zde nechybí, karty jsou némlich stejné, herní pravidla taktéž, a ke všemu je hra oproti deskové verzi svižnější, když všechno počítání za vás dělá počítač, a lépe chráněná vůči lidskému faktoru - tj. proti fikslování zkušenějších hráčů nebo zapomínání pravidel. Jediná, byť podstatná vada na kráse je absentující podpora více jazyků. Desková verze se ve světě jistě dočkala širší oblíbenosti a určitě byla přeložena do několika světových jazyků, takže by překlad počítačové verze s odkazem na papírová pravidla deskových verzí jistě nezabral tolik času jako u jiných počítačových her, které v deskových hrách předlohu nemají. Vytvořit amatérský překlad by byl zřejmě nadlidský úkol, protože herní data jsou hard-kódovaná v Unity, což je jedno velké bohužel, jinak by už byl překlad dávno na světě. Pro hráče, který do styku se Studenou válkou, nebo chcete-li Twilight Struggle, přijde nejprve elektronicky, bez toho aniž by si nejprve osahal deskovou verzi a bez toho, aby mu nějaký zkušenější hráč podrobně vysvětlil, se může hravě stát, že na hru rezignuje hned po pár tazích, zvlášť pokud musí luštit pravidla v angličtině. Počítač, natožpak lidský hráč z masa a kostí, je totiž dosti nevybíravý a nenechá si nic líbit. Ať už tak budete hrát hru sami jen proti počítači anebo s kamarády, vemte si na to raději dovolenou, protože se vám může stát, že u jediné partie prosedíte i celý večer. Celkově hodnotím 9/10, kdy strhávám jeden bod za to, že herní data nejsou přívětivá k vytváření amatérských modifikací, díky nimž by bylo možné hru přeložit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098282099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1710652496}
review: 回想起了我的大学时代，没有课的下午在走廊支起桌子，迎着温暖但不炎热的初夏微风展开版图，与三五好友举棋对弈各式兵棋。当时大家血气方刚，虽不知前路却相信自己具有无限的可能性，自是意气风发，落子之间仿佛我们真的是在执掌苏联和美国、指挥德军和盟军、真的是那凯撒投出命运的骰子。

review:
The board game itself is pretty decent. The digital version sometimes freezes between turns for up to 30 sec on my Macbook Pro 2020. Come on, should I play a [i]board game[/i] via GeForce Now? 

Also, AI behaves weirdly: sometimes plays on an OK level and right after that commits suicide by decreasing DEFCON to 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198865230207', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1686421199}
review:
作为一款长年霸榜BGG榜一的桌游，TS在可玩性、策略性上的表现确实非常稳健。玩法制作精良、题材引人入胜，作为一款以冷战为主题的游戏，确实也将玩法和题材结合得很好。占区、控核、军备、航天……以区域控制为主要的博弈点，依靠各种国际事件的卡牌为自己创造优势，既考验大局观又考验临时应变能力，很有运筹帷幄的感觉。

TS的内核和棋类或者说具体点和围棋有几分相似之处，核心玩法都是对区域争夺攻防的“区控圈地”，若将整个世界看成一张棋盘，那欧亚是角，中东美州是边，非洲等算是草肚皮。先手的苏方拥有主动进攻权，以自身的先手效率抢夺战区巩固战力铺开战法，而后手的美方则需紧紧咬住，做好防守和跟随工作，尽量遍地开花，寻找合适时期突入。许多关键卡牌的使用策略和一些重要区域的争夺攻防都可以做很多文章。同时运气成分存在但可控，既能一定程度改变战局调整每局游戏的不同体验，又不至于让玩家依赖随机性，使游戏变数更多样，游玩过程更刺激。

不过不得不提的是，游戏的入门门槛还是相对过高。在规则较为复杂、版图卡面需要时间熟悉的情况下，依然还有许多需要学习成本的地方。比如对关键事件的记忆，对一些强反制或滚雪球手段的预警和防备，对一些地区形势的判断，都需要在已经深刻了解游戏规则的情况下继续深入研究，这些不了解的话很难随便玩玩图一乐。同时双人对抗的模式还是比较容易滚雪球，虽然是跑分游戏，但大半的场合都是以一方领先20VP取胜，打到终局不易，从而很难让新玩家在学习游戏的过程中有逐步“变强”的乐趣。不过入门门槛问题也算是策略游戏的通病了，反正电子版游戏也不贵，感兴趣的朋友还是可以尝试尝试。

author: {'steamid': '76561199042503937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24129, 'last_played': 1699767543}
review:
The best 2 person board game out there.  The variety of play mechanisms within the game to the depth of strategy allows this game to stay fresh.  AI is a great learning tool, but does get a little predictive in it's patterns and doesn't use cards to their full potential.  

Pretty much a 1:1 match for the board game.  The digitalizing of the game makes it a lot easier to digest all the elements needed for strategy, especially the scoreboard for each region at a glance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122337593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1685661742}
review:
Para quem nunca jogou a versão física como eu, Twilight Struggle exige alguma dedicação nas primeiras horas. Tem um tutorial básico e textos, mas é daqueles jogos que se aprende a jogar. Inicialmente foi difícil suportar a interface, porque tem um mau design. Com o tempo, torna-se aceitável.
 É um jogo de cartas, e controlando os Estados Unidos da América ou a União Soviética, vamos influenciar os outros países, provocar golpes de estado e até dar origem a uma guerra nuclear. Ótimo para quem gosta de história e não é aborrecido, as descrições nas cartas são simples e claras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055928533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1683586131}
review: Always wondered about this game since I love government struggle and espionage games.  Finally bought it.  Played one game and asked for a refund.  It's more numbers than strategy and is not very realistic with actual international struggling.  If you like espionage and government stuff I would try Illuminati or CIA vs. KGB.  Those allow you a lot more control over your plays and what you want to happen.  This game feels like A LOT of control and direct action is taken away.  Again, plays more like a numbers game, sans real strategy.  Very disappointed because people told me that it mirrored government struggle.  Not, it doesn't...trust me.  The packaging makes it look like a real cold war/spy strategy board, but that's only the image.  The game play does not reflect true strategy when it comes to international affairs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148752979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1682, 'last_played': 1682930109}
review:
我愿称之为最强地缘政治桌游。实体版买了两分电子版也入了一份。
规则较为复杂但理解之后会发现魅力无穷。
可惜以前一起玩的朋友都离开了，现在只能虐虐AI。
别太纠结那些说运气占主导成分的评论，当你熟悉规则后开局让分AI 10VP都能在late game之前就获胜。

author: {'steamid': '76561199223577888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 97191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2763, 'playtime_at_review': 4679, 'last_played': 1712443749}
review:
Hi,

I was a backer of the collectors edition of Twilight Struggle back in 2014. In that campain they also offered a digital version to be played on CPUs/laptops, pads and cell phones (the later (cell phones) was never fullfilled). 
I think this digital implementation of TS does it really well. It also, like all digital boardgames, helps you not to forget any rules. However, if you are a beginner of this game it is a really good idea to read some strategic giude lines before playing online with real people (there is a good e-book that you can download for free or be nice and give the auther a small donation, [url=store.steampowered.com]https://twilightstrategy.com[/url]).
To learn the game you can play agains the AI but it's making a lot of strange moves that a fairly good player would not. A player who knows  the initional setup and strategies will be a too hard opponant but luckly they have a raiting system so you can play with people at your on level.
IMHO this is a really good boardgame that works very well in a digital enviroment. The theme is high since you feel very tensed about how your opponant will react to your move or what he/she has up there sleeve. Since the game is turned based you have to wait before the opponant makes there move and that wait is thrilling and tensed just like the times during the cold war.

Enjoy
Set Jonasson

author: {'steamid': '76561198123287165', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1679690521}
review: Twilight Struggle¿A quién no le gustan los juegos de cartas? A algunos les gusta que son rápidos, a otros les agrada la estrategia y a algunos más les gusta crear mazos específicos y ver qué estrategias existen con ese mazo. Yu-Gi-Oh, Magic: The Gathering, Pokemón y muchos otros juegos tiene versiones físicas y digitales que ofrecen horas y horas de diversión. Twilight Struggle. No hace eso.Twilight Struggle es un juego de mesa físico (eso ni yo lo sabía) y la idea es sencilla de entender: eres una potencia (USA o Rusia) y el mundo es tu tablero. Consigue punto de influencia en los países del tablero y derrota a tu oponente. Eso es fácil de entender como concepto y estrategia. Usa cartas basadas en hechos reales para obtener esas ventajas y hacer que el oponente pierda influencia y poder y por lo tanto el juego. Eso también es sencillo de entender y comprender.Sí, bueno, Twilight Struggle manda al carajo ese concepto sencillo y en su lugar te da un juego LENTO y extremadamente denso y tedioso para jugar. Jugas por turnos PERO tu oponente controlado por el CPU se va a demorar en tomar una acción y va a usar estrategias que ni vienen en el tutorial. ¿Quieres jugar con otros humanos? Agárrate, te van a masacrar o se van a tardar horas en tomar una acción. Esas son tus dos opciones en este juego.No sé por qué alguien quisiera jugar Twilight Struggle cuando hay opciones mejores en el formato digital (MTGA: Arena, YGO: Duel Links, Faeria) en términos de diversión y estrategia. Aquí ni siquiera puedes armar un mazo y todas las manos que obtienes es RNG. “Bueno, pero está basado en un juego real ¿Cuánto puedes cambiar un juego sin perder su esencia?”. Existen juegos físicos cuya versión digital mejora o cambia las partes lentas (o las acelera lo suficiente) para que se sientan como un juego dinámico y divertido. Twilight Struggle trata de ser tan fiel que se vuelve lento y aburrido.No sé cómo describir Twilight Struggle; es un juego de mesa que ahora es un juego para PC que conserva, lo que supongo es, la esencia original del juego físico: lento y tedioso. En ese sentido es notable. Las imágenes de las cartas también son destacables aunque al ser fotografías reales es difícil hacer un mal trabajo en ese aspecto. El sonido es lo que se podría esperar de un juego de mesa: sonidos que tratar de imitar las acciones en pantalla pero muy lejos de lo que han logrado otros jugos digitales.Si quieres un juego de mesa con cartas pero bueno juega Faeria, MTG: arena o Wingspan. Evita tirar tu dinero en algo que jugarás 40 minutos y no te dará ni diversión, ni entretenimiento.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977525240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 13658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13555, 'last_played': 1685912505}
review: Where do I begin. The implementation of the board game is spot on. It takes a while to get everything right, but then anyone wanting to play Twilight Struggle isn't averse to some learning. The board game itself, well, it wasn't NO. 1 on Boardgamegeek for years for no reason. It is exquisitely elegant and can easily be called the king of all asymmetrical 2-player board games. The balance simply never ceases to amaze as well as the amazingly implemented flavour. The game exudes the feel of the Cold War. You can simply smell the leather camera case and the valve radio. It is a monument to board game design, expertly implemented by Playdek.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358737540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1676808009}
review:
游戏通过经典桌游移植到PC端，机制和内容是非常优秀的，但是以下【4】点的体验异常糟糕：
1、需要自己网上找补丁才能用中文游玩，对中国玩家始乱终弃、背信弃义（众筹承诺问题）；
2、规则阐释存在歧义，通过线下桌游玩耍时，玩家们可以商议规则达成一致。但是通过电脑来玩，就是AI单方面指定规则；
3、缺少SL的机制，因为第2点的存在，AI对玩家（特别是新手玩家与自己解读规则的玩家）有着吊打级的优势，特别是在战争等级方面，可以一击必杀，之前的游玩直接付之东流。但这个原因，仅仅是因为规则阐释有歧义；
4、既然已经是电脑游戏了，AI出牌还需要让玩家等待若干秒，浪费时间。至少应当出一个机制，调整AI的等待期限，每次等AI出牌都是一种煎熬。
综上所述，不推荐通过STEAM购买这款游戏，但是线下桌游还是可以的（就是时间比较久）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198083873258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8843, 'last_played': 1709800623}
review:
This game is simply amazing.
It's a great way to learn the board game, and find new opponents online. The AI isn't too bad for newer players to face, either.

If you're interested in the cold war, and/or would like to learn more about it, play this.
If you like pathing and map control strategy board (as well as card) games, play this.
If you want something different from generic military conquest games, such as Risk and Axis & Allies, just play this game.

With the constant looming threat of nuclear war, and risk of losing influence in key regions, tensions run high in this game of various possible outcomes.

The computer version makes a complex board game much easier to learn, and to follow the detailed turns.
The music and sound bites even effectively add to the game's images/mood/events/figures of the cold war (if you can handle hearing annoying JFK & Reagan quotes).

Neither side is depicted as the hero in this honest & fun strategy masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008966217', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1704843399}
review: The presentation is pretty clunky and confusing for folks who aren't familiar with the board game version - albeit one big plus to the digital version is getting to easily see the degree of control over any region easily without doing the calculating yourself.  The strategy requires knowing the deck well, so it takes time to get good at the game, but every turn is tense, every match is thrilling.

author: {'steamid': '76561199443370137', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1675772462}
review:
TS是一款非常好玩，和你的人生非常相似的游戏：
1、对手摇6你摇1，好像你那运气垃圾的人生
2、选美国却拿到一手苏联牌，好像你那条件低劣，只能殚精竭虑去卷仍然落选的人生
3、从第2回合开始你就会卡在核2，好像你那矛盾重重一触即发的家庭生活
4、双方轮番打出中国牌，乌苏里江、文革、尼克松，你就好像那张中国牌，只是一个被利用的工具
5、在核二打出对面的中情局、枪手，就好像撑死海豹的最后一条深水鱼，你因为生活中OP1点的微小事物而崩溃
除此之外TS还有很多与人生相似之处，古言围棋如人生，我说人生如TS

author: {'steamid': '76561198135399611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 256, 'playtime_at_review': 1842, 'last_played': 1712263328}
review:
Magnifique version de ce jeu que j'adorais en version cartonnée. Je le conseille vivement.
Peu de bogues remarqués. Je regrette la différence de conditions pour accéder à la domination d'une région, par rapport à l'original cartonné.
Un seul point noir : qu'il ne soit pas possible de revenir en arrière, comme c'est le cas pour toute carte jouée par erreur, lorsque le fin fond d'une carte (y compris celle de la réponse de l'IA !) nous envoie en DEFCON1 et fait perdre la partie. La moitié de mes échecs s'expliquent ainsi, même dans des parties où je pouvais encore l'emporter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271429712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6956, 'last_played': 1691114936}

author: {'steamid': '76561198119145040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3159, 'last_played': 1706821410}
review:
This is a great game.  The board game is fun, though you have to be this type of turn based strategy type of game player.  Used to play this while deployed (board game), but really learned to play it with this game.  Lots of replayability, and is super well balanced with history (strong Soviets in the early game, strong US in the later).   For 10 bucks, I recommend getting it and learning one of the highest rated board game for years.  
Would love to see Imperial Struggle get developed, which is the "Spiritual successor" to TS according to Dice Tower Reviews.

review:
Однозначно рекомендую эту игру! 
Особенно тем, кто уже знаком с настолкой.
Цифровая версия берет на себя рутинный подсчет очков, держит в уме очки военных операций (что часто забывается нами в оригинальной игре) и дает при этом удобный интерфейс и атмосферный антураж.

author: {'steamid': '76561198351534292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 43945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 250, 'playtime_at_review': 40608, 'last_played': 1712397736}
review:
经典的卡牌推动桌游，背景为波谲云诡的冷战年代，玩家分别执美苏一方，通过手牌中以各种冷战时期重大事件命名的卡牌，以世界为棋盘，去战胜对方理念的王道征途游戏（确信）
如果你是萌新，可以往下看：
1、切勿对游戏内容中某些真实事件的具体效果，或者地图内容过分深究，毕竟这也是一个充满了美式刻板印象的游戏
2、游戏的运气成分占比很大，但是依旧存在策略，如果你是新手，推荐可以从苏联上手，毕竟苏联阵营在早期运气较好的情况下可以打出很大游戏结束游戏
3、游戏目前没有汉化，而且规则相当繁杂，推荐新手首先阅读过相关规则再进行游戏
4、作为卡牌推动的桌游，想要玩好的话，把所有牌背完才是入门，加油吧
5、中国玩家太强辣，不想打的太累的话千万别打疑似国人的玩家XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198997226636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1708069150}
review:
非常不错的一款桌游，可以和另一个好友一起体验休闲时光，各种权谋战略来赢得一场角逐的胜利。如果说二战是三国杀（轴心，同盟，共产国际），那冷战更似楚汉争霸，以日月星辰为经，以山川河流为纬，天下列国为棋，体验世事沧桑。所有国家都拼命相当棋手，但最终大多数都沦为了棋子。
治乱兴亡恍如梦,世事真若一局棋。

author: {'steamid': '76561198048321126', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1670172716}
review:
Twilight Struggle is a very entertaining game. It works best as a strategic experiential game. While there are deep strategic decisions to make, it's also a very dramatic game. It often hinges on dice rolls, and if you aren't into that, then this game will drive you crazy. But the Cold War atmosphere is palpable. This game is thick with paranoia and suspicion, and it does a great job at putting you in the mindset of the Cold War.

The app itself is...alright. It never feels truly pleasant to play, but it works well enough. Perhaps its best feature is how easily it lets you switch between multiple ongoing games. So as an implementation of a board game, it's pretty good. As a design it's quite impressive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006416400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'playtime_at_review': 1803, 'last_played': 1711727896}
review:
Faithful port of the board game. 

I like the interface one of the better ones I've seen for ease of play. 

AI for offline play too so well worth the buy. 

If you don't know twighlight struggle check it out its a great head to head game of board control where players take on the mantle of cold war super powers US/USSR and vie for world domination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196544039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1403, 'last_played': 1710285397}
review: Grain Sales Vs ABM Treaty in the headline phase. Russians coup Pakistan with ABM. Grain sales picks up Defectors. Played as an event at once. Nothing happened. ABM Treaty was not cancelled!!! I don't think the wording is followed right on Norad Vs Quagmire. It says that Quag cancels Norad, not that it prevents it being played. If it hasn't been played yet it could be after without being cancelled (as Quag has been played out). Well maybe that is English being more than one language, but the first one is definitely a thing. I love the board game, but this overdoes the klaxons and has cancel buttons when clicking the info window confirms that you have read it better. The play your Scoring card warning is a turn early, except when you get eight turns, then it is two turns too early. How about a you haven't coup-ed yet warning?  The AI does some weird moves that leave it open in obvious ways. Maybe have a difficulty setting on that? A hard mode might help you prepare for the vicious world of TS online.

review: This game is not fun (imo). It feels as if the opponent (AI) constantly has the perfect card, and has the ability to read your hand, while you're left with bad cards that often help the opponent more than yourself. There is no difficulty for the A.I., so people like myself always face the strongest version of the game. Admittably, there's the possibility to handicap one side. The A.I.'s turns/decisions take way too long to be enjoyable. The UI could be improved as well, but isn't horrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561199130206630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9092, 'last_played': 1708271238}
review: This is such a fantastic adaptation of the board game. It's tug of war, back and forth game play and tension from the constant threat of looming nuclear armageddon provides an outstanding simulation of the Cold War that really captures the feeling of the era. I love the design, theme, game mechanics...absolutely everything. The game is also very affordable for all that you get (even if you pay additional for the turn zero/promo cards expansion). It has an excellent tutorial and is not too difficult to learn, but the strategies are complex enough that it never gets boring. It's also one of the few online strategy board games that has an excellent AI that actually challenges you. If you want to play against a human opponent, the game is popular enough that it's never difficult finding someone to play against. I honestly prefer this to the tabletop version, because it takes no time to set up and all coup/alignment rolls are instantly calculated, which saves a TON of time and shortens the length of games compared to tabletop. I cannot recommend this game enough--especially if you are interested in the Cold War and historical-themed board games!

Q:如何安装汉化补丁？

review:
A great one. I play with AI for 2 or 3 times to understand the rules, and maybe over 10 times to know the effect of all cards. 
The rules may be a little bit hard. Whatever? When u r familiar with all the cards (or only early-war cards), it will be easy for u to defeat AI.
When u r sure u can beat down AI at any condition, just play online with other players. That will be a lot of fun.

If u r interested with the history of COLD WAR,  try it, and u wont regret.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339412664', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1682525608}
review:
作为PC游戏的Twilight Struggle：牛逼！电子化以后规避了冷战热斗最大的缺点：set时间长，配件繁多，数值显示不明晰，操作繁琐，可以说这个游戏作为电子游戏比作为桌游合适得多。新手教程简练清晰，非常准确地概括了原来几十页规则书才能讲清楚的东西，一遍就能学会。界面UI好看，背景音乐氛围感合适，足见制作人对这款游戏的用心程度。

作为桌游的冷战热斗：几十页的规则书只带来了满满的堆砌感，虽然机制很多，但作为德式桌游却并不能多线发展，因为实质上只有地区影响力这一个核心机制，地区影响力落后的话其他数值都缺乏意义。运气成分大于策略成分，发牌员给你发到什么牌（尤其是发到什么地区的记分卡）会对局势有很大的影响，光靠运营很难扭转过来。局部战争、太空竞赛、改变阵营这些掷骰行动更是血压高，玩了几次后会下意识地规避掷骰行动。但是优点也很显著，就是背景代入感极好，背景故事极为考究，每一张手牌都有具体的事件人物和非常恰如其分的效果，玩起来真的完全有处于冷战一方的体验感。数值设定比较平衡，双方的赢面确实旗鼓相当。

author: {'steamid': '76561198003429146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1561518154}
review:
Twilight Struggle is a good implementation of a great board game. Here are my thoughts on the actual game:

So, what's to like about this?

1) Tension! This game has it in spades.

2) Low set-up breakdown time

3) A low amount of downtime between players turns

What is this game? Some would argue that it's a war game, however, the fact that it has VP some VP's are awarded through area majority some would say this is a euro. Who cares what it is, just play the game and see if you enjoy it.

Let's talk about the games card driven mechanism since it's the heart of the game. Throughout each turn of the game (there are a maximum of 10) each player will have 8 - 9 cards and will be required play the majority of them. Each non-scoring card will be associated with you, your opponent, or it will be neutral. When you play a card, it can be done as either an event or used for it's point value. So, why would you play cards associated with your opponent as an event? Well, you wouldn't in normal circumstances, but the rules state that when you play cards associated with your opponent for the point value, the event will trigger regardless. Some events when triggered will be removed from the game permanently. This makes things very tricky. So how do you get out of playing nasty opponent events that are in your hand? You can typically carry one card into the next round and once (sometimes twice per round) you can chuck a card towards the space race to avoid opponents events triggering but this means that your opponent might get it when the discard pile gets shuffled to become the new deck. So, players will be forced to decide what to play, how to play, what to get rid of and what to hold. Tension!

Out of the box there is a definite USSR bias especially in the first 1 - 4 turns but there are a few variants to try and negate it. If you want to have a satisfying Twilight Struggle experience, I would recommend using the optional cards and the Chinese Civil War variant for the first 10 or so games. After that, the optional cards alone should be a sufficient once the American learning curve has been completed.

So what would I say is the games weakness? Well, the dice makes me feel as if luck can heavily swing the results of a game. There is a fair amount of die rolling and while it does create tension sometimes it can be annoying when you roll high on the space race and low on everything else. For once the die rolling randomness is less of an issue to me than the card randomness, and that's because inciting a die roll can have ulterior motives (ie lowering defcon, chucking unwanted cards to the space race, increasing required military ops) than simply trying to get the result of a good die roll.

Speaking of the cards there definitely seems to be a lot of luck in who get's what cards. Particularly the scoring cards. Who draws what scoring card, in what order and based on the current board position can have a huge effect on the outcome of the game. While there is randomness in the dice and cards it doesn't detract from having a highly engaging confrontational experience.

I no longer own it as I'd much rather play online via Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969480462', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 3131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3104, 'last_played': 1682544931}
review:
An amazing game of strategy and luck! Winning, especially as the US, is gratifying! It's a slower-paced game (Turn your animations to "FAST" in the option menu, you'll thank me later) but it is cerebral.

I'd recommend it in a heart beat to anyone who likes card based games and even to those who haven't tried that type of game before but have a historical interest in the time period (like myself!).

There are bugs in the base game--but not too many and they don't crop up often. 

However, I'd steer clear of the DLC, Turn Zero. I liked it at first (and it has a little upside on its own merits) when I bought it with its base-game. But, I didn't have any knowledge of TS's game design or flow, I didn't even know the game existed in real life. Ultimately for me, the DLC purchase was a mistake and I don't use the cards anymore.

If you want to try it out, Turn Zero can spice up the game play in some ways, but there are some major issues the DLC introduces in terms of unbalancing the game with certain cards. 

It also introduces major bugs that cause card-based conditions to be ignored. This makes them both useless and in fact detrimental to the player they are meant to help--or helpful to the player they are meant to parry.

All in all grab the base game, even at full price, it's more than worth it. Skip the DLC and save your money for something better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082301592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1651637034}
review: Contains the most merciless AI on Steam. It either card counts, knows what you are holding, or works out and guesses the probability of which region scoring cards you are holding and must play. I get dealt a region scoring card where I am holding the lead and then every chance it gets the AI floods that region, knowing full well I have to play the scoring card or lose. Getting annihilated every game makes this the most un-fun I have purchased on steam. The ONLY benefit is that you get to see how the rules work. But it is depressing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995521894', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 3434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 33, 'playtime_at_review': 1638, 'last_played': 1712423407}
review:
Overall a great PC port of one the best (if not THE best) boardgame of all time. 

There are some minor bugs (only noticeable if you're a Twilight Struggle fanatic) and some inconsistencies in Late War scenario (but this does not affect core gameplay or main scenario)

Online play is very much alive.

On the game itself - oh boy. Lead either US or USSR in a proxy war-espionage-influence race throughout the entire Cold War, with the nuclear armageddon threat looming in the background.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255596335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1650626656}
review:
I don't know what all this fanboy BS is about this game, but it's one of the worst experiences playing a board game I have ever had. You might as well just go into an alley and throw dice against the wall with someone who cheats, then shoots you for drug money. The AI rolls fives and sixes, there's no real tutorial, and the scoring makes no sense. I have dominated a region, presence everywhere, battlegrounds in my favor, twice the presence of the opposition, and when it's time to score that region... 6-0 in their favor.

I've read the rules several times, watched unhelpful videos, and all this game has given me for my money is the feeling that I'm stupid. I've been playing Euro board games for years. 

F*** this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971423945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 33900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 82, 'playtime_at_review': 24025, 'last_played': 1711393465}
review:
So at first I was frustrated with the game as I could not get my mind behind the mechanics and how they are meant to work.

This is a card game, a board game, a dice game and a deck builder at once.
Events, that are negative for your side, will happen and have to be played at some point. You need to find an opportunity to play them for minimal negative effect. Got a card that makes your opponent stronger for the whole turn? Play it last!
Dice rolls can turn out bad for you. Several times in a row. Such are dice. Do not depend on good outcomes.
Unused events go back to the deck. Try to trigger unique opponent events in harmless contexts to eliminate them from the game.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198036187691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1669467971}
review:
멀티는 아직 못 해봤는데 AI가 가끔 아쉬운 부분이 보이는 것 빼고는 괜찮다. 그나마도 게임을 배우는 단계에서는 쉽게 알아차리지 못할 정도다. AI가 잘못한 부분 하나하나 지적할 수 있는 정도가 된다면 멀티를 돌리지 않을까 싶다.

게임이 자동으로 해주는 부분이 많다 보니 현실에서 보드게임으로 해봤을 때 보다 귀찮음이 덜하고 배우는 속도도 빨랐던 것 같다. 황혼의 투쟁이 명작 보드게임이라 하던데 배우기 귀찮다던가 같이 할 사람을 찾기 어렵다던가 하는 이유로 미뤄놓았다면 이 게임으로 시작해 보아도 좋은 것 같다.

포럼 보니까 버그 몇 개 있다던 것 같은데, 이것도 개인적으로 마주친 적 없다.

review: És Twilight Struggle, amb tot el que això comporta. Trobo a faltar més opcions en el online a nivell organitzatiu, poder tenir lligues, tornejos, etc. Podria estar millor implementat. author: {'steamid': '76561198859599796', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1575905059}
review:
Twilight Struggle is one of the most highly-rated board games of all time and I wanted to try it out.  I only played a couple of games, this game is loooong, but the game here absolutely served the purpose of letting me test how the game plays as a board game.

If you like the idea of Twilight Struggle the board game and want to play it on computer, this will do it!

review: I don't know what's happened, but the game has become completely unplayable for me.  It had always been rock solid, but now it just doesn't work.  I've gone so far as to completely uninstall and reinstall, and the problems persist.  You can't scroll on menus like options, when you get into the game, the card movements are dog slow and when the cards leave the board area, they form that trailing shadow graphic problem, turns aren't resolving, etc.  None of these problems existed when I last loaded this game up about 8 months ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060357763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1672615476}
review:
Twilight Struggle es uno de los mejores juegos de mesa de la historia pero es que  ahora encima está también en Steam y hace probablemente aun más fácil el aprender a jugar y te permite jugar en un momento sin tener que montar nada. La versión de Steam esta super bien hecha; no es de esas cutres como en otros juegos.

En cuanto al juego en sí os diré que muy pocos juegos tienen la profundidad y tensión que tiene Twilight Struggle. Cada decisión que tomas puede ser la diferencia entre ganar o perder, ya que tendrás que jugar cartas sí o sí que beneficiarán a tu enemigo, así que cuándo jugarlas y cuándo aguantar el golpe es vital. Es un juego que te mantiene en tensión todo el rato y aunque está lleno de sutilezas y jugadas, un novato puede jugar perfectamente, es solo que tiene ese efecto ajedrez de "fácil de jugar, difícil de volverte un maestro".   

Si lo tenéis en vuestro radar pillaoslo. Es super temático y no os defraudará. Es un auténtico pepino.

Si queréis saber algo más echadle un vistazo a este vídeo que deja muy claro como se siente el juego: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R3ZtsbDKA_w

author: {'steamid': '76561198087290909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1709143214}

review: Not implemented with new (to the game) players in mind. author: {'steamid': '76561198351112375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1422, 'last_played': 1641126374}
review:
Fun adaption of a board game I don't know. There is a good deal of luck involved because the actions you may take each turn are drawn from a pile of cards and the result of many actions are also randomly determined by dice. The inbuilt handbook does a fine job of explaining the game and there is a small tutorial to get you started. In the beginning the computer opponent is tough, but after having a few games under your belt it is easy to win. The game knows a few different gameplay options which change the game, but not drastically. 

This is a fun game to waste away a few hours and play with a friend online. It also runs flawlessly on GNU/Linux' Steam Client. Recommended if you like board games.

EDIT: I noticed that while playing the Late War option the War Games event counts as a win for the USSR, regardless of actual score.

review: It's a faithful adaptation of the board game.  Unfortunately when playing online you can't take back anything so unless you know the game very well many games will be ruined by some minor detail you missed.  On top of that the game has some elements of randomness (e.g. realignment rolls, quagmire/bear trap) that allow for unfortunate chance-based swings.  All that said, once you learn every card and are familiar with their potential implications there is still a solid amount of strategizing around best usage of the cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105958673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3631, 'last_played': 1693870393}
review: Very good adaptation of the board game.  I'm somewhat of a novice to this game (have probably played 20-30 times over a 15 year stretch.  But the AI seems challenging enough to be respectable.  It's nice to have the computer to use for upkeep of special card/board conditions that can be easy to miss on the table.  Only complaint I have at all is that some of the rules in the help tab are incomplete and I've had to look at a pdf to see the rest of the rules when I've forgotten them.  But the tutorial is thorough and complete from what I can tell.  I've only played against the AI so can't say anything about what it's like in the multiplayer.   As for the game itself.  It is a classic and one of the best designed games I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245170266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2322, 'last_played': 1698362556}
review:
Twilight Struggle is one of the best tabletop games of all time, and this e-version is exceedingly well-done. 

I have had ongoing games against a friend for the past two years, with each of us taking one or two moves per day. It's a constant presence in my life, in this way, and one that I am continually learning from and about. In this sense, it reminds me a bit of the ancient game of Go -- seemingly endless depth is generated by a deceptively simple rule-set. Playing it eventually becomes a way of life, or at least a delicious ingredient of a life well lived.

If I had to wipe my HDD of all but a handful of titles, this one would easily, automatically, make the cut.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089772477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1605656981}
review:
Según tengo entendido, cuando este juego fue a salir, se dijo que si se llegaba a un número especifico de ventas, se realizaría la traducción del juego al español. Hasta donde se, se supero el número de ventas requeridas, pero jamas llegaron a realizar la traducción del juego. Me da mucha rabia tener este juegazo en mi biblioteca y no poder jugarlo por que no esta traducido.

No soy de poner mala nota a un juego por no estar en mi idioma, ya que la empresa que lo publica no tiene la obligación de traducirlo a mi idioma, pero en este caso ellos dieron su palabra  y no han cumplido. Nos han engañado y como tal expreso mi descontento con dicho producto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070338870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2917, 'last_played': 1710057263}
review:
As a strategy, history and a board game lover, I'm thankful to have found this game a few of years back and have been delving back into again over the last year.

It's a relatively simple game to pick up but still manages to be quite deep in terms of strategy. 

The concept of a card driven game where you are dealt your own cards, neutral cards and your opponents into your hand and having to play the cards at the correct time to minimise your opponents events is a cool mechanic that showcases the tension of the cold war very well.

Also luckily for me, I have been playing this game so much that my girlfriend has taken notice and purchased me a physical copy of the game for my birthday as well.

I would recommend this game for history lovers, board game lovers and general strategy game lovers. It's makes for a cool time to spend a spare couple of hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190447078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1703276356}
review: I might be possibly misunderstanding the game rules since I just starting playing recently, but why do I always lose the game whenever the AI does a coup in a battleground country  that subsequently lowers the defcon to 1 after I use a card that gives the opponent ops values (and I even get a defcon warning from the game before I play the card)? For example, I am the USSR and I play the CIA card for influence, which also gives the USA AI a free 1 op value to use, but before I play the card I get a defcon warning before committing to the decision, and after I do so, the AI does the stupid decision of launching a coup in a battleground country while at defcon 2, but when it lowers to 1, I somehow lose the game??? Shouldn't it be the AI, since it was the one that caused the defcon to lower to 1 in the first place? It's really frustrating because sometimes I am winning and all of a sudden I lose because the stupid AI lowers the defcon to 1 from using the events of a card that I played like the CIA card. There's also other problems with the AI being silly (like using Indo-Pakistan card when there's zero influence in both countries, or even playing the opponent's cards in the headline round). Overall, I would not recommend playing against the AI, but at least the quality of players online are significantly better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385861283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1664009595}
review:
和朋友完了实体，不过瘾来玩电脑，真的代入感很强，激情澎湃好不好！但是，但是，我严重怀疑电脑开挂了！！
我玩了两把人机对战，第一把，中期的一个回合，电脑发动了Bear Trap，于是我连续掷了5次5点，五次！！都是五！！！白白扔了5张牌。而且剩下的牌也不满足要求，甚至一回合啥也没干，于是人机VP拉满，直接给我干爆。
第二把，头条阶段，人机没有发动Bear Trap，但是我下一回合直接控制了欧洲，手中有一张欧洲记分牌，正当我以为我赢了的时候。人机发动了Bear Trap，我本以为上次是偶然，好的，这次我又掷了4次5。每一次！每一次！都是五！？？？！！该死的五！！
于是我又是三个轮次没有做任何事，由于争夺欧洲，其他地区我较为疲弱，被人机VP一波拉满。
我觉得和电脑对战Bear Trap的效果改成————获得游戏胜利。这样就简单理解多了！(╯‵□′)╯︵┻━┻

author: {'steamid': '76561198372532413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1703324740}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993386596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1353, 'last_played': 1623232320}
review:
It's a digital recreation of the highly regarded 2 player strategy board game. Apparently this was the designers first published game which is very impressive that they were able to create such a focused & fun game out of such a complex subject. The gameplay seems complicated at first but is quite simple once you learn the rules. Basically you take turns playing cards over a number of rounds. These can play for your benefit or if you play an opponent event their benefit. The game becomes a puzzle of trying to control the regions of the world while not giving your opponent an advantage with card events.
The game is able to touch on many of the aspects of the cold war period without getting bogged down in minutiae. The space race, thermonuclear war, proxy wars, domino theory, region stability and all the card events are all here and make this an engaging history lesson as well as a great strategy game.
As a PC port this is obviously a small budget game with a design that serves for tablets and touch screen devices. The lack of hotkeys, in game options or flashy effects are disappointing but understandable. The single player AI is good practise but can't be configured. The online options are good but games can take 1 to 2 hours so it's something for the dedicated or to organise with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018428432', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1682293630}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066235686', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1662980689}
review: An outstanding adaptation of the boardgame. The AI doesn't hold up well against experienced players, but it's good for practice and learning the game. The community is mostly nice from what I've encountered, which I'm grateful of. I'd recommend reading the external manual that comes with this game, as I think it does a far better job of teaching the mechanics than the tutorial does on it's own, although the tutorial does do a good job at getting you used to the gamespace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055431078', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1666624156}
review:
"Сумеречная Борьба" занимает 11 место среди настольных игр в рейтинге крупнейшего тематического сайта BGG на данный момент, что говорит о высочайшей реиграбельности и глубине геймплея. Игра посвящена геополитичеcкому противостоянию США и СССР во времена "Холодной Войны". Задача игрока - в течение 10 ходов набрать 20 победных очков раньше противника, либо заставить его начать атомную войну. В случае, если никому это сделать не удалось- проводится финальный подсчет очков после 10 хода, кто набрал больше - тот и побеждает.
Каждый ход игроки разыгрывают карты с руки, распространяя свое влияние, совершая военные перевороты, продвигаясь в космической гонке, переубеждая население в правоте своей идеологии,  либо активируя различные исторические события. Примеры: корейская война, убийство Кеннеди, революция на Кубе, эскадроны смерти, берлинская стена и т.д. События бывают нейтральные, советские или американские. Отсюда вытекает главная "фишка" игры - умение правильно свести на нет эффект вражеских событий и извлечь максимум выгоды из своих.
В игре есть карты " подсчета очков", привязанные к определенным регионам которые необходимо разыграть в течение 1 хода. Они и приносят большинство победных очков. Умение заставить противника сыграть такую карту в нужный момент тоже является ключевым.
В начале игры СССР сильнее, но со временем инициатива переходит к США. Удастся ли вам изменить ход мировой истории зависит только от вас и совсем немного от удачи, потому что эффект некоторых событий проверяется с помощью кубиков. 
Реиграбельность огромная, ИИ - неплохой противник, цена смешная, по сравнению с настольной версией. Есть онлайн режим для игры против людей. Также рекомендую сразу брать дополнение " Нулевой Ход". которое меняет стартовые условия игры.
Разработчики обещают русскую локализацию, пока есть только английский язык.
Однозначно рекомендую!

review: If you dig tabletop games, this is one of the greatest of all time.  A deep strategy game that feels like a war of inches and carries the weight of history with each play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093181166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 63565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60686, 'last_played': 1652878198}
review: An excellent digital adaptation of the board game. I've been playing it IRL for years long before the desktop version came into being and this gets everything right - an intuitive interface and well-designed presentation of all the important stuff. And so handy to be able to just check the continent scoring instantly without having to squint at the board and work it out every time (though I am much faster at that now thanks to playing on here so much!), plus being able to quickly refer to discards and already-played events etc. to better strategise your card play. I've greatly enjoyed playing this, especially as I've had a shortage of friends IRL that know the game enough/are willing to learn it etc. so I've been able to play, practice and refine my technique without being reliant on having an in-person opponent available. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005391568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 2408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2087, 'last_played': 1680450029}
review:
Je me rends compte à l'instant que je n'ai pas encore évalué [b]Twilight Struggle[/b], sacrilège, car si vous aimez comme moi les jeux de plateau vous ne serez pas déçu par celui-ci.

[b]Twilight Struggle[/b] est un jeu de stratégie politique se déroulant pendant la guerre froide, vous y incarnerez donc un de ces deux blocs qui, ne pouvant se faire la guerre de façon frontale sous peine d'anihiler notre chère et douce planète, vont tenter de contrôler d'autre pays et ainsi étendre leur puissance à travers le globe, et notamment près de leur ennemis respectifs (salut amis Cubains et Vietnamiens!).

Le plateau de jeu sera donc la carte du monde, avec en bleu les pays détenus par les USA et en rouge les pays détenus par l'URSS.

Avant toute chose sachez que, une fois n'est pas coutume, le jeu n'est pas traduit en français, mais le niveau d'anglais demandé reste supportable, une fois les différentes cartes connues vous n'aurez aucun problème à vous repérer dans le jeu, d'autant qu'il n'est pas compliqué à comprendre.

Un tuto est assez bien fait, certes complètement en anglais, mais il aborde tout ce qu'il y a à connaitre.

Ce jeu ressemble à un autre jeu de plateau qui s'appelle [b]Precipice[/b], le but ici sera d'amasser 20 points de victoire le premier, cela notamment en contrôlant des blocs de pays (Moyen-Orient, Asie du sud-est, Amérique du sud...) et de jouer des cartes associées à ces blocs de pays au moment opportun.

Si un de vous contrôle entièrement l'Europe, c'est la victoire immédiate (reprenant ainsi les théories de sir H.J. Mackinder, considéré comme le père de la géopolitique et géostratégie moderne, qui disait "Qui contrôle l'Europe (de l'est) contrôle le monde").

Pour contrôler un bloc, il faut avant tout contrôler des pays sensibles, marqués par une bande rouge derrière leur nom.
Chaque pays a un facteur de stabilité, et pour les contrôler il faut placer de l'influence égale ou supérieure à ce nombre de stabilité, et si l'adversaire place lui aussi de l'influence il faut absolument le dépasser.
Ex: la France est un pays sensible de l'Europe de l'Ouest, il faut absolument le contrôler pour assoir votre domination en Europe. Il a une stabilité de 3.
Si je place 3 influences je gagne son contrôle, sauf si l'adversaire place lui aussi de l'influence, en ce cas je devrais avoir 3 plus ce que l'adversaire a placé.
Lorsque vous contrôlez un pays, l'adversaire devra placer 2 influences pour obtenir 1 point jusqu'à vous détrôner, ensuite 1 point vaut 1 point, ceci est à prendre en compte pour assurer vos arrières (toujours si je veux contrôler la France, mieux vaut mettre 4 ou 5 influence plutôt que les 3 demandés, ainsi pour m'égaler (valeur stabilité de 3) le joueur devra placer 5 influences si j'ai mis 4 ou 7 influences si j'ai mis 5).

A côté de cela vous recevez des cartes de jeu, dont certaines sont relatives aux USA, d'autres à l'URSS, et d'autres sont neutre. 
D'autres enfin sont des cartes de score (Europe, Moyen-orient...), qu'il faudra jouer absolument lors de vos 6 tours de jeu sous peine de perdre la partie (6 tours où chacun joue à tour de rôle).
Une des clés du jeu est de deviner si votre adversaire a en main ces cartes score, et tout faire pour contrôler le plus de pays de la zone concernée avant qu'il joue la carte score et obtienne ainsi peu de points, voir même vous donne des points si vous avez joué finement.

Les cartes du jeu ont un texte (effet), mais aussi une valeur de 1 à 4 (sauf cartes score), et cette valeur pourra être utilisée pour placer de l'influence, dans ce cas vous ne jouez pas la carte (texte) si elle vous appartient.
Si vous décidez de jouer le texte, vous ne placez alors pas l'influence égale à sa valeur.
Si elle appartient au bloc ennemi, là cela peut vous coûter cher car le joueur ennemi devra alors jouer la carte (tandis que vous ne pourrez que l'utiliser pour sa valeur).

La valeur des cartes permet également de faire des coups d'état et des réalignements qui sont parfois plus rentables pour détrôner un ennemi que placer de l'influence, mais les coups d'état sur des pays sensibles font chuter un countdown qui a 5 au départ, et qui une fois qu'il atteindraà 1 enclenchera alors la guerre nucléaire (partie perdue), les coups d'état sont donc à utiliser avec parcimonie, je vous renvoie au tuto pour savoir de quoi il s'agit, de toute façon in fine il s'agira toujours de contrôler des pays puis des blocs de pays.

L'IA se défend très bien, j'ai parfois du mal à la battre.
Il y a également un jeu en réseau, y a t il du monde, je ne peux vous le dire je n'y joue jamais comme ça.

Amis gamers je vous souhaite de bonnes parties avec ce bon jeu!
