author: {'steamid': '76561198025286003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1677718338}
review: This is not a condemnation of the game by any stretch, the devs just need to come back and clean the game up and maybe add some more tutorial or something to make the game easier to understand. I pretty much had to learn how to play from youtube videos since the actual games tutorial really did not do the best job explaining how the game really functions and how to really do better. This game is stupidly complex with a semi medium weight rule set. The digital version of this game will not actually teach you how to play with any candor required to play even a novice in person. Another thing which is minor, would be maybe a bit more music. I feel like it would add a lot to just get a few more 1960’s era cold war pieces to really flesh out the fell of this games war room as the world slowly becomes ever more tense. The art and graphics are bare bones which is fine for the most part, they function as intended but I feel some artistic flair could have helped sell the game a bit more since this is a digital version. Overall the board game is a great game, the digital version still feel fairly rough and needs some love.

author: {'steamid': '76561199030661438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1683760032}
review:
Un excelente juego de tablero para dos, con un sistema de cartas dinámico. Juego una yo, juegas otra tú, juego yo de nuevo, contratacas tú, no hay respiro. Hay que estar echando un ojo a cada zona geopolítica del tablero y tratar de leer qué se trama tu adversario para poder responder a tiempo. También hay que estar atento al nivel de DEFCON (no vaya a ser que por una mala decisión se desate la catástrofe nuclear) y no hay que descuidar la carrera espacial, dado que si inviertes en ella te llevarás preciados puntos.
En pocas palabras es un juego profundo, tenso y lleno de giros a medida que pasan los turnos. Cada vez que lo juego se me pasa el tiempo volando. Lo tengo en formato físico y cada cierto tiempo lo sacamos a mesa con mi novia. 

Esta versión digital no defrauda, está muy bien implementada, con una interfaz clara. La IA también me ha sorprendido gratamente. Es realmente desafiante jugar contra la máquina, aunque si tienes algún amigo con quien explorar las diferentes sinergias que se dan en cada partida, sin duda lo disfrutarás muchísimo más.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294437182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 121665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116110, 'last_played': 1633090269}
review:
Qualified Yes.  This is a fantastic game.  Basically perfect except one thing.  There is no mechanism or penalty aside from a forfeit for people who just log off and leave the timer running.  All you can do in this situation is take the loss, because they will come back at the last second, or sit there and let the game idle for an hour or more.  Way too much of this, which leads to a lot of wasted time as some players let the clock run down and then log in with two minutes left to get a cheap win by playing last.   This is extremely irritating when it happens five minutes into a game with 90 minutes per side. There is no way to blacklist or flag players who routinely do this, or check their records before they join your game.  There are no major ratings penalties for quitting without a forfeit, after not making a move for over an hour.

So ya, it's one of the best strategy games of all time.  Works perfectly.  Lack of community controls basically ruin it.

review:
游戏是好游戏，电子化做得也不错，但是KS众筹时说好的包括中文在内的多语言文字选项呢？这都几年了？~......

Although it's a good adaption for this outstanding game coming to PC platforms, where is the multilingual interface implementation promised in your Kickstarter project? Awaiting since 2016...

author: {'steamid': '76561198143989383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5730, 'last_played': 1689067465}
review: Excellente adaptation du jeu de plateau. Cette version électronique économise du temps et permet d'enchaîner les parties... Ce qui est la seule manière de vraiment apprécier ce jeu. En effet, ce dernier demande un investissement certain pour connaître les cartes et leurs interactions. La première impression est celle d'un jeu de tir à la corde un peu stérile puis on commence à distinguer les subtilités du plateau et on acquiert des automatismes. Le jeu devient plus fluide et il s'agit vraiment de faire au mieux avec ce qu'on a et de savoir laisser à l'autre ce qui ne peut être défendu. Excellent jeu donc qui mérite sa solide réputation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083546597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1673057388}
review: The game really brings out Eisenhower's famous "domino theory" quote. Every playable card is designed with a specific real life Cold War occurrence in mind, and the impact of the card itself often reflects those actual implications. It can be fascinating to watch the opportunities created by which cards are played where, giving every turn an important cause-and-effect feel as you try and spread your own influence around the world while simultaneously controlling your opponent's efforts. An incredibly well-made board game with balanced sides, this is a masterfully done tabletop-to-virtual-screen port. If you like war games or are a fan of Cold War history, give this one a try. If you're a fan of both it's a must buy.

review: I played the tabletop game for many years and I backed the digital version. TS is one of my favorite games and thanks to de digital version I've played it a lot. Though, it would be nice to store and playback previous games (as promised in the KS).

author: {'steamid': '76561198207478633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2232, 'last_played': 1681995000}
review:
I love this game. From the sheer number of variables in the action cards that mean no two games are the same, to the historical speeches in the background as you play. Clearly this game was made by people who love history and geopolitics, for players who love history and geopolitics. 

I recommend consulting an online guide/tips at first or play offline for at least 3 games before going online against somebody more experienced. This game has some of the best AI I have ever encountered. From my experience online, the AI behaves like an experienced player but will very occasionally make a mistake. This means you will get beat in your offline games the first several times, but it also means you will learn more quickly.

I have never learned to play chess and with this game in my library it looks like I won't be learning for some time...

author: {'steamid': '76561198286968194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1681712367}
review: I was talked into playing this game by a buddy. I was apprehensive how much fun it would be since it looks like a risk remake with only 2 players. I was absolutely floored how fun it was. I was clenched from round 5 on. I have literally never played a board game that made me so anxious. The learning curve was pretty hard however after two or three games you will have the rules down no problem. I am a big history fan and the incidents that are described on the cards make you feel like you are dealing with spot fires constantly. I recommend finding a friend to play with as talking while playing makes it feel more real.

review: Great board game with pretty good adaptation. The tutorial in this game is really good and helps new players. I've heard the AI is pretty meh but its good to practice against and since its only 2 player its not as hard to find another player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173234209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1615959825}
review:
A great and deeply involved board game that perfectly simulates the back and forth nature and mindset of the cold war era. Be warned because there is a bit of a learning curve, which is simply due to the amount of options and cards you have.  But once you learn the game it is always engaging. Every decision is tense and you are always wondering what your opponent will do next. This version is especially nice because it takes care of all of that background stuff that is annoying to keep track of yourself. 

My advise for new players: play the U.S side first, Get control of Thailand, and don't lose Israel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413910338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7080, 'last_played': 1678312312}
review:
If you like Twilight Struggle as a Board Game, you will LOVE this computer adaptation. I'd say it is pretty much flawless. Not having to do all the counting and calculation of points manually of course makes the gameplay super smooth and relatively fast.  The beautiful rendered graphics and the great soundtrack add a lot to the great thematic athmosphere. The AI is decent.  After 5 games or so I became addicted. 
If you are new to the game and have a bit of patience, there is a great tutorial that you can follow along. 
Enjoy this masterpiece,  see you around!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995570612', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1608721136}
review:
There is a good reason this was the #1 rated boardgame for almost a decade, capturing the history and relentless tension of the Cold War superpower struggle over global regions. The digital implementation is entirely faithful to the board game, the UI is smooth and superior to most digital adaptions. The sound design, while simple, adds significantly to the mood. 

Highly recommended.

review: Still new to this game and have only played against the AI so far... I find the replay-ability and variety of options during each round to be excellent.  Always exciting to get your new cards each turn and attempting to figure out how will be the best way to leverage them to either get ahead or defend against your opponent.  Seemed too heavy at first, but the complexity goes away after 4-5 tries... and the constant losses as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997561468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1611751618}
review: Perfetta trasposizione del famoso gioco da tavolo. L'interfaccia è chiarissima e rende decisamente facile e piacevole valutare tutte le informazioni di tutto il tabellone e giocare. L'IA è stata nettamente migliorata negli anni ed è dignitosa, ma il punto forte del gioco è il multiplayer online, in diretta o in modalità asincrona, che permette di soppesare e studiare bene ogni mossa. Il gioco originale è un capolavoro ormai diventato un classico dei giochi strategici, è un gioco ricco di decisioni che pone al giocatore continuamente scelte critiche, un duello serrato fatto di continui botta e risposta, scelte sofferte per limitare i danni, di affondi decisi, aperture di nuovi fronti.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993605099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 72, 'playtime_at_review': 5329, 'last_played': 1712276372}
review: Mr.Gorbachev, tear down this wall!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047868362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 17253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12324, 'last_played': 1705821621}
review:
my favorite board game of all time. if your a cold war buff you'll love each and every card (the physical rule book has a section that you you what the historical significance of each card) . AS far as actual game play goes there's a couple pretty big things to note before you play.

1) pretty decent learning curve as far as a board game goes. The steam version does a good job of helping you along the way by semi guiding what you can and cant do which is nice and speeds the game up. however there are a few things to learn prior

2) the game inst inherently balanced. Online allows for you to set a handicap but it virtually only ever goes to benefit the US player as they are usually in a weaker position in the begging of the game. the different handicap formats are really just to give the US a fighting chance but many twilight struggle tournaments consider 2 handicap to be standard for what makes a fair game. none of this makes the game bad in fact a huge pull of the game is it is challenging to push off the soviet player and it can feel super rewarding because as you get better at the game the US actually has a just as high if not higher skill ceiling and can play on par with USSR but that takes a lot of play.

3). RNG 4 dayz. ive played a ton of board games and im usually a huge supporter of no rng pure skill games but even with this games crazy amount of randomness its a blast. there are a lot of die rolls and the game is played entirely off of cards. sometimes youre going to get the worst hand ever and lose automatically but as you learn to play the game youll discover that damage minimization is just as important as offence. while the game will seem random at times with skill you can usually mitigate misfortune and sometimes even misdirect it back at your opponent.

4. play against super high elo players online to see how they combo cards itll blow youre mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002341742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1609628421}
review:
The word struggle is in the title for a good reason. I struggled through a handful of games with the AI before finally getting my first USA victory. And all the time I just could not stop thinking "what's my next move?" or "how could I have played that situation better?". Even though the Soviets kept over-running me in the Middle East, or ruining my plans in South America, I kept at it because it was so much fun! If you are a fan of strategy games, board games, and cold war history then give this game serious consideration. It is a really good game. 

It is smart to read up on cards that you should generally deny your opponent until after the turn 3 reshuffle. Eg "De-Stalinization" and "Decolonization" are good cards for USSR, and should be held by the US player if possible.

Pros: 
Tense! Feels like you are balancing on a knife's edge every time.
Historically based
Decent graphics
Games are quite fast.

Cons: 
The game crashed on me a few times if I had left it running for long time without interacting with it.
Some dice rolling. Bad rolls can really sting.
Warfare is abstract, so no animated tanks nor airstrikes :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198120380050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4868, 'last_played': 1607915205}
review: Jogo sensacional. Prefiro a versão on-line que a física, pois as regras são complexas. No PC, o sistema não permite você cometer erros de regras. Além disso, é muito mais prático. Sobre o jogo, a todo momento você fica "gelado", tenso. Reflete bem o conceito da Guerra Fria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040723454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1607005947}
review:
Honestly just not a fan at all, the barrier to entry is so high that you basically are required to entirely memorise the deck to formulate any kind of strategy without just scrambling around in desperation. It definitely evokes an ethos of constant oneupmanship and looming doom, but not in a satisfying or fun way. Due to the fact that most actions you can take will give the opponent an immediate bonus or deny you a bonus it's distinctly unfun. It may be good game design that mechanics can give you an intended emotional response but that does not make it enjoyable to play. 

Do not buy this game to have a fun time. Consider buying it if you're a big modern history fan who cares more about theme than playing a game for relaxation or fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054221988', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1619964806}
review:
Отличный порт настольной игры.
С другой стороны, хоть процесс становится удобнее и многие подсчеты автоматизированны (да еще и с предпросмотром), это влияет на геймплей. Он становится более "чистым", с меньшим количеством плохих решений. Так же, говорить об исторической справедливости в справке к картам не приходится, но это уже не проблема порта. 
Несмотря на все эти недостатки, это игра с уникальным сеттингом, увлекающая на десятки часов.

P.S. Если кому нужен русификатор готовый на 60% - пишите.

review:
A great board game, truly ones of the best 2 competivite two player games out there. Though it is a game you really have to play a couple times to understand (the biggest draw back to the game is you need to know the deck of cards).

And this digital version is great. As most digital games it does a lot of the busy work for you and with all the move parts makes sure you don't miss anything. 

And great sound track. I'm a sucker for real audio spliced into a good background track!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970421669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1701569694}
review:
This is one of the best board games in the world. 2-player, asymmetric, historic feeling (epic), awesome. I've played the board game which helps as it is a bit unintuitive. Best to play with people how have played about the same amount of time. 

BTW. You hear some snippets from speeches made by Kennedy, Reagan etc. Compare it to things we hear today.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198116866353', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6074, 'last_played': 1660571267}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001503710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1603833262}
review:
Major problem is that this is just a card game where you throw a random but very finite set of cards at each other, about half of which are more or less game-ending if you are hit with them about twice. The card randomness overwhelms and swamps any tactics. It's a game that's about getting good cards. Basically like two rounds of 5 card stud, without any gambling or bluffing. 

In addition the game mechanics terminology is vague and ambiguous, and the relationship of the mechanics to any real world Cold War dynamics is not explained. It would have been a better game if it was abstract and lacked the historical veneer. It has nods to Illuminati but just ends up being random noise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076139858', 'num_games_owned': 1779, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 2329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1670507764}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989380272', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1655523959}
review: This was originally a highly acclaimed board game published by GMT games. It is a Cold War themed game that has you playing as one of the superpowers of the era (US, USSR) and trying to achieve world dominance through influence and coups (I guess realignment is in there too). This is exactly like the board game, but with some nice extra features like online multiplayer, a tutorial, and an AI bot to play against. It also removes the need for all the tiny pieces needed for the board game which, in my opinion, is a huge benefit. The game itself is complex and it will absolutely take at least two games to understand what is going on. I strongly suggest taking a look at this fan strategy guide: https://twilightstrategy.com/ to get an idea of what you should be trying to do your first few games. Once you get the hang of the cards and how to play each side the game is just an absolute joy to play. The system creates a lot of tension as you try to decide what to play and how to use it. Because cards that have opponent events will trigger something for your opponent you have to really think about when you play cards. Often opponent events will create opportunities that add to the feeling of crisis the game creates so well. I highly recommend this game. It was not number one on board game geek for so long for no reason after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996462373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2957, 'last_played': 1698152926}

author: {'steamid': '76561198241245312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 36266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 107, 'playtime_at_review': 13187, 'last_played': 1712424803}
review:
非常值得推荐的桌游移植版，随便聊聊几点感想
>省去了纸牌版本的大量计算，与人对战时一局游戏的时间从一到两小时直接缩短至半小时左右。
>AI真的有待提高……
 (即便如此游戏本身趣味性强，不妨碍几乎每周来上一局)
>DLC的0回合平衡性欠佳，玩熟了的玩家体会一下变化作为娱乐很不错。
 (顺便Molotov的实际效果和卡牌描述都是-2，但牌面显示为-1)
>还有一个疑点，#80一小步一大步，卡牌描述是只能获得第二个太空竞赛格子的胜利点数，但游戏中第一个格子的胜利点仍然可以获得。

review: Absolute masterpiece of a game, with simple rules and deep, complex interactions. I am a beginner and this online version is a great help for being able to play with fellows wargamers worldwide. I love the boardgame but it's not always possible to play it in person and this is an excellent alternative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144363991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2567, 'last_played': 1629783406}
review: This is a great implementation of this long-time number one strategy game.  I've just started getting into it more recently and have been able to use it being part of a Twilight Struggle tourney and practicing against the AI.  It works smoothly and does just what you want for a strategy game - takes care of all the bookkeeping for you so you can just play the game.  It also does a good job of giving you various views of situations to judge possible out comes by, such as current status for each region, imminent game losing situations, and such.  Some things I would like to see could be an AI that you could pick a level to go against like Rookie, Average, or Experienced, and further numbers crunched for things like likelihood for coups.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999559135', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12932, 'last_played': 1690503784}
review: This is very true to the original board game, and, as is often the case with computer adaptations, makes the game-play much less onerous and more enjoyable, and -- in this case particularly -- even gives you, as a player, more strategic information than you'd get playing analog-style.  (For instance, your probabilities are calculated before you ever roll the dice to realign or attempt a coup.)  I highly recommend the game itself, but if you've never played Twilight Struggle as a board game, trying this computer adaptation first might make it a little hard to pick up as the tutorial and rulebook doesn't seem to be as filled out as the board game's rulebook (the last time I checked).   I would recommend learning with someone who has played it before.  It's a game that definitely has a learning curve, and the more you play, the more familiar you get with the cards and strategies.  As far as the adaptation goes, I am thrilled with the gameplay.  The AI is also very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970625690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 69489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4, 'playtime_at_review': 52026, 'last_played': 1711581841}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039769252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 10980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7025, 'last_played': 1700128194}
review: Game AI still cheating. Needs to be fixed. Its disgustingly obvious. Based on the board game but AI blatantly cheats ruining the game. Knows exactly what score cards you have and acts accordingly. Its so obvious not sure why the designers didn't hide it better. Also some bugs, just had the score card display a massive victory and the end victory announcement gave it to the AI. What's happening there? Another example of AI blatant cheating. AI has extremely high success rate with coups and re-alignments and some completely BS results. Israel suddenly going 12 USSR? Where's the historical background for that? There is none. Also the AI launches repeated coup attempts at DEFCON 2 and never triggers a nuclear event. Every time I as the human player has done it it triggers a nuclear event, although its an odds based outcome supposedly. BS again. Game remains unbalanced and AI still cheats. Played the CIA card and saw the AI player hand. It subsequently played a card it didn't have. Not sure how that happened.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072302348', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1237, 'last_played': 1571617521}
review:
Juegaso, bastante divertido e inmersivo. Nunca e jugado el juego de mesa pero esta adaptacion digital es bastante buena en si. El juego se trata de mantener la mayor cantidad de paises bajo tu esfera de influencia usando los puntos o habilidades que te dan las cartas. En si es mas facil de aprender de lo que parece, se toma como unos 10 minutos en aprender, lo complejo viene de aprender y entender los efectos de las cartas. Tiene bastante profundidad estrategica y cada partida se desarrolla de una manera bastante unica.

La IA verdaderamente no aguanta una vez que uno mas o menos aprende a jugar decentemente, pero si no te gusta multiplayer eso aun asi tomara como 5 o 10 horas y luego puedes darle handicap a la IA para que siga dandote un reto. Igual el multi a mi me gusto y al menos cuando lo jugue pude encontrar personas de mi habilidad (a.k.a. noobs) porque la verdad si me temia que el multi estuviera poblado de jugadores bastante avanzados dada la popularidad del juego en la comunidad de juegos de mesa "serios".

De la parte que es solo en el videojuego y no el juego de mesa en si no hay como mucho que decir. Es una adaptacion bastante purista, que eso me parece bien. Tiene un soundtrack bueno pero corto, con lineas de voz bastante inmersivas al principio pero que se vuelven algo repetitivas. La interfaz es funcional aunque no muy estetica y nunca tuve un problema tecnico en el juego.

100% recomendado a cualquier fan de los juegos de mesa o de los videojuegos de estrategia y probablemente la manera mas accesible de jugar este clasico moderno dado el prohibitivo costo y la esporadica disponibilidad de la version fisica.

review: This game really snuck up on me. When I first tried it I knew it was a revision of a board game. It's a very strange yet elegant game. After putting in a hundred hours it's clear it is addictive! I've enjoyed the multiplayer battles and just facing off with the AI has some fun challenges.

review: This is a good electronic version of a great board game. The asynchronous play option is a great option. I am not a great player, so the computer provides enough of a challenge for me, and it is helpful being able to use influence handicaps to even things out.

review: Faithful representation of the celebrated boardgame with the added perks of 1) unable to lose any pieces, 2) cards don't wear out, and 3) The game won't let you make an illegal move.  AI plays a decent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002922649', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3392, 'last_played': 1694296058}
review: This is probably the best two player turn based game I have ever played.  It takes a few games to get a handle on it, but once you get familiar with the deck it is pretty straightforward.   There are aspects of a strategy board game, and a card game, with the order of card play being the part you have the most control over.  There is a pretty serious competitive scene for this game too.

review: 很少有西方人能够公允的看待这段历史，大多数都是DICE既没有思考能力，又没有知识储备的瑞典白痴。

author: {'steamid': '76561198295604606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1635961100}
review:
이미 실물 보드게임으로 유명한 황혼의 투쟁 (황투)가 맞습니다.

제가 못 찾은건지 한국어로 변환 옵션이 없습니다.
실물 게임과 같아서 카드 내용을 안다면 문제 없이 플레이가 가능하지만,
룰적인 요소 + 언어장벽으로 처음 하시는 분들에게 비추합니다.
영어 가능하다면 문제 없을것 같습니다.

Ai 수준은 무난합니다. 쿠테타 걸어야 할 곳에 걸고, 영향력 들어와야 하는 곳에 들어옵니다. 룰까먹고 cia 내리니까 바로 데프콘 깎아서 데프콘패배 걸어버립니다.
다만 시스템적으로 상대방 카드를 확인가능한건지 영향력을 뿌려서 뻥카를 몇 번 걸어봤는데 말려들지 않아 좀 아쉬웠습니다. 사람같진 않지만 무난하게 혼자 플레이하기 좋습니다.

세팅이 현실게임보다 압도적으로 편하고, 적당히 룰 미스 부분을 캐치해줘서 아주 아주 좋습니다. 저도 모르게 등신같이 데프콘 패배가 날 수 있는 카드 내려놓으려고 하면 마킹도 해줍니다. 근데 잘 안 보입니다..ㅋㅋ
대충 몸에 익으면 2시간짜리 게임이 30분 컷이 됩니다.

장점은 
1. 어쨌든 Ai가 있다.
2. 세팅/룰적인 부분에서 편하다.
3. 특정 이벤트 카드 터질때 브금도 깔아준다.
4. 게임 자체가 재미면에서 치트키라 게임성이 좋다.
5. 스팀 리모트 플레이로 친구랑 플레이가능

단점은
1. Ai가 그렇게 썩 잘하지는 않더라
2. 한글이 읍드라
3. 영향력 집어넣고 수정할 때 한 개만 되돌리는 키가 없다 (있을 수도 있는데 발견 못함)
4. 쿠테타 진행ui가 정신이 없어서 결과만 보고 대충 꺼버림

review:
Настольная игра отличная, а вот это компьютерная игра-недоразумение нет. Именно против ИИ играть невозможно из за мухлевания. 
ИИ всегда знает всегда какие у тебя карты,  игра наполняет твою руку красными картами при игре за США, так что на 3 раунде счетчик +13 не в твою пользу. Какими бы ты тактиками не пользовался ИИ запросто их контрит так как знает твои карты. Русификации нет и совести у разработчиков тоже.

review: One of the most cerebral and fascinating games I've ever played.  Outstanding replayability, great historical depth, heart-poundung anticipation each turn and it gets the gears upstairs turning like few other games.  Multiplayer is rather time consuming but you can always do something else while you wait for your opponent to finish his turn.  On top of all this, the game gets an A+ for overall presentation.  A real pleasure to play.

review: A very good two player game based on the cold war. Would 100% recommend getting the turn zero and promo expansion with the game as they add great new outcomes and strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561199008446311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1701908675}
review: One of the best board games ever made and this might be the best digital version of a board game on Steam.  They captured the tension of the game and got the cards and mechanics right, and the music and voice-overs from Cold War leaders are a nice touch.  This game is known for having a long learning curve -- learning against the AI is more fun than losing to your friend 10 times and a lot faster than doing it in real life (games take half as long because the AI is very fast).  For $10, this is a no-brainer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198965127214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1644040154}
review: Interesting and historical strategy game.  More enjoyable than board-game version of Twilight Struggle, in fact I am impressed with the quality and automation.  Note - each game typically takes 3-5 hours to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007324163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1593571295}
review:
As a Multiplayer online game it's ok, but as a single player game the unbalanced luck factor makes this game (like a lot of card / dice games) nothing but a sad frustrating waste of time. 

The AI (computer cheat) advantage factor is really hard to overcome. In 16 single player games my dice rolling succeeds about 20-30% of the time with 50% or better probability, the corresponding AI success rate is 75-80% for similar propositions. Also the AI for the most part has a card mix that is usually ideal to counter and / or trump any moves you make and seems to have an uncanny knack of being able to predict where the scoring cards will fall in any given round. I call this lazy programming, as the game concept is intriguing but the inherent randomized disadvantage to the human player gets old fast.

If you have a group of friends and you're going to play multiplayer, the games seems to be much fairer at dictating the random results, so it's much more enjoyable. 

On a scale of 10, I rate it a 6-multiplayer and a 3-single player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035742939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1402, 'last_played': 1603918814}
review:
It's great for solo-play.  The AI is also decent with is more than I can say for most of these games.  I lost the first several times I played it.  Others like Fort Sumter or Richard III, I beat first time without even really knowing the rules.

Twilight Struggle is a classic among board games.  I hope to see its siblings Labyrinth and Imperial Struggle adapted in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326238064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1601066795}

review: A very good board game the translates perfectly to digital. Keeping up with everything in physical version is complex, in the digital version all the housekeeping is automated and you focus on your strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198857603639', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1597497819}
review:
没有传说中的那么复杂嘛，打一遍教程就会玩了。
还挺好玩的，钢四玩腻了玩玩这个挺不错的。
熟悉机制之后就着英文也能玩，记住几个常见的词就行了。
稍有遗憾的是只能1v1，要是有多人合作模式就更好了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053169918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 30479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16257, 'last_played': 1700549188}
review: This is a faithful adaption of an excellent board game.  I own the physical board game and prefer to use this version as there is almost always an available opponent online, I can play with friends across long distances, and the interface streamlines the games making them go faster because no one has to shuffle or deal.  Additionally, the cards don't wear out which means your opponent can't tell what's in your hand based on how worn the card is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188510055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1593215159}
review:
Poderia ter como modular a dificuldade da IA e algumas regras ficam meio nebulosas durante o jogo. A regra das MilOps e do DefCon não fica muito clara a princípio. O texto das cartas ativas não ficam muito visíveis por conta do tamanho.
Entretanto o jogo é extremamente divertido e consegue capturar a experiência do boardgame, de modo muito mais dinâmico e ágil. Recomendável a qualquer um que goste de jogos de estratégia com um pouco de sorte envolvida.

review: As a multiplayer (that is, against another person) game, this might shine ... but as a single player game, it is painful to get into.  While there is an initial handicap option, it doesn't take into consideration the skill level of the player ... that handicap is easily overcome in subsequent turns as the AI plays the game optimally ... against a new player, it is very discouraging ... and there's no other way to change the difficulty level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992827942', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1607276403}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976263410', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 24542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6072, 'last_played': 1690198615}
review: A great implementation of a truly excellent boardgame. Atmospheric and tense. The online play, which can happen asynchronously (offline), is very convenient and works well. Highly recommended for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077086726', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 15209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5852, 'last_played': 1690107312}
review:
Great game I love it one of rare board games easier to play in digital version. And frankly that's the way it should be play. There are many nuanced rules that are very easy to miss and error in board game form. I have board game, but still digital version is much easier and even if I have friends to play we would opt in for hotseat rather than going to board game. 

I highly recommend it, there are some nuances that would need to be fixed. But it is worth a price. And you will spend a lot of time. However, be ready for steep learning curve especially against experienced players.

review:
A rather fun board game where you play during the cold war as one of the main opponents and have to try and outclass the other.

It has a nice detailed field, interesting cards and quite a bit of strategic depth.

I havent tried the online yet, but the AI provides a decent challenge. At least while youre getting used to the game.

If you like the cold war era or board games, this is a good choice.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198326759008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 14071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4317, 'last_played': 1684006195}
review:
Great game. Initially steep learning curve offset by excellent tutorial.
While the learning curve is steep - it is not very long.
GMT allow access to a full copy of the pdf rules on their web site.
Excellent AI player, tough to beat without giving oneself an advantage. (Much stronger than many AI's efforts)
Remarkably deep strategy - with multiple options and there is very often a way to "catch up". e.g. - lost control of Africa and Asia, you can still win by pulling down the Berlin wall and dominating Europe.
All this with relatively short (but steep) learning curve.

If you were around in the cold war - the game also evokes some nostalgia
If you're learning or teaching this period of history - provides a relevant background. It is historically accurate in events, although they don't necessarily happen in the historical chronological order.

Great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198123971061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1590328455}
review:
Played quite a few times now and don't understand why the game is slanted towards the USSR. Play as the US and you'll struggle, ALOT. Play as the USSR and it's a breeze. A lot of events place Russian influence all over the shop, while there are less US mitigating cards. Once the USSR starts to gain control it is very challenging to break, and then it's just a waiting game for that player for the scoring cards to come out. 
Don't get me wrong, its a well designed game, with easily graspable functions that let you focus on one area or the big picture, and a decent enough tutorial. The AI thinking time isn't that bad either (if you've played Civ II on the PS you'll understand). Technically this game is a decent port, and if you like an uphill struggle against almost insurmountable odds by all means get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134219338', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1590306689}
review: Slow and confusing. I was so excited for this game because of the theme and I've heard great things about it, but there are too many moving parts to keep track of digitally. I attempted the tutorial five times (two of which bugged out and wouldn't let me play a card that it wanted me to play to progress) and still only have a slight grasp on the mechanics, and definitely no idea how to properly play the game. The issue is that the various tracks are either not shown or do not give any information when interacting with them. For instance the space race panel and defcon track do not tell you what is going to happen or what benefits/detriments will come with advancing/neglecting those areas. The AI takes up to 20 seconds to play a card, in which time I usually end up wondering if it's my turn and I just don't know it. I'm sure this is a great game once you can master the basics but without proper info panels you end up just guessing at what you should be doing, which is not a fun way to interact with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054543870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 37883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35421, 'last_played': 1705548394}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061456869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1590063000}
review:
I can't comment on multiplayer as I haven't played yet. 

Offline play vs computer is ridiculous. I've played now twice and in two separate games the computer has rolled 6 20 of 22 rolls. I thought the first tutorial game may just be a glitch. Replayed it a second time while streaming and every roll in the second game was a 6. Before I knew it every coup was successful and it was a quick gg. That's absurd and makes it no fun when you are busy racking up territories for control/domination and in 3 turns you go from domination to presence and they now have control. Glad strategy is meaningless v AI in this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963295797', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1589761131}
review:
I'm still relatively new to Twilight Imperium, so I'm learning the in's and out's of strategy and how certain cards/abilities work.  However, I've enjoyed learning how to play TI.  It's a deep game with lots of strategy, and some luck with card draw.  I could definitely see this being a game I'd play around the table with a friend.

However, I will say that playing against the computer's AI has really been frustrating.  I'd swear they get a lot of really lucky rolls and card draws, or seem to know exactly what I'm planning to do.  It took me a good 15+ games before I finally won a game.  I've seen lots of similar complaints about how either the AI makes really confusing moves, does something dumb, or seems to get "lucky".  In fact, in the single game I won, the AI decided to call it quits in the late stages of the game and played a hugely-damaging card that dropped the game to DEFCON 1, and would have given me a bunch of influence points.  This seems really odd.  I have to imagine that there was a way for the computer to play non-losing moves.  I was only at 13 points, so it's not like I was going to win that round.

There's also no way to change the difficulty of the AI.  All you can do is adjust a starting handicap of points leaning one way or the other.  I'm not really thrilled with that idea.  Virtually all my other games I was creamed by the AI, so even with a several-point handicap in my favor, I don't know that I could win regularly.

In any case, I'd say this could be a lot of fun playing online with a friend, or learning to play the physical board game on your own.  But, I'm not sure I'd recommend getting this just to play against the computer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134819559', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1599095329}
review:
This is a really interesting board game, and it's well done digitally here. Anyone who likes games like Risk would enjoy this. 

The tutorial sucks ass though. It fails to explain several things (The mid and late war phases are never even mentioned), there is no tutorial for different game modes, it makes it difficult to get a grasp on the ui because it makes all irrelevant info completely invisible until it becomes relevant (at which point what was previously relevant is now made invisible), and there are so many little things that you just won't understand by the end of it. Luckily the game comes with a digital rule book in the options menu. This rule book is actually helpful and makes the game comprehensible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971367557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8384, 'last_played': 1702400435}
review:
J'aime ce jeu, le concept est vraiment bon.

MAIS le merite ne revient nullement à Playdeck Inc qui s'est contenté de l'adapter sur micro apres un kickstarter...

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/559431060/twilight-struggle-digital-edition

Trop de promesses non respectées malgré la levée de fond reussit :

Traduction francaise absente (d'autres langues aussi)
5 Scenarios devenu 2 scenars + 1 varation (ininteressante)  et ... + 1 scenar en DLC payant 
De nombreuses cartes ont des effets qui ne correspondent pas à leurs descriptions : Iron lady, Wargame, Vietnam revolt associé avec red purge et j'en passe
La moitié des succés sont buggés.
Et j'en passe des plus anecdotiques

Je peux me tromper mais je n'ai vu aucune justification ou excuse nulle part de leur part.

J'espere que le createur a touché une somme correct pour l'adaptation de son oeuvre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044581598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1712282915}

author: {'steamid': '76561198276822009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 388, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1711821537}
review: Одна из лучших настольных игр для двух игроков (если не лучшая). Интересный сеттинг (можно переписать историю, ну и подтянуть собственные знания по ходу игры), тонкие игровые механики, хороший, пусть и спорный баланс (игроку за СССР легче играется в начальных фазах, игроку за США - в конце игры). Из недостатков можно отметить некоторую зависимость от бросков кубиков (да, случайность здесь нивелируется стратегическим расчетом, но кубик все равно может решить исход игры), зависимость от того, как часто игрокам в руку заходят карты подсчета очков, ну и самое главное - ПРОДОЛЖИТЕЛЬНОСТЬ. Обычная партия равных игроков длится 3-4 часа. Но, суммируя, эта игра - шедевр настольных игр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169307903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2414, 'last_played': 1628301563}
review:
Ok, so the good things first: the board game is amazing. This platform will allow you to play with a friend (who knows the game already) in a faithful rendition of the game. For anyone who hasn't played this style of game, I recommend it as a fun and intuitive thrust into the "wargame" genre (I use this term loosely, as all hexy grognards would burn me at the stake for lumping this in with the likes of Panzer General). Another pro is that it is relatively inexpensive. 
So the bad: The game crashes a lot. A LOT. There are reports of this to the developer, but no response/bug fixes. Disappointing. The AI isn't very good, and it is hard to lose if you've ever played the game before. You have to basically get caught with a Defcon suicide hand after the first couple of rounds (very rare, but it can happen), or lose all your coup rolls or something. And finally, the game does a horrific job of explaining what is going on to the novice. I recommend reading the pdf of the rules online through GMT Games if you really want to learn how to play. 
So if you know someone who knows how to play already, grab it as you hunker down in your Corona bunker. Otherwise, grab Tabletop Simulator instead and learn how to play Lake of Fire or Cuba Libre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980009117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1587658539}
review:
Twilight Struggle has two strengths - it is pretty much a direct conversion of the board game and, as such ,  a great way to learn the basics of the game. The AI provides a fairly stiff initial challenge for someone new to the game, but stick with it and learning what it is doing wrong (and right) gives you an appreciation for the deeper layers of strategy it requires. 

Yes, its principally a game of drawing cards and then playing them, guesstimating what the other player might have, trying to keep the worst cards out of play while making the most of the cards made for you, but it is also world domination through scheming, dastardly machinations, brute force, and (above all) foresight.

It's not going to be everyone's cup of tea, It's not an easy game , and it takes time to learn the cards. Losing is the default state at first, and it can initially feel that the USA is "hard mode". 

However If you've bounced off the real world version due to the rules (confusion often reigns for new players in their first few games) then this is an excellent way to give it another try.  It's faster, you can put it down and come back to it, and you'll see yourself improving as you get more games under your belt. 

Then there is online multiplayer (which admittedly I've yet to try) which, if you have someone to play, gives the game real legs. 

I'd recommend this wholeheartedly if it looks like your kind of thing. A solid conversion of an excellent board game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253838767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1621002990}
review:
Excellent portage du non moins excellent jeu de plateau. En ce qui concerne le concept de base, on est dans de la simulation de guerre froide de haute pétée ^^, je n'ai pas grand chose à ajouter si ce n'est qu'il convient quand même de réserver ce jeu aux fans de simulation stratégique. Un simple adepte du Risk risque surtout d'être largué. 
En ce qui concerne son portage en support jeu vidéo, le jeu rempli avec brio trois critères essentiels :
1) Fluide (pas d'interminables messages de validation comme dans Terraforming Mars par exemple)
2) Les calculs fastidieux du jeu de plateau sont désormais gérés par l'ordinateur (et clairement expliqués au joueur)
3) Une I.A.... la vache, elle saura vous occuper le temps de trouver un ami avec lequel jouer à ce jeu (et pourtant dieu sait que cette phase peut être longue ^^)
4) Et enfin le plus important : un multi local en écran partagé est disponible. Ca peut sembler la plus évidente des bases concernant le portage d'un jeu de société mais certains arrivent quand même à ne pas nous proposer cette fonctionnalité (je pointe du doigt des licences comme Armello ou Colt Express, je conchie copieusement).

review: A good implementation of the board game. The Cold War is an interesting setting and the tug of war mechanic where you surprisingly often hunt for Status Quo is unique. It's advanced and the different event card require some matches to get some understanding good enough to actually have a plan and a strategy. The fact that it's based on real event (with some added information in the rule book) adds a lot to the feel and setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024822059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1678671087}
review:
So, I'll see that I've played this enough times that might make you wonder why it's a negative. Well, this is a  ...good enough... adaptation of the board game. All rules are implemented, graphics are alright, and multiplayer works well.

HOWEVER, this is 2020 (the game is a few years old) and I can't simply recommend this game with this many UI flaws:

- Clutter everywhere. This is a very simple card game, all you need is to see your hard an a few piles of cards besides the board, which is a map of the world with a few markers. And yet, there are indicators everywhere, using a very LARGE font (which, up to a certain point, I appreciate, but I'll be damned if I can understand what each indicator is for without clicking over it).
- The game uses a lot of modal pop-ups when you are clicking stuff like cards, scoring, etc. There are different ways to closing then, and those are always convoluted. A simple, familiar action like clicking on the background won't close the modal pop-up.
- Placing influence is the essence of the game; but you can't simply remove a influence point you've just assigned, you have to undo ALL you round (which might mean two plays even, the effect of your opponents action and your own).
- Again, undo is terrible.
- You are always logged out of the game, so whenever joining a multiplayer match, you have to enter the multiplayer screen and click on login. The game saves your password, so I don't get why couldn't it just login.
- Esc won't close modals either, btw.
- There's no in-game help for rules. (at least on multiplayer). If you've played the boardgame, like I did, you'll probably be fine since the game does a very good job of conducting you, but if you want to remember how something works, well, alt-tab to the web and ask google.

So, if you are a die-hard fan of Twilight Struggle, do get this game. However, if you are new to board games, just skip it and hope someone does a better adaptation in the future.

review: One of the best digital board game implementations I've come across. Twilight Struggle (the board game) is a great game, and the digital version streamlines all of the maintenance and overhead of playing it. The pacing is great, you can go over your cards while you're waiting for your opponent's turn, the music and sound are great (although the speeches are loud and tend to cut off trying to voice chat with my opponent), and the game does a good job of warning you if you're about to do a bone-headed move. I hope GMT releases more of their games in this style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366093929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 52102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48630, 'last_played': 1675893337}
review:
This is my favourite boardgame and my favourite game on Steam. It creates a level of tension unlike any other turn-based game I have played.

The complexity level is not too high, but familiarity with the cards is essential to winning regularly. And this mostly comes through playing a lot. So it can be a bit brutal for newcomers, but they live and learn! (Or don't live.)

The application has a few, mostly obscure rule-related bugs, but nothing too major. The interface has been done well. I have played almost 200 games of TS now and have just returned from a 8-9 month break from not playing it and am enjoying it again.

Definitely good value for money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060519527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1659871986}
review:
I didn't like this game at all when I first played it, but I had friends who raved about it, and I saw the rave reviews on BGG, so I stuck with it, and I can now at least understand the appeal it has, and I can say I've gotten to the point where I can have fun playing it.  I still wouldn't say I like it as much as Risk, though.

Misc thoughts:
- Just playing the game a bunch of times and referring to the rules for the parts you don't understand will get rid of the confusion you feel when you start.  Don't just try to reread the rules a million times before playing, hoping to get it all to make sense before you actually play a game.
- You really need to understand how scoring works, and especially what the requirements for 'Domination' of a region are.  You want to be able to achieve 'Domination' as cheaply as possible, and prevent your opponent from getting Domination as cheaply as possible.
- The other complicated parts (aside from scoring) are how coups and realignments work.  That's going to take some time to sink in.
- Like everyone says when they're introducing the game, the game is about maximizing the effectiveness of the cards you have and minimizing the effectiveness of the enemy events you're carrying.
- You need to remember that Europe scoring, Asia scoring, and Middle East scoring are done once each in the first three turns, and then the other three regions are activated in the next three rounds (with Europe/Asia/ME also being scored again).
- Now that I'm familiar with the game, I notice that the AI doesn't always immediately play a scoring card when it has Domination of a region, which seems like suboptimal play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001096362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1585791991}
review:
A poor adaptation of a good board game.  Basic rules aren't implement right, such as the game seeing connections between countries that don't have connections, or not always recognising region domination for scoring.  If your opponent adds influence to a country that is off your current screen while you are partially zoomed in, it just flies off the side of your screen and you have to go find it.  The timings where it has pauses that require player acknowledgement are off, such as there being a pause at the start of your turn before you can look at your hand again, but no pause when an opponent is playing a card.  So, if like me, you haven't played in a year, and the bot throws a late war card at you, it's up for 2 seconds, then it's gone and effects are happening.  The discard isn't sorted in any logical manner, so if you want to see what that card was, you could be looking for a while.  Speaking of the bot, if you were a test player only playing the first turn or two, you would find that it plays a mean early game, and think it was well designed.  But somewhere around the mid game it just starts derping out trying to ram influence into controlled countries to no avail.

So to recap:  Twilight Struggle is a fantastic board game, but this screen adaptation of it is junk.

review:
Um jogo fenomenal.
Com regras simples e fáceis de aprender, mas com uma profundidade estratégica incrível, mantem toda a tensão da Guerra Fria, com cartas inspiradas em eventos históricos que acabam bem amarradas com o tema e a mecânica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007558579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1608134675}
review:
I was a bit reluctant to buy this game as the rules are not that easy and I feared the card/dice mechanic makes you rely too much on luck. Played 4 times against the AI and didn't win (although once it was close) but nevertheless I enjoyed the game. It is deeper and more immersive than expected. There is also an in-game tutorial and rule book.

Tip: there is a very good (3 parts) Youtube video from Harsh Rules on how to play Twilight Struggle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400783538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1816, 'last_played': 1619797014}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000313039', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1585244304}
review:
I obtained this game as a discount, but feel like is is almost worth the $10.

Recommended for anyone who is a fan of the board game, or wants a tense yet slow moving strategy game.   Note:  As far as I can tell the game has NO shortcut keys, I hope a future update fixes this so in the meantime don't expect being able to take as many quick turns like in Sid Meier's Civ.

As someone who played the board game hundreds of times and has most of the cards memorized, this is a solid adaptation of the board game.  For me the interface is decent, and info on the screen is good.  It adds variations in the board game such as the Chinese Civil War, and optional cards (I forgot to check if the future war is available).  It even has a handicap slider for newer players.

If you haven't played the board game, I can imagine it may be a bit of a slog trying to read and understand all the tiny details, especially when ongoing events are tucked in a corner of a screen and you can't figure out why you can't do something (its probably because an event played earlier in the game).

review: Straight-up port of the board game, which was the top board game on Board Game Geek for many years running.  Simple yet fascinating Cold War game that will accidentally teach you a lot about this historical period (a la Europa Universalis 2, which I still say should be used in European History courses in the USA).  There is a mediocre AI that you can beat up over and over if you can't find people to play it with, but as always it's better with a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005414570', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1715, 'last_played': 1644351667}
review: Probablement un des meilleurs jeux de plateaux jamais sortis. Son adaptation est très réussie et s'est affinée avec le temps (j'y ai récemment trouvé une faute d'orthographe, mais rien de grave). L'IA s'est énormément améliorée et représente un challenge, même pour un joueur expérimenté. Elle a tendance encore à ne pas défendre suffisamment l'Europe, fait quelques choix parfois curieux, mais honnêtement, elle peut vous surprendre et il faut jouer sérieusement pour la battre. Bref, 10/10, sans la moindre hésitation, c'est une énorme réussite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004087263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1597537990}
review:
Better than the table top version. I enjoy physical board games over digital, but this app is so clean in design, and the book keeping and scripting are so well done that I just cant play the table top version anymore. 

Its one of the deepest 2 player board games ever made.
If you like the cold war, or just like strategy games, pick this one up

review: An exceptional digital implementation of an already outstanding board game. I've encountered few bugs so far, and the interface is intuitive and definitely helps expedite gameplay. Online play is surprisingly stable (considering that Twilight Struggle is turn based). The game automatically sends email reminder when it's your turn, which is a very neat addition. The community is fairly friendly, but the forfeiting mechanic means that online play is subject to trolls: you will see a decent number of trolls in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189824355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1602, 'last_played': 1609088457}
review: There is no warning before losing on defcon zero. You play a card (the midwarcard 45) and your opponent got the choice to set defcon higher or lower. He decides for decrease. But you lose because you played the card. This is not obvious. On the other hand the actions of the opponent (AI or player) are shown to short. You always lose attention to understand what is going on. The played cards disapear very fast. And they are discarded in disorder. You always have to seek them and look in the log. It is imposible to know all cards by heart. Therefor it sucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055696887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1583125104}
review: Pretty good implementation if a bit clunky in some areas. Having to click on each card in your hand to view it's event is slow and annoying, especially since viewing on hover is used elsewhere in the game. The AI often makes terrible decisions though (such as not competing for a region even when it holds that region's scoring card) which reduces the satisfaction of beating it. Helped me realise that I had interpreted some of the rules incorrectly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982755671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 56833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 594, 'playtime_at_review': 12222, 'last_played': 1712426033}
review:
Buenas amiguitos!
El juego Twilight Struggle está considerado uno de los mejores juegos de tablero del mundo actualmente según Gameboardgeek.com.
Es un juego para jugar tranquilamente y pensar bien los turnos para ejecutar las cartas lo mejor posible.
La comunidad online es genial y hay muchos jugadores conectados.
Tener el juego en Steam te permite jugarlo mas frecuentemente que con el tablero físico y además las partidas pueden ejecutarse a 45 min, 60 min, 3 horas, 6 horas, 1 día, 3 días, 7 días, 21 días o 45 días.
Me ha encantado y creo que el precio se ajusta perfectamente a lo que es el juego. 
Está totalmente en inglés pero no creo que sea un impedimento para jugarlo.
Como nota negativa diría que una traducción al español y otras idiomas habría sido acertado.

Pd: ¡Si no sabes inglés ya tienes un motivo para aprender!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999307974', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 1085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1599878564}
review:
It's a popular board game, and this version shows why. It's a nice alternative to heavy IRL boardstate maintenance through automation.

Learning the basics of it has been an emotional rollercoaster but there's loads of depth here for those that want to plumb it. 

I'm a bit scared of the online community but the AI already gave me my sales price worth. 

AI absolutely calculates for distractingly long and, when you're a little more familiar with the systems, makes some amusingly shot term plays. 

Worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205248751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1604264683}
review:
I've played TS a little as a board game and a little as a Steam game. Going from the board version to the computer version is basically a lateral move, not a step up or a step down. 

It's a fairly straightforward adaptation of the boardgame to a Steam format, without  lot of bells and whistles added. The sound effects and video effects are minimal. A lot of the disappointment expressed in the reviews is from the playability challenges of the original game, not really problems with the interface. It seems odd to me that people would have such high expectations -- it's a board game. (Do they complain that Microsoft solitaire "didn't knock my socks off"? Minesweeper "just doesn't have the great soundtrack I was hoping for"?)

This is a boardgame made into a video game with minimal changes. You could argue that it could have used more work to make it fancier, but it really is just a boardgame you play with a mouse.

If you love the original version and have people willing to play it with you, toss a coin over whether to buy this version. The main benefit of the Steam version is that, unlike the original, you can play it solitaire (against a UI which is neither a genius nor an idiot.)

If you really want to see a good boardgame absolutely butchered by poor software design, check out Catan or Carcassone (or Axis and Allies, for eff's sake -- how could you screw up Axis and Allies?!?) This one's pretty decent, all things considered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207397411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2042, 'last_played': 1690200451}
review:
Twilight struggle is a masterpiece of game design.
It's simple, easy and quick to learn and will keep you on the edge of your seat everytime.

The Cold War-themed cards add a certain flavour to the game and its ambiance. It makes everything seem more real and more stressing.

If you love good strategy games, planning your domination multiple steps ahead and reliving the Cold War nuclear war constant fear, you'll love Twilight Struggle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1704305296}
review:
Twilight Struggle is a ripoff of the complex boardgame of the same name.   Control the USA or USSR during the cold war.  Play cards and distribute influence tokens to expand your control over the world.   Various elements (cards etc) represent real world events that influence the flow of the game. 

The implementation here isn't great, the gameplay area is really cluttered and confusing.   The flow of the turns isn't made very clear, and given the complexity of the game, the UI being so imperfect is game breaking.  Also, there's some AI bugs where the AI will hang on its turn, so you would be better off playing against human players... if there were any playing the game.  But online is dead.   $14.50, it's probably cheaper than the real board game, but it's definitely not better, and not better than most other games you can get for the same price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198453266934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 18827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13499, 'last_played': 1653753456}
review:
运气游戏 玩尼玛呢
反向ROLL点，政变全小，飞机都大
建议引入伪随机机制，政变和飞机分开算，你见过我脸黑的时候一局飞船一格没动么？艹
再者，重新设定区域稳定度和政变制度，1-6影响太大，改成1-3就好
一局玩那么久，前期布局不错结果硬是被运气击败，这种体验感太差了。
要么就互相平衡一些，比如你大点政变，我下次政变是大点的概率也提高。
不然这样拼运气真的一点意思都没有 越想越火大

author: {'steamid': '76561199014674268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1640118694}
review:
Not the Cold War - the Frozen War. The software is not functioning to make this game playable. Within a few minutes each time, the game freezes and you can only resort to reset. Tried this multiple times; looked online in four places for advice but it seems it is an unadvertised 'feature' of the game.
**Update** Managed to play a staccato game of TS with about 15 freezes. This time I opened the game via the Steam page on my PC. 
I lost my first full game. My second I began as Late War and finished with the an error of scoring. 
The following scores are listed on firstly the continent score cards and secondly, in brackets) the final scoring screen
CA: +1 USSR (+1 USSR)
AF: +5 USSR (+5 USSR)
EU: +5 USA (+5 USSR)
SA: +4 USA (+4 USA)
ME: +1 USA (Draw)
AS: +5 USA (Draw)
At the bottom of the screen it summarises the points thus: USA: 09, USSR 06 and the winning margin four for the USA. 
Yet the final screen states the USA was crushed the USSR as does my player profile. 
The game is so good and detailed. These two bugs are frustrating!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086140978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2400, 'last_played': 1639154812}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968536004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1584916252}
review:
Plays like the real board game with some PROs and CONs

PROs
-No need to do math/calculate probabilities for Coups, and Realignments
-Enforces rules that can sometimes be forgotten or missed during gameplay
-No need to keep swapping influence tiles like IRL, will automatically decrease/increase
-No need to shuffle/setup/tear down
-Keeps track of points from military OPs/Def Con
-Lots of book keeping becomes automated or given reminders

CONs
-The AI is hit or miss, will def-con suicide sometimes, or play decently well against noobs (me)
-Sometimes finding a game is difficult, 
-No desktop notification when a game is found/played, have to rely on checking on the game itself or email
-The rolls sometimes seem fishy, I find that 6s and 1s appear quite often,, which then averages to a 3, maybe the algorithm should be tweaked, or maybe I'm using confirmation bias, or only remember when its a 1 or a 6. IDK

Pretty good implementation of TS, haven't played any of the variants only base game, and the extra cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039744857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 69, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1712406033}
review:
명작 보드게임의 무난한 PC 이식. 무난한 PC이식조차 못하고 똥이 되어버린 수많은 다른 게임들을 생각해보면 추천할 만한 가치가 있다. 특히 할인할 경우 약 7천원에 턴 제로 확장팩까지 살 수 있다는 점은 큰 플러스 요소.

+ 기본기에 충실한 이식(이것조차 못하는 똥겜들이 널림)
+ 나름 괜찮은 가격
+ 크로스 플랫폼 온라인 대전 가능

- 기본기 이상의 것을 보여주지는 못함
- 심각하게 멍청한 AI(싱글플레이로 실력을 키우겠단 생각은 버리는게 좋다. 스코어링 카드를 들고 폭사하는 병신이니까.)
- 따라서 같이 할 친구가 없는 찐따들은 살 수가 없음

author: {'steamid': '76561198028133949', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1698864309}
review:
Больше года думал купить "физический" оригинал, но цена останавливала. Взял по распродаже. Первая партия была проведена с кузеном, длилась почти 2 часа и, лично мне понравилась. И не потому, что социализЬм в моём лице победил капитализЬм в его, а просто потому, что игра захватывающая. Когда пытаешься просчитать, что на следующем ходу ты укрепишь влияние в одном из регионов - оппонент тебе ломает весь кайф какой-нибудь карточкой, в стиле "противник убирает 3 влияния в таком-то регионе".
Сильная нехватка русификатора, для полного погружения в исторические события (нет желания постоянно сворачивать игру, чтобы посмотреть уже русифицированные карточки по номерам.
Разрабы, ау! Дайте русский язык! учитывая, что физическую игру уже перевели.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019232689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 13409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1962, 'last_played': 1673927116}
review: A fantastic Cold War geopolitical simulator with lots of historical accuracy and well-implemented game mechanics. The AI will make questionable choices sometimes, but is still a ruthless opponent that you will often lose against. 100% recommended for anyone with an interest in international relations and Cold War history.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972021635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1583751731}
review: This is a review of the video game version. The board game is great as long as you have two people of equal skill. The same can be said for this version of the game. The learning curve is very steep. The game is unforgiving to new players. It's impossible to win playing the United States without giving yourself an advantage at the start. Unless you are a veteran of the board game I'd stay away from this else you'd be wasting hours upon hours trying to win ONE game against the AI. There is no difficulty adjustment of the AI. Only giving them an influence handicap at the game setup. Had I known this I would have stayed away. If you have lots of friends to play this with then it may be worth it.

review:
1 zu 1 Umsetzung eines der besten 2-Spieler Brettspiele (Thema: Kalter Krieg).
Interface ist manchmal etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig, die Zeiten für Online-Spiele ("Schachuhr") sind entweder 45 Minuten oder 90 Minuten/ Seite (beste wäre meiner Ansicht nach 60 Minuten, 45 ist fast Arbeit, 90 sind 3h für ein ganzes Spiel). 

Funktioniert zu 100% unter Linux (via dem Steam/wine Interface).

review:
약간 ai 한테 유리한 면이 많은거 같은데

특히 내 수중에 지역점수 카드가 들어왔다고 하면

귀신같이 알고 그 지역에다가 영향력 깝니다

특히 재조정..

너무 ai한테 유리한거 같습니다

3점짜리 분쟁지역을 한방에 바로 날리는거 보면..

나는 한 수십번 해야 성공해야 말까인데..

이 점은 좀 빡치게 합니다 

그래도 시작하면 시간가는줄 모르고 하게됩니다

냉전사에 관심있는분이시면 꼭 한번 해보세요

review: excellent port of a fantastic game. review:
One of the best card driven wargames, number 1 on boardgamegeek.com for 6 years.
Now in digital format, in a very smooth transition.

I play it mostly on the phone, but online accounts are linked, which is nice.

There seem to be some unfixed bugs (Tacher card for example), but it is not that game breaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082437840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 137485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 618, 'playtime_at_review': 80726, 'last_played': 1712454588}
review: I was really excited when I heard that my favorite game was coming to PC, which for me has several advantages like not losing several minutes looking for specific counters, not having to organize everything after a match and most importantly being able to find other players, I live in a small town where very few people even heard of this game, but there are a few flaws that stop this game from being much better. First: time choises are extremely limited, there's no moderation and the developers apparently abandoned this game after releasing the Turn Zero DLC because there's no response about the bugs still present after many years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041961081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2453, 'last_played': 1659470873}
review: Adattamento eccellente di quello che penso sia uno dei più bei giochi da tavolo da due mai creati! Questo adattamento é BELLISSIMO, si gioca online sia in diretta che in differita, e la community é molto attiva. STRA CONSIGLIATO se amate i giochi di strategia. In solitario a volte l'IA si prende un po' troppo vantaggio, ma é un livello di sfida che contribuisce solo ad aumentare l'interesse. Inoltre, per chi non conoscesse il Gioco da tavola, ogni carta si basa su un evento reale, e si ha proprio la sensazione di governare una delle due superpotenze... Con lo spettro di una guerra nucleare. FANTASTICO!

review: A game for those that like strategy and thought over action, its a board game.  Tough game to understand especially as there is a lot of nuances to learn and this online version help is incomplete/doesn't help you easily keep track of rounds remaining and ops points needed.  However it is fun to experiment with different strategies and +10 handicap gives the beginner a chance to gain some experience as they play.
