author: {'steamid': '76561198978681129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1711116393}
review:
This is a faithful version of the (great) boardgame, and the only negative aspect is that the computer AI regularly hangs when making a decision, leaving a permanent 'waiting for Opponent to decide...' screen. This has happened in more than 50% of games I have played (i've played over 10 times at this point), and requires a full restart, which totally ruins the game.

I am playing on a MacBook Pro (2018), for reference.

If that was resolved, or if you are playing against other people, i'd recommend fully.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992880692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 11874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4231, 'last_played': 1694048695}
review:
Great way to play the board game on your computer. If you like the board game or enjoy PC games that mimic board games that are highly strategic and involved, this is for you.

Definitely a learning curve if you are not familiar with the board game.

PROS
-One of the most thoughtful and strategic board games out there
-Great integration of Theme and Mechanics. You may even learn a bit about history in the process.
-Games take between 1 to 4 hours
-Sounds and animations are simple but do add a little flavor to the game

CONS
-Only one type of game. No variations or alternative modes. If you don't intend to master the game, there is not a lot of replayability
-The AI has no difficulty setting. It is perfect for medium skill play, where you will lose if you are new and have an even match when somewhat familiar. But after a while you can enter every game confident you will win
-No over-arching advancement. No unlocks, xp, or anything to show for completing a game just the satisfaction of winning or the desire to try again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992262470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 60, 'playtime_at_review': 2608, 'last_played': 1711577448}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007138342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1696176405}
review:
I am a big board game fan and have heard good things about Twilight Struggle. I have never played the real version of the board game, but am enjoying play the digital version of this a lot. There are some good history lessons to be had about the Cold War here as well.

I had no idea how to play the game, but understood the rules after the tutorial and first game. There are a lot of concepts to take on, but I understood them soon enough and then begin to think about deeper strategies by game two.

My only issue is that after only fifteen hours of game-play, the AI has already become quite easy to beat. I might have to play a real person I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432554908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11462, 'last_played': 1703473573}
review:
Always been a fan of boardgames, and this is the best boardgame out there. The translation to computer program was done very well, and multiplayer is smooth. Never really encountered any bugs, and there are always people online to set up a match with. I like how you can set the clock for each player to be up to 40 days, so you don't have to dedicate a couple of hours to sit down and play a match, you can play it in chunks.

AI is easily beatable after you understand how the game works, but luckily, the foundation of this game is built on the active multiplayer community, and that is done very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035732528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1574741486}
review:
Faithful reproduction of one of my favorite board games. Overall recommended, but not without issues and disappointments.

Pros: The interfaces is very intuitive for someone who knows the board game, he AI seems decent, the soundtrack is excellent, and the Turn Zero DLC adds a few neat twists to keep the game fresh even for people like me who have been playing TS over the board for years.

Cons: Somewhat buggy on certain combinations of die roll modifiers, crashes sometimes on Linux. Autosaves after every action round though, so you usually don't actually lose any progress. The developer does not seem to be supporting the game anymore, so I'm assuming this is the finished product, which is kind of a bummer. The Turn Zero DLC is good enough that I'd like to see more.

Overall 4/5, definitely got my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036115434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1667747167}
review:
iOS(아이패드)로 구입해 플레이한 시간까지 합하면 5시간 정도 될 것 같습니다.

일대일 대결에 초점을 맞춘 세력 싸움(땅따먹기) 보드게임으로, 
플레이 방식이 꽤나 독특합니다.

정치의 매커니즘을 반영하려는 듯 내 선택이 항상 자신에게 유리하게만 작용하지 않는데요,
셔플되어 자기 손에 들어오는 카드들 때문에 그렇습니다.

게임의 진행 방식은 굉장히 단순(?) 합니다.
각자 소련, 혹은 미국의 역할을 맡고, 손에 쥔 카드 중 한장을 꺼내어 
아래 중 하나의 행동을 취하면 됩니다.

(1) 카드 귀퉁이에 적힌 숫자 점수에 맞게 여러 국가들에 영향력 행사 
    (이 영향력이 해당 국가의 안정도를 넘어서면 지배를 하게 됩니다)

(2) 카드 지문에 적힌대로 효과 적용 

(3) 카드 귀퉁이에 적힌 숫자를 기준으로 주사위를 굴려 
     특정 국가의 미소련 영향력을 조정하거나 쿠테타 시도

(4) 우주 개발 

여기에서 문제는 자기 손에 들어오는 카드가 무조건 자신에게 
유리하게만 작용하는 건 아니라는 점입니다. 

미국, 소련, 중립 이렇게 세 그룹으로 유리하게 작용하는 카드가 들어오기 때문에, 위에 서술한 진행 방식 중에 어떤 걸 선택해야할지 큰 고민에 빠지게 되는 것이죠. 만약 자신이 미국을 플레이 중인데 소련에게 굉장히 유리한 카드가 들어왔다면, 2번보다 1, 3, 4번을 시도하는 게 낫습니다. 그리고 1, 3, 4번 중에서도 현재 보드판 상황에 따라 심도있는 고민이 수반되죠. 저도 배워가는 입장이다보니 간략하게 설명드린 것이고, 사실은 이보다 복잡한 이해 관계와 규칙들이 얽혀 있습니다.

실제 역사를 기반으로 제작된 게임이다보니 테마의 깊이가 상당하고, 이에 대한 몰입도는 훌륭한 편입니다. 다만 주사위라는, 확률과 운에 기대는 게임 방식은 다소 김이 새는 부분입니다. 실물 보드게임 상의 주사위라면 던지는 맛이라도 있지, 디지털로 던지는 주사위는 클릭 한번만으로 바로 결과가 나오기에 나쁜 숫자가 나오면 묘한 억울함이 생깁니다.

게임에 큰 영향을 주진 않습니다만, 배경 음악, 효과음, 그리고 카드 안에 삽입된 사진이나 그림을 감상하는 소소한 재미도 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005130438', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1569769041}
review:
Rigged. Abysmally rigged. 
The original game is already asymmetric and heavily against USSR, but with dice rolls completely in favour of the AI it's impossible to get even to the last phase, if you play Soviets there's no coups for you, no space race, no reallignments. 
And mostly you get US cards (and in this game you cannot discard them most of the time. 
I'm going for a refund even if it's like 4€ because someone misunderstood frustration for challenge and I'm fed up with punitive gameplay based on RNG, and when a single aleatory roll can condemn your entire game, it's a crappy game to play. 
Before getting some GIT GUD shrewd comments: I played this game for >10 years and yes it's hard to play USSR and not 50:50 win rate but this dice rolls are so skewed I feel ashamed for those who tought they're fair.

review: Twilight Struggle is a fantastic strategy game with an excellent Cold War theme. The cards are based on historical events, which really adds to the game. It will take a few games to get used to the mechanics and tactics, but it is really fun once you get the hang of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202913131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 408, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1569252239}
review:
《Twilight Struggle》一款以第二次世界大战结束后的冷战为故事背景的双人策略型桌游。游戏主要以瓜分第二次世界大战后的世界格局为主要玩法，通过卡牌效果的模式决定游戏过程中的决定胜负的点数。游戏中的卡牌通常都是基于一定的历史时间设定的，在游戏的卡牌浏览一栏可以查看卡牌背后的历史事件。游戏有着颇为详实的教程，不过上手后需要一定时间来精通。游戏的可玩性很高，是非常优秀的桌游移植作品。

[h1]游戏体验[/h1]
游戏因为采用了冷战题材，所以就是一款双人对抗游戏，玩家分别代表这美国和苏联阵营，其余国家都是美苏需要去争取的对象，当然游戏中有个特殊的国家设定，那就是中国，这也听符合历史的，中国对应的卡牌在游戏中属于斡旋类型的，就是两边都可以从中获利。游戏里也的确非常好的体现了冷战的含义，玩家过多的发动侵略战争（热战）会触发核战，从而导致双方都毁灭，当然游戏里还是会结算核战时点数多的玩家为胜者。所以游戏的主要策略就是发动政变，策反敌人，发动局部战争，太空竞赛，通过这些不断地限制对手。

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1871039888

[h1]卡牌模式与掷骰子[/h1]
游戏的一些列操作采用的是卡牌模式，也就是说游戏中玩家使用的策略具有一定的随机性。因此也需要玩家随机应变，从而造就多样的策略战术。这也为游戏增加了许多可玩性。

游戏中的掷骰子环节也是随机性很大啊！为游戏带来了太多不确定性因素，也让游戏可能在瞬间就发生局势的扭转。

[h1]历史的还原[/h1]
游戏以美苏冷战为背景，游戏除了在大多数游戏规则设定上体现了冷战的特色外，在卡牌的名称和背景介绍上可以说是直接搬来了历史课本，在游戏的设置选项里，玩家可以查看到所有卡牌的详细信息，每张卡牌底部有一个历史背景介绍按钮，打开后可以查看到卡牌对应的历史时间的详细介绍。

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1870938766

[h1]游戏教程[/h1]
游戏教程颇为详实，可以让新手玩家快速适应和熟悉游戏的流程，当然游戏上手还是有难度的，但是值得花时间去研究。除了互动性很强的新手教程外，游戏还提供了更为详实的文字版教程，需要进阶的玩家可以去翻阅查询。

[h1]联网体验[/h1]
游戏的联网体验也很出色，同样第一次登陆需要注册一个账号，当然除了提供官服务器外，也就是作作产品的推广了，毕竟桌游厂商应该还是要靠卖实体桌游赚钱吧。然后联网对战时可以提供掉线再联的，这也为网络不稳定的玩家提供了便利。

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1871039691

[h1]总结[/h1]
少有的实体桌游和电子桌游都取得成功的游戏，当然游戏的电子版也还是哟很多方面受到了实体桌游的限制，不过想想能在方寸之间体验一回冷战也是一件非常棒的事情啊！介于游戏的精通难度，游戏还是推荐给那些喜欢桌游或者回合制策略游戏的玩家，相信你们也不会辜负游戏的精彩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198320279527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1708013584}
review:
Meh.

Look, I love the board game. And in a way I love the digital version. The UI is great, the AI can be challenging without being impossible, and the multiplayer is easy to use. I rarely have trouble with this game. But there's one big problem that makes this game nearly unplayable for me, and it's one that I think can be fixed. That's the arbitrary win conditions. Most digital games I play don't reach a "normal" win condition. Instead, I reach some weird win condition that only exists because of quirks in the rules and not because of the actual strategy of the game. These are win conditions that wouldn't happen if you were playing a live game with reasonable people.

For example, when the DEFCON is 2 and USSR plays CIA created, the US can end the game by a coup in a battleground state using the card's effect. This ends the game. But who wins? The USSR for playing the card, or the US for actually starting thermonuclear war? In real life, I would choose the USSR, because it's the US's fault. But in the digital version, the US can cause thermonuclear war and then win the game.

Another weird win condition is the "no holding scoring cards" rule. In a real life game, this rule is just there to make sure that the scoring cards get played. In real life, I would just keep playing with the penalty being that both players are now aware who has the scoring card, but there's no "continue playing" option in the digital version. In my most recent game, the USSR played Bear Trap. They proceeded to lose their next 3 rounds discarding cards and got stuck with ME Scoring, thus losing the game. I literally won the game because the AI beat themselves using the dumbest lose condition available in the game. This was not the first time something like this had happened.

If this gets fixed, I'll be happy. It's a great game, but without a "continue playing" option for when stupid wins happen, it's difficult to use this digital version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320595579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 27397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 146, 'playtime_at_review': 4768, 'last_played': 1712278420}
review:
냉전시대를 배경으로 두 명의 플레이어가 각각 미국과 소련이 되어 플레이하는 파워 게임.
실제로 있었던 역사적인 사건들을 배경으로 하는 카드들을 통해 세계에 상대보다 더 많은 영향력을 행사해야하는 게임이다.
긱스에서 몇 년 동안이나 1위를 차지했던 게임이니 보드게임을 좋아하시는 분이라면 안심하고 구매하시면 된다.
AI가 돌머리라는 것이 약간의 단점이지만, 역으로 이 때문에 AI를 어떻게 관광보낼지도 생각해볼 수 있게 되어 온갖 속박 플레이가 가능하다는 것도 장점이라면 장점.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114229530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 34574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16913, 'last_played': 1700419811}
review:
As a bit of  a historic nerd myself, I think this game is a fantastic strategy game/board game. It is one of the best board game adaptations on Steam. Play as either the Soviets or the Americans for world domination in the Cold War. The objective of the game is either gain 20 points, force your opponent onto DEFCON 1 or have the most points in the end of the game. Gain control of as many countries as possible is your way of winning. Controlling "battleground states" is a must.

I think this game is a very good way of increasing your interest/ understanding of the Cold War. It gains a sort of understanding of the different events in the Cold War and makes you ask questions. For example, one question it makes you ask is why didn't the Soviets play more interest in Iran in the Cold War, when it is a big part of Twilight Struggle. This makes you go and research into history. Indeed, the "Cold War" channel on Youtube is a good one to look through. Another part of the game I like is it makes you think about the current situation of global politics. Indeed, I think there is a real opening for a new version of this game but for the struggle between China and America today. 

There are common strategies in this game but no two games are ever the same and you are bound to return to playing it simply because it is so enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304402386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 76830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1664, 'last_played': 1701884881}
review:
FIRST REVIEW AFTER ONE WEEK:
Absolutely amazing game. If you like strategy games, this is probably the best one there is. Slight draw back with the latest release -- it crashes. A lot. Sometimes two or three times per game. And that's on my Mac. But the game itself: it can't be faulted.

REVIEW AFTER ONE MONTH:
This is still an amazing game. (Oh, hear the giant BUT coming)....

But, it has some issues. Yes, it crashes. A lot. But it is also horribly buggy. And if you're not looking, you won't notice - but boy is it there. The computer AI plays Warsaw Pact as an event... then doesn't bother to take advantage of it (chooses to remove all US influence in Eastern Europe when there is none). The dice rolls aren't random. No, this isn't a bad player whining. On my version, playing as the US the AI Russian *ALWAYS* rolls a six on the Korean war. Every time. The same happens if the AI makes an opening coup on Italy with a 4 Ops card. Every time. Other rolls seem variable enough (Whether they're random or pseudorandom I don't know - I haven't charted them). Upon snagging every battlefield in Europe, if you overcontrol them, the AI just gives up - guaranteeing you victory. I've used Five Year Plan to force the other player to discard... and then the US event doesn't trigger. There are quite a few of these little quirks throughout the game. If the Russian AI gets Defectors, it often headlines it. This is an extremely unlikely move for a human player and it's vanishingly unlikely to be the best strategy for an AI either. These flaws are a shame - it is a fantastic game. But it's been out long enough with enough players reporting these faults (and similar others) that they should have been fixed.

Did I mention it crashes three times a game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198003880852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1687983208}
review:
The digital adaptation of a boardgame that is considered to be within the Top #5 of all competitive boardgames in existence (right up there with Chess itself).

It's nicely detailed, with a solid historical background, with intricate, but not unnecessarily confusing mechanics and a very ambitious and competitive 1on1 gameplay.

And, for people who prefer Solitaire games, the biggest plus: This game actually has a VERY good AI. Zero cheats, just very clever decisionmaking and actually strategy. 

Overall, a very solid strategy game that I can definitely recommend.

review: The video game version is a lot easier to play and understand than the tabletop game, which is already the #1 board game in the world (according to Board Game Geek), and this adds up to an awesome experience. In addition, the AI is very challenging and doesn't miss an opportunity to punish every mistake you make. Would recommend if you like a sort of advanced chess with nuclear stakes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000525316', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1610675781}
review:
This is the smoothest board game adaptation I've ever played.

IRL Twilight Struggle is a real pain in the ass. There's lots of rules, lots of finicky counters, lots of simple math. 

This version simplifies all that with a clean, clear interface. It's intuitive and easy to learn, thanks to a clear and well thought-out tutorial. The AI is a bit predictable, but it's a good opponent for those learning the game for the first time.

On top of all that, this digital version has a sinister soundtrack that helps establish the tension and foreboding of the Cold War.

It's real good. Bryan Reynolds has an online series where he talks through the thought process for games against high-level opponents, which is worth checking out once you've learned the basics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073635672', 'num_games_owned': 1260, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1561870604}
review:
A very good representation of the board game.
You play one of the great powers (USSR or USA) during the cold war and you struggle for influence all across the world. Essentially it is a card game and every card represents a real event which occurred between '45 and '89. It is a constant back and fourth. The supports online play and also has a good AI if you want to play solo.
In short, I recommend it but if you haven't play the board game you deffinetly need the tutorial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337684950', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 5522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2456, 'last_played': 1637590211}
review:
在战略类游戏中能把外交主题用非常好的核心玩法和底层语言呈现出来，在桌游类游戏中也是同类的电子化以及卡牌契合性上的榜样。它取得的成绩名副其实，对我个人的设计也有明显的积极影响，但也难逃桌游类的窠臼：
①有对骰子结果进行控制但较为微弱，运气依然与策略产生相反的游戏体验；
②游戏语言的翻译较为松散繁复，未经统一化的雕琢，增加新手认知成本；
③棋盘策略的定式化，以及这些定式化棋盘策略与手牌牌型的相关性较小；
④卡牌控制力在棋盘幅度下略显狭窄，卡牌间及卡牌与棋盘的配合少而拆招多。

author: {'steamid': '76561198132723133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1565269671}
review: Отличный перенос великолепной настольной игры на ПК. Отдельно хочется выделить прекрасное музыкальное сопровождение, которое держит в напряжении до конца партии и усиливает впечатление от противостояния в холодной войне.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025521889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1644120791}
review:
Don't be scared.  It looks like a really grognardy wargame, but it doesn't take as long to wrap your head around as you think.  Once you've got the hang of it, it's a very clever game of action management.  Every turn, you have many things to deal with, and not enough actions to deal with them.  Should you make a coup, to try and flip a key country?  Play a powerful event to crack open enemy territory?  Place influence to expand your reach?  Keep fighting over the Middle East or open up a new front in South America?  And how are you going to accomplish all that when you've got a hand full of events that help the Soviets?

The one criticism I have is that the "Defcon Suicide" mechanic is very unintuitive.  If it's your turn and you play a card that lets your *opponent* drop Defcon to 1, it's *your* fault for triggering nuclear war.  This leads to very weird situations like "Hosting the Olympics causes a nuclear war."  Thankfully, the game will warn you before you play a card that can screw you like this.

review:
Best strategy board game, true to its physical tabletop version. Better if you already learned how to play the physical version though, because the digital version pace is faster and sometimes confusing if you're not familiar with the rules. 
Set the playtime to over 3-4 hours minimum, because this is hard core strategy thinking board game. Love it. 5/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003837486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1675716889}
review:
+ I like the context of this game, the cold war and the fight for influence over the world is really nice.

+ The fact to always searching for the best solution how to use bad cards without ruining your strategy.

- Game is unbalanced, USSR always have access to the coups first, playing first, their events are really much stronger than the USA ones. My results: playing USSR => 16 victories, playing USA => 1 victory.

- Theres is too much randomness. You can spend 8 turns to build your influence pretty well, and then next turn, you just have the worst cards ever, which ruin completely your game and strategy. This has too much influence on the game. One game I've lost 17 victory points just because of bad cards (3 scoring cards + mostly ugly red cards while playing USA)...

- It could have been nice to have a warning before going to Nuclear War.

- Too many animations slowing down the game, click click click and click again and again...

- Some cards make you win the game instantly... Just why? What's the point?

author: {'steamid': '76561198883081066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1630119318}
review:
人気ボードゲームのデジタル版。
現実同様の世界地図を舞台に冷戦下のアメリカ、ソ連、に分かれて諸国の支配を奪い合う2人プレイ用の陣取りゲーム。
全てのアクションの解決に百枚以上にも及ぶカードを使用するところが特徴となっていて、これらのカードはすべて歴史上の出来事をフレーバーとしているがうまくゲーム内容に落とし込まれており没入感も高い。
ゲーム中の運要素はそれなりにあり、いくつかのアクションはサイコロの出目のみで成功／失敗が判定されるため局所的に見ると運の比重が大きいが運だけでも勝てないのでなかなかバランスは良い。
また、デジタル版では対AI戦が実装がされていて、このAIがなかなか強いため練習相手として申し分ない。もちろんオンラインでの対人戦も可能。
ルール自体はそれほど複雑なほうではないのだが戦略的な自由度が高いため、最初のうちは勝ち方がわからにくい部分がある。長い場合1ゲームに2時間程度かかるボリュームも考えると人を選ぶゲームではあるが、何度かやってるうちにきっと面白くなるのでぜひプレイしてみてほしい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198043401618', 'num_games_owned': 1802, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 101277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 569, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1712422112}
review:
[h1][b] Class Struggle [/b][/h1]

This game has an amazing strategic and tactical depth, and depicts the Cold War with both humor and neutrality. The recommendation does come with serious warnings:

[h1] A warning to the casual gamer [/h1]
The game is complicated and has a steep learning curve. The tutorial gives most the required information but it's so much to take in that you will inevitably fail your first few games, get confused much, and go back to the tutorial.

You need to learn all the cards by heart so you can use (and counter) them effectively. New cards get added each phase so it takes a long time to learn all, and the only way to learn is by failing.

[h1] A warning to the hardcore gamer [/h1]
Despite the highly tactical nature of placing pegs and planning surprise moves, there are just too many base actions and cards that rely on dice rolls. The roll outcomes are often critical, get a 1 three times in a row and you could pretty much put yourself in an unrecoverable position.

A big shame as it feels like the game could have been designed with less RNG in mind and still work just as fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053806936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1556905614}
review:
I got it for a buck via Humble Bundle. 

So, beside wasting a dollar, I also lost time playing an over complicated, slow game thats yet another variant of  requiring memorizing card combinations and victory being determined by who gets lucky on a draw and some dice rolls.

Its not really strategy, due to the luck needed on so many roll based cards, and on getting the right card draws. Its slow, its unfriendly to a new player. Tutorial is worthless. Don't bother playing as the US as a new player.

There are better ways to spend your time than this, even at a buck. Not even worth it if it was free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198947984338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1554748854}
review:
Игра очень необычная, классная, затягивает, неплохо убивает время)
Плюсы
1. Сеттинг Холодной войны
2. Карточки исторических событий - любители МО заценят)
3. Изи ту плей, хард ту мастер (на 8 партий за СССР лишь 2 победы, ну это может я такой лох просто ахах)
4. Очень качественная проработка. Как бы случайно карты не выпадали, все равно будет соблюдаться последовательность основных событий Холодной войны более-менее. Плюс игра превращается в очень сбалансированное противостояние равных по силе игроков, которые пытаются перехитрить друг друга. Это необычно.
5. Прекрасное звуковое и музыкальное оформление
6. Классный дизайн

Минусы.
1. Низкая реиграбельность. 
2. Долгие, очень долгие партии (что помноженное на низкую реиграбельность делает игру со временем скучной)
3. Очень высокая роль фактора случайности. Иначе говоря победа зависит от того, в чьих руках инициатива в начале игры. Все мои 2 победы за СССР произошли в Early game. И это было тотальное доминирование, и по очкам, и по регионам. Иногда выпадают одни карты США, иногда - одни карты СССР. А поражения происходили в большинстве своем из-за того, что DEFCON падал до 1. 
4. Параллельно с фактором случайности складывается такое ощущение, что ИИ раздает один и тот же набор в начале игры с незначительными вариациями.
5. Низкий онлайн. Очень низкий. По сетке играть можно разве что с другом)
6. Высокий порог вхождения. Нужно попотеть, прежде чем въедешь в суть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358903451', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 5724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 24, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1711827727}
review:
Никогда до этого не играл в настолки. 
Попробовал - понравилось. Игра довольно глубокая, уже второй вечер играю - и только начинаю освоение. 
Как игра сама по себе - классная. Реально классная. Очень захватывает эта борьба за влияние. От игрока требуется тонкий расчёт и умение думать сильно наперёд. 
Считать игру каким-то пособием по истории - не стоит. 
Неплохо переданы некие базовые (совсем базовые) основы геополитики и некая часть логики подобных противостояний (как писали когда-то авторы оригинальной настолки - регион становится важным потому, что он важен для противника). 
Эффекты карточек порой непонятно вообще как связаны с событием в реальной жизни. Например, карта "Пятилетний план" - они пишут, что экономические планы вносили лишь раздрай в работу экономики Совдепа и таким образом это карта работает на США. Но простите, проблемы экономики СССР - это проблемы всей административно-командной системы. Если бы не эти планы, то всё бы не развивалось вообще. Это как считать колёса плохого автомобиля причиной того, что он плох. 
Или например - почему Горбачёв - это полезная карта для СССР? Можно конечно по-разному относиться к Михаилу Сергеевичу, но игра-то у нас - про политику сверхдержав, а именно Горбачёв выступал против сверхдержавной политики СССР и таким образом в той сфере, которую охватывает игра, он сыграл однозначно негативную роль, если смотреть с т.з. апологета экспансии СССР. 
Есть и ошибки. Например, на американской карте "Атомные подводные лодки" изображена... советская ПЛАРБ проекта 941. Она же "Акула", она же "Тайфун". Неужто было трудно найти красивую фотку АПЛ США? Того же легендарного "Наутилуса". Казалось бы - мелочь, но ведь из таких картинок состоит 99% игрового контента. 
Это раздражает. Ещё раздражает то, что нельзя например одновременно включить Тёрн Зироу и китайскую гражданскую войну. Ведь было бы интересно - все ивенты в Тёрн Зироу происходят, кроме китайской ГВ, а последнюю мы делаем в рамках игровых механик. Но увы. 
За исключением этих недостатков, игра абсолютно замечательная. 
8 из 10.

review:

Bought TS a long time ago. I hadn't played in quite a while. Didn't have many technical problems before. But now can't get passed turn 2 before it hangs. Tried reinstalling; still no dice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006745577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9375, 'last_played': 1698164237}
review:
Single player: if you're a novice like I was the single player will still rock you. After a while you will notice some poor strategic decisions that you can exploit. Still, it's a fun challenge and a good way to learn the cards, card scenarios, and improve your gameplay. I'm confused by folks who say the AI takes too long--the computer AI takes about 10 seconds to decide its turn in my games and you can see a timer that goes around the avatar. It's not immediate but not too troubling for me.

The only frequent bug I notice is that the AI will not realign its full allotment of moves from time to time. In other words if it has a 3 Ops card it may only realign two times and pass on its third attempt. It's not gamebreaking, just a poor AI decision.

A lot of great positive reviews of MP which I will defer to since they all reflect my views.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051966592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1708, 'last_played': 1675205499}
review:
It's an excellently functional digital adaption of a game that was the top rated board game on BoardGameGeek for years on end and as of this review is still #5.

For me this game scratches the same itch as Chess. You can read pages of theory online as to when you should consider the COMECON gambit or what the safest turn to send Fidel Castro into space is. Even though it can be a little random because of draws or dice rolls, don't get it twisted: this is absolutely a strategically deep game. You can also buy a copy for yourself and a copy for your friend on the other side of the country for half the price of a physical version, less when on sale. There's even a reasonably active player base online. There's even AI that is useful for learning how to play the game (although it won't be too long before you're absolutely crushing them).

If you have any interest in board games at all I really can't recommend this enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142145723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1650135973}
review:
Non ho mai giocato alla versione da tavola del gioco, ma dalle partite fatta questa trasposizione mi sembra un ottimo modo per imparare le basi del gioco. 

Il manuale è sintetico ma esaustivo e l'interfaccia di gioco è ottima e aiuta a capire velocemente che cosa puoi o non puoi fare durante il tuo turno. 

Unica nota dolente è l'IA: se si gioca con l'URSS infatti, l'IA non sembra in grado di rispondere e di offrire una sfida a un giocatore minimamente competente. Al contrario, se si gioca con gli USA, la partita è un po' bilanciata anche se, superata una certa soglia, l'IA stenta a star dietro al giocatore.

P.S. se qualcuno che sta leggendo vuole fare qualche partita online (non troppo competitiva :D) mi aggiunga pure

author: {'steamid': '76561198245987738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1622702456}
review:
将近13个小时，终于用美国和苏联各赢了一次操牌傻了吧唧的电脑。简单写写这个游戏。
（玩过实体版桌游的大佬不用看下去，肯定要补票的）
首先是《冷战热斗》的受众，明显是对冷战时期历史比较熟悉或者感兴趣的玩家，诸如杜鲁门主义，朝鲜战争，《禁止大气层核试验公约》，东欧剧变等富有冷战色彩的词汇都可以在这个桌游中遇到，对冷战或者历史不感兴趣的玩家可以绕道。
其次是这游戏应不应该买。由于暂时没有汉化，推荐有英文基础的玩家玩教程关了解规则，然后和电脑对战作为新手练习。如果英语苦手或者像我一样玩完教程关规则还是半懂不懂的话，建议先和电脑打几局，然后去网上找规则讲解的视频，这样理解起来比较快。（冷战热斗贴吧里有国内平台，也可以玩那个）
规则大致熟悉了以后，就可以想办法打赢电脑了，总体来说只要出牌与布点尽可能对自己有利的话，还是不难的。
当然，打赢电脑只是入门的开始，至于后续的PVP以及DLC新玩法还是去贴吧或者相关的群找大佬带吧，我也是新人，帮不到各位了。

review: Twilight Struggle is often considered the best two-player board game ever made. The trouble with it is that there's so many things to keep track of (did you remember Flower Power? Iron Lady?) that it's easy to make a mistake and play the game incorrectly. This computerized version fixes all that - it plays the game correctly, by the book, and so I highly recommend this version. It's frustrating at times due to there being a little too much randomness for my tastes, but overall it is a fantastic game that makes you think, and rewards you for playing well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966299106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1549159497}
review:
I would say this game sucks bad, but I only played about an hour and a half. I can say definitively that I did not have fun during that hour and a half. It seems mostly random who wins and loses. I had a turn where I drew almost all 1 power cards that all gave huge benefits to USSR. WHELP. Meanwhile USSR coup'ed every battleground in the middle east and rolled nothing but 5 and 6. Thanks RNGsus. Then I was forced to play the middle east score card so he made out like a bandit. The next turn the draw pile got reshuffled and he got the middle east score card, which he played immediately for double damage. The game just takes a dump on you and there is nothing you can even do about it. 

When will devs realize random != fun? Here is a good idea for a game: we all put our name in a hat, and whoever has their name pulled out of the hat WINS! WHAT FUN! Its a lottery. They have created a lottery. A dumb lottery that takes an hour and a half to punch you in the balls.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987613673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1668142659}
review:
I've played several games of TW (vs. AIs). I find them good enough to beat me fairly often. 

I don't know that I've seen bugs, but not certain on that. Several times I thought I ought to be able to select certain locations for coups or realignment roles and it wouldn't let me. It would be nice to have more information in the form of a popup if you tried to click on an invalid location with a note saying WHY that location is disallowed. By my reading of the rules, I think some of them should have been valid. 

I had some trouble finding the rules relating to DEFCON levels and what limits they impose on coups or realignments, etc. That needs to be easier to find and if again if there were some popups when you tried to select an invalid location for a function that described why it wasn't valid (including being at a particular DEFCON level or as the result of a prior play of a card that changed what can happen at a location), then there wouldn't be any confusion. As it is, sometimes I feel like I ought to be able to do something and the game won't let me and it isn't clear why. 

Other than that, the game seems to work well and the data presented is understandable. 

I hope they make 1960's Making of a President as well. I'd like to see someone do the Montezeuma's war game from this series, but they'd first have to fix the entirely disfunctional and unclear rules that the original board game came with (it's like there's a great and interesting game lurking somewhere in there, but the rules are keeping it from escaping into the land of playability.... and I suspect the designer just missed explaining bits very clearly....). 

Happy to have this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970604245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 28839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 138, 'playtime_at_review': 6262, 'last_played': 1712418474}
review:
Un jeu trés prenant, qui exploite bien son cadre (la guerre froide) sans pour autant en faire pâtir les mécaniques du jeu. Le hasard est bien dosé car selon la manière dont vous allez choisir de jouer vous allez pouvoir lui donner une place plus ou moins grande. 

Les erreurs se payent chères une partie est sopuvent riche en rebondissement: on peut croire la partie perdue ou gagnée des les premiers tours, mais on s'accroche et à la fin des 10 tours on se rend compte que c'était beaucoup plus sérré que ce que l'on imaginait. Il demandera au joueur débutant d'accepter de se prendre quelques raclées au début (un 10aine je dirai), le temps de comprendre les erreurs grossières à éviter. Un système de classement des joueurs, calqué sur celui des échecs, permettra ensuite de choisir un adversaire plus ou moins à sa portée et de progresser petit à petit.

C'est devenu l'un de mes jeux préféré et je trouve que l'outil informatique apporte un vrai plus au jeu par rapport à la version plateau: certes, on perd le plaisir de se retrouver avec un ami pour jouer mais il devient possible de jouer avec des joueurs du monde entier à toute heure (avis aux noctambules!) et la gestion des marqueurs est grandement simplifiée. Quand j'ai le temps, j'adore commencer ma journée avec une petite tasse de café et une petite partie en ligne.

review: Not the easiest game to learn but a great strategy game with a great theme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037900007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 12994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 72, 'playtime_at_review': 6399, 'last_played': 1712307861}
review: This review is based on single player only and the PC viewpoint as ive never played the boardgame. Its a easy game to pick up although a fair amount of luck is needed as things can wrong really quickly if you are dealt the wrong cards.No bugs as far as i can tell and its never crashed, but if your a player who plans out methodical strategy and thinks the AI cheats every single time your going to HATE this game, first off the opposing side goes first so your going to be playing catch up or limiting damage, secondly your strategy is card based so if you dealt a lot of problems kiss your carefully built up advantages goodbye, thirdly yeah i think the AI cheats and only because out of hundreds of games ive only won maybe at most ten and then only due to random events.Having said all that i think this is a fantastic game i play for that ok ive lost the last 12 in a row 1 more and ill quit factor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035656732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1674683304}
review:
Après avoir fait une partie de ce jeu sur plateau j'ai décidé d'acheter la version numérique. Je trouve l'adaptation fidèle. C'est en anglais certes mais les régles du jeu en francais et les traductions des cartes sont disponibles sur le net.
Il ne faut pas s'étonner de perdre les première parties, même face à l'IA, (peut être que vous ferez mieux que moi ceci dit.. ;) ) Quoi qu'il en soit on apprend vite de ses erreures.
A noter que je n'ai pas acheté les extentions et n'ai pas encore fait de partie multijoueur mais j'apprécie ce jeu.

Pour info les USA sont bien plus difficile à jouer que les russes, même avec l'option "guerre civile chinoise". Les débutants mieux vaut vous faire la main avec le soviétique. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028907823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2653, 'last_played': 1654344830}
review:
Bought this game to learn the rules for the boardgame, now becoming addicted :)

Excellent rendition of the graphics and gameplay, plus a haunting soundtrack with real cold war soundbites for effect.

AI plays a mean game, seems to 'instinctively' know your hand if you have scoring cards and goes for the jugular.

All in all I would thoroughly recommend this to all boardgamer pals and strategists looking for a demanding challenge.

** update **  AI is a great game tutor, but becomes predictable and does not use events well. Best played against humans after you've learned the rules and unlocked the non-bugged achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964064136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1647673921}
review:
I am going to give this game a "thumbs up" even though I am very disappointed with it and probably will never play it again. I know a *lot* about the Cold War, having grown up in it and having studied international relations and the Soviet Union for most of my university education.  When I found this game I was incredibly stoked: I instantly recognized and knew the history of all but two of the cards in the game.  I understood the basic strategies and tactics, and as I began to play I could see history re-written.  Then I lost, over and over again through weird, abstract situations.  Also, the computer opponent would push the world into nuclear war, and win!  I double-checked the rules and sure enough, you can win by making the other side start the nuclear holocaust.  As I studied the game strategies, the ways to use the cards, the placing and manipulating counters on the world map, the turns and action rounds, the DEFCON level, and other aspects of play, the appeal of the game was sucked out.  It turns out that many of the actual game mechanics are not accurate and end up being highly contrived.  For example, the DEFCON level instantly shoots up to 2 and stays there (in reality it has only been reached twice, during the Cuban Missile Crisis and the First Gulf War), and is simply used for most of the game to prevent your opponent from taking various actions.  And as noted above, one way you can win is to cause a nuclear holocaust, so long as you can blame the opponent (which is the complete opposite of the Cold War, because the goal of each side was to win *without* starting a nuclear war).  Playing with anything more than a passing nod to historical realities means near-certain failure.

I am still recommending this game because it is a good strategy game for its own sake if you don't care about accuracy.  It's well balanced (unless you use the optional Turn Zero expansion's "what if's"), the mechanics are good, and you can play it repeatedly with different results each time.  There's dice rolling and other RNG elements, but you win mostly through your own play.  And as another reviewer noted, you can learn a lot about a crucial period of history that has in many ways defined our modern world if you pay attention to the text of the cards. Download the 450-page game guide on TwilightStrategy.com and read the introductory sections about whether this is the right game for you; there's a good summary and checklist.  On the other hand, it is so inexpensive that you might as well just buy the basic game and try it out. And remember, there'll be no fighting in the War Room ...

2022 edits: some typos, a bit of trimming down, and a bit of additional commentary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025340447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3455, 'last_played': 1538942898}
review:
I really want to like this game, I have never played the board game and was recommended it from a friend who is.   I've been playing it for a month now and while I enjoy the strategy and methodology of the game, the inability to save inbetween rounds really sucks when you're trying to learn it. 

I get that the point is to learn from bad moves, but it allows for no chance for experimentation for tactics or getting a better idea of why not to play certain cards in certain situations.   The inconsistencies make it that much more difficult to learn. For instance, it makes no sense that the computer will warn you about potential defcon issue in one case but not another (eg. it will give you a warning on Olympic Games but not if you accidentially decided to coup a battleground country at defcon 2 -- I think it is something very easy to overlook if you're in the heat of playing the AI or playing intermittently between turns/rounds,  especially near the endgame -- unless I'm missing something, no rational player would intentionally coup a battleground at defcon 2, so why does it allow you to do it or at least do it without warning?  

Other design issues; I wish the inteface would just go ahead and clearly indicate what countries are coup-able.  It would also be nice to have a display of how many military ops you have to play aside from beginning of each action round -- it might be there but if it is, it's not in an intutive place. 

I realize these gripes might be the sign of a novice player, but at the same time, I'm not getting the sort of enjoyment or learning how to play the game any better.  I wouldn't even mind if these sorts of options were....optional.  I'm not playing for stats yet, I'm just trying to master the flow and strategy --, it's infuriating to get all the way to late war, way ahead on VPs, and then lose because of a boneheaded mistake due to some esoteric rule of the game or that the information that I would need to make a better decision isn't more clear. 

I think if you're coming from the boardgame to this, you'll probably find it really easy to adapt to it, but if you're approaching this fresh, it's just aggravating.

review: This game is very good.  I was apprehensive at first becuase every move feels like I am doing the wrong thing.  Once I realized that my early games were just going to be learning experiences, things really improved.  This is a great adaptation of the boardgame.  Actually it is better than the boardgame because it does all of the math for you.  Plus you can see the discard pile and removed pile.  Playdek did a great job on this digital version.

review: 讲真，我接触这款桌游一年多，对于我来说，他基本还原了这款桌游。AI的实力虽然不是特别强，但是也算是中规中矩了，尤其对于初学者来说，是很好的练习。除此以外，不需要担心游戏中存在语言障碍；虽然游戏语言是英语，但是对于绝大部分人来说，完全足够理解每一张卡牌上面的描述。总之，对于冷战热斗爱好者来说，还是很推荐这款游戏的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198278429557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1600775739}
review:
It's like the boardgame. Which means, good, strategic, thematic 1 v 1 game about Cold War. 

Not primarily a wargame, actually first one starting a nuclear war loses. But if you're not showing your military might via proxy wars and assisting coups, your credibility will suffer. So, it's always a balancing act. 

The game also teaches you about Cold War history, if you're into learning about that. The cards are based on real historical events.

But also has notable luck factor. So, a win can be taken from you when you get dealed a bad hand of cards, or roll of dice at critical turning point. While skill plays a bigger part. Just like in the boardgame. 

This game adds some nice things, that aren't in the boardgame

- Thematic music and historical sound clips like famous speeches played at appropriate moments. Really adds to the Cold War atmosphere
- All the math and scoring done for you
- You can't accidentally ruin the game, by remembering some rule wrong or neglecting a rule
- No arguments about a card effect in special situations, googling it up. All automatic
- You avoid the setup phase and cleaning the game back to storage box

The AI is okay for the most part. You can customize the influence handicap freely, so if you want more challenge, you can adjust this. There is no other difficulty level for the AI, just one and then you adjust the handicap. 

Main negative side is, that the AI does it's turns quite slow. Don't think CPU speed matters, since I have 8700K and it still seems sluggish. Haven't tested with other CPUs though, but I assume CPU doesn't play a factor. I have 16 GB of fast RAM too. It's not big deal, but kind of simple moves take quite bit of time. Some moves it does faster than human opponent would, some moves slower. Averaging same kind of speed for all decisions, no-brainers and complex ones. Which can get a bit annoying ("Oh comeoooon!"), when it's the no-brainer ones. 

Gives you some extra time to plan your next move though. But I think it should be faster, 8700K is basically an insanely powerful calculator, that should crunch the involved math easily. Although, to be fair, against human opponent you would probably wait much longer, overall. But it's a bit different, as playing IRL is also a social interaction situation.

Multiplayer is included, and I guess that's the main way this game is to be played. There is no local multiplayer, and it doesn't really work due to the nature of the game (Cards are hidden from opponent)

Would probably enjoy playing against a human opponent, but I was looking for something to fit into my schedule. I give it an okay, but with a NO recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018916483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 4072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1951, 'last_played': 1658541254}
review: I have not played against the AI and cannot address any issues there. As far as playing against friends, this digital adaption of the board game is near-perfect. It is worth the money alone just for the tutorial which teaches you how to play the game 1000 times better than the manual that comes with the actual board game (which flat out sucks). And for those learning to play, the simple fact that the program will not let you make illegal moves will help refine attention to small details which are easily overlooked (of which there are plenty). Don't get me wrong, this is one of the greatest board games ever made, and I love this port. If you want to learn the game, and have no one to teach you, this is the way to go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002857297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1620678062}
review:
I already own TS on Android and the board game, probably sunk at least 200-300 hours in this game in total. 

This is for me is the the best board games ever made. Unlike say Risk or Axis and Allies, you don't have perfect information on the game board at any time (since you don't know what cards your opponent holds), which leads to a very tense experience. I like how USSR and USA have distinct playing styles, and stronger/weaker phases in the game. It's symmetric, and asymetric at the same time, and a perfect mix of chance (or rather; odds and die rolls) and strategy. 

The AI is not the best, but at least it teaches you to play the game fairly well. It will also take advantage of DEFCON-situations (which can insta-lose you the game), which is good (and a bit unexpected since it is quite erratic in its general play). It's in MP this game really shines, and usually you can find a match in the MP lobby. 

For the price it is an absolute steal, and if you like strategy games you should buy ASAP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044011326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1484, 'last_played': 1659022755}
review:
I would highly reccomend this game, i have the physical product as well, a friend and i came across this whilst looking for a way to play twilgith struggle online.
the one thing I wish had been kept from the physical version that wasn't, is the turn system. 
in the video game, a regular turn system is used, a, then b, then a, then b, ect. however, in the physical version, and i think this adds a lot of a dynamic nature to the game, is a system that goes a, b, b, a, a, a, b, b, a, a, b ect.
failing an incorporation in the base game, if there is anyone with the inclination, and more importantly the modding and coding skills (which I distinctly lack) I would love to see this made.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970310844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5532, 'last_played': 1679027857}
review:
Playing this game causes the human brain to experience 100% utilization and lock up. But that’s only one piece of the puzzle required to accurately describe the overall experience. On top of going cross-eyed as your brain overheats, you will also undergo two significant types of emotional turmoil:

1) Trauma from the ass-pounding you just took during your opponent’s last turn/your last roll attempt/your new hand of cards.

2) Unrelenting and all-encompassing dread from the knowledge that essentially any action that you or your opponent makes is going to result in more of the trauma described in Type 1.

In the end, if you are playing this game correctly you will want to rage kill your opponent and then yourself regardless of whether you have won or lost.

A great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976626116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 9768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2856, 'last_played': 1695578437}
review:
Digital version of the analog boardgame.  The game itself is brilliant, and is one of best board games I've played.  It's very well balanced (each side has their strengths and weaknesses through the early, middle, and late war).  There is some chance involved, but it would take an extremely long set of bad rolls to ruin a game.  

The port to PC was very well done, and in some ways I prefer to play on the PC over the physical game (no setup time, and  keeping an eye on scoring in each region is a breeze).  The tutorial is well done, and should get even the most inexperienced person up and running in no time.  

The AI is tough at first, but soon you will be defeating it with ease.  It's good for learning the ropes, but it fails at preparing you to play another human.  

The MP lobby isn't super populated, but there's usually game to be found.  

Overall, a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198398807108', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2980, 'last_played': 1700107575}
review:
这个游戏真是太棒了 规则设置的非常贴近现实
可以看出来每一个国家的稳定度设计者都在还原冷战时期的真正状况
同时有极强的可玩性 不在最后一轮永远不知道你是否会赢
完全没有普通策略游戏的那种后期无聊的现象
同时该游戏有非常棒的教育意义
这个游戏完全可以说就是半部冷战史 并且每个卡牌还附有历史背景
让我了解到了冷战时期的大大小小的事件 
你们敢信就为了玩这个游戏我去读沈志华的冷战史了
多谢冷战热斗这款游戏 帮我打开了冷战史的大门

author: {'steamid': '76561198028365667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 13027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8992, 'last_played': 1655269536}
review: One of the best board games ever made. A very good digital representation of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184573725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1605443771}
review:
Game is great, implementation is good. But the AI is very disappointing.

I got stomped my first 2 games, lost the third...and can now beat it easily. Highly suspect, it leaves itself wide open to the "instant loss" condition - European Control, meaning all you have to do is stitch up Europe and get European Scoring. I have exploited this several times now. Also it leaves itself very open in Asia, is obsessed with military coups, frequently doesn't play influence in the strongest way and misplays events.

Disappointed and more than a bit puzzled. Seeing as the lobbies are deserted I can't recommend it right now....such a shame as the game itself is wonderful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972498416', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 6178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4929, 'last_played': 1703755754}
review:
This is probably the most well-designed board game since the invention of Chess. It's actually very similar in many ways. You must constantly think ahead of your opponent, anticipate their actions and plan ahead your own. 

The game is so well balanced that both players are consantly worried they can lose the game at any second. If you get the chance, buy the board game and play it. 

The Steam version is great. It's all the glory of Twilight Struggle with all the math done for you. You're allowed to check the scores in each region at any time, that way you can focus more on strategy and worry less about neglecting territory. Plus this game includes the additional cards (Kremlin Flu, etc), which you can disable if that's your preference. 

Single player AI sometimes makes dumb decisions. DEFCON suicide happens a lot. 

Multiplayer can be challenging, but rewarding, and always a learning experience. You'll get to play with some of the top ranked players in the world.

Buy the board game. Once you've played it a couple times, you'll get hooked. Then you'll buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030192100', 'num_games_owned': 1993, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1688150811}
review:
Brilliant game set in Cold War. USA and USSR are fighting over for world domination without commiting into actual hot war. This game has everything: political plots, coups, puppet goverments, space race and what not. Couple first games might be confusing when you're trying to wrap your head around the rules, but just going with flow and seeing what happens is a quick way to get a feel of the game. Mastering it is an entirely different thing.

As situation gets more tense, while blue and red fight over the control of the world, player is often confronted with very difficult decisions. Sometimes your hand is filled with cards that seem to be set against you. But you have to play one of them, minimize the damages and preferably even manage to gain something else. Local defeat is acceptable if it leads to global victory.

Style of the game is typical board game with decks of cards and counters on a map. Event cards have evocative art that sets the tone of the game. SALT Treaty, Olypics as PR event, Cuban missile crising (and many, many more) make an appearance and remind you of the time that isn't that far back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108704507', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1625022559}
review: 对冷战历史有了解或有兴趣的玩家来说非常有意思，每张卡片的背景故事都了解以后也算是冷战史入门了

author: {'steamid': '76561198285845599', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1653172241}
review:
最喜欢的桌游，没有之一，在全世界范围内的大博弈和生动贴切的事件牌实在是太有沉浸感了，可谓将幻想和历史、娱乐和竞技、运气和技术充分有机结合的桌游界集大成者，无愧BGG榜单多年冠军。游戏中核危机等级、太空竞赛、区域掌控、军事行动、中国牌等等各种要素的组合让游戏内容非常丰富，对于基本掌握了这个游戏的玩家来说，游戏体验可谓每一场都毫不重样，充满挑战和惊喜。
非常适合喜欢历史的桌游和策略类游戏玩家，可以说这个游戏本身就是一个寓教于乐的冷战史教材，对每一张卡牌的背景故事都熟悉后，你基本也就算是一个冷战史的入门者了。
电子版也做的相当不错，在基本还原游戏原汁原味的同时，完美解决了这个游戏的最大缺点————没人陪你玩！当然，这个游戏对国内玩家来说有一个不容忽视的问题，没有中文。如果你对自己的英文水平不太有信心的话可能玩起来会比较吃力，不过一共就那么多牌和那么些规则，记住了就没有语言障碍了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198057093464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 47385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22666, 'last_played': 1710186312}
review:
How do i report a bug? It was turn 6 in game #485117. I played Nucleur subs as the event as the US. I then couped in a battleground country in Africa and triggered the auto defeat of nucleur war. BUG!!!!!

I love Twillight Struggle, though am not real impressed with the AI or bugs in the steam version.

Michael

author: {'steamid': '76561198295174297', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6047, 'last_played': 1692980651}

author: {'steamid': '76561198096636465', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1702100443}
review:
twilight struggle,被别人安利的一款卡牌游戏，游戏设定在了非常充满诡计与较量的冷战年代，对于对历史不了解的玩家可能理解起来很困难(纯英文)。游戏对于我这种万年ai党来说还算友好(我都是开局+5作弊起手的)，电脑的卡牌运用的都相当合理(比如你的遏制政策会到最后一回合再当点数打出来)，但是放点或者调配势力就很僵硬了，总是喜欢强塞西德东德这种，包括会顶着肃反或红色恐怖强行放点，就发现电脑打着打着场面就劣势了。
注:脸黑的人玩起来很搓火，电脑一政变老是6，我政变个安哥拉都是1，你敢信冷战末期我太空竞赛才刚刚2级？
9/10 分 we need chinese

author: {'steamid': '76561197988641475', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1676418823}
review:
It would be great... if AI wouldn't cheat on dice rolls. Every F time if you have 1/6 chance shit happens to you, it will. And at the same time if there is 1/6 chance AI has lucky roll, it will.

It's so F frustrating!

author: {'steamid': '76561198206278651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1529026004}
review:
很有意思的游戏，玩家扮演冷战时期的两个超级大国之一，在世界各处争影响力。游戏还融入了太空竞赛元等那一时期有的事件，使得游戏的可玩性进一步提高。
游戏本身机制不难，个人认为阅读说明手册比玩系统的教学关卡对游戏规则的理解更加清楚，当然还是建议在读过手册后再去玩一遍教学关卡来熟悉游戏机制。AI过于强大，所以建议玩家在熟悉游戏运作与规则后转而去线上游戏。
欢迎广大网友加我游戏内好友“Judge Centurion”来和我对战。

review:
Fabulous game!
It's fast and relatively simple for a game that is really immersive. All the historical events, the map, the influence points systems and the operations you can use really gets you into the game. More people should play, online mathup system works great and could use more players. Totally worth the price. Don't wait for any deal, delaying the discovery of this game is costing you more than what you could save.
See you online

Autist

author: {'steamid': '76561198069099185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2693, 'last_played': 1677187390}
review:
Twilight Struggle, ya como juego de tablero, realmente capturaba de manera magistral la esencia de la Guerra Fría. El sistema sigue siendo un clásico, y esta adaptación a PC cumple todas las expectativas. La presentación gráfica es brillante. Las ayudas (cálculos, puntuaciones, reseñas visuales, histórico de cartas jugadas, descartadas, etc.) hacen que el juego pueda ser ágil, rápido y libre totalmente de tareas tediosas.

La AI es un desafío, pero el sistema de multijugador + puntuaciones/ranking (tipo Ajedrez, útil también para los logros) es sencillamente extraordinario. La jugabilidad es prácticamente infinita y los elementos aleatorios o probabilisticos hacen de cada turno y cada fase de acción una oportunidad de reproducir el mecanismo de toma de decisiones imperfectamente informadas con una elección básica siempre de fondo: Mejorar la posición de mi bloque, o perjudicar y anular las posibles (aunque intuidas) estrategias del bloque oponente. 

Sin duda, de lo mejor y más jugable que hay en STEAM. Recomiendo también las DLCs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143871741', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 4286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1693386303}
review:
这个差评给的原因还是因为[b] 我们需要中文	[/b]

并不是说没有中文的游戏就给差评，我也不是那么死心眼的人，毕竟现在steam上没有中文的游戏那么多
但是，既然你已经承诺了说要给中文（KS众筹上已经达到了中文的解锁条件），到现在还没有，这就很有问题
等有了中文，这个差评会改过来的

[spoiler] 然后我就买了一个实体中文版	[/spoiler]
[spoiler] 不过话说这种游戏不是应该先玩了桌游之后才会买电子版的吗，感觉我的顺序好像有点奇怪	[/spoiler]

然后说说游戏
冷战热斗
不得不说是一款非常优秀的桌游，在BBG榜单上，2010年代替波多黎各取得世界第一，一直到16年才被取代[spoiler] 现在到第四，居然出前三了 18.2.19	[/spoiler] 而这就足以说明它有多么的广受好评

Just purchased my Steam copy.. this was my first introduction to 'heavy' boardgames and gets better and better with every playthrough. I've got 20 games against AI under my belt now and am slowly growing in confidence... absolutely recommend for anyone looking for a very different, challenging and strategic game to play that sits well outside the digital norm.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993525585', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1342, 'last_played': 1603852377}
review:
A nearly perfect translation of the board game, with a slick UI and some great historical sound effects.

If you haven't played the board game, it's a tense nailbiter where you feel stupid for 90 minutes straight as you do everything wrong. Sound good? This might be the game for you!

The AI is comically bad (let's coup the Philippines with the China card turn 1 AR 1!) but in some ways that's part of the charm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070398008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 78690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42875, 'last_played': 1708691384}
review:
I'm coming up to 1000 hours of online play over a twelve month period. Despite the lack of support from Playdek, this is a great game well worth buying. Hands down, one of the best strategy games ever released. 

This is an excellent port of the boardgame and is the better alternative for frequent play. I save my hard copy for special occassions because this is just so convenient. Set up and play are a snap. AN entire game can run in just under an hour.  Even better, it functions well on tablets so you can play in bed or generally while relaxing. Much better than being stuck in front of a desk or laptop. 

Play occurs at the political level in a series of ten Turns divided into six or seven Action Rounds (USSR followed by USA). Each Action round pairing is roughly equivalent to one year. An Action Round involves playing a card either for the action or using the point value of the card to distribute political influence around the world by placing points in individual countries (on a slightly simplified map) in order to contest and control them and the regions they belong to. Cards can be played either for their point value (1-4 Operations Points each) or their actions. The actions are depicted by photgraph with historical and mechanics text and correspond to key and generic points during the Cold War (e.g. famous speeches, political crises, coups, wars) and proves a great way to learn the macro-history of the period. If you play a card that bears your opponents action, it automatically triggers. This makes for a very tense and exciting game, particularly as the DEFCON level drops. DEFCON dropping to 1 in your turn (either through your own or the other player's action) is an automatic loss. This is complicated by the inclusion of regional score cards (Asia, Middle East, Europe, etc) which must be played in the Turn you recieve them. New cards are added to the deck as the games progresses into the Mid and Late War stages (Turn 4 and 8 respectively), gradually tipping the balance from USSR towards the USA. Some cards are expended if the action occurs, while most are discarded and re-enter play when the deck gets shuffled (Turn 3 and usually Turn 7). It is not unusual for both players to think that they are about to lose.

The AI is a real pushover and only useful for learning how to play (it will smash you repreatedly at first). Gameplay with or without the AI enforces the rules well, so it's not unusual for even seasoned board gamers to pick up a few nuances from playing this version. Once you've got the rules and rhythmn down pat, you're ready to take it online. Online play is where this game really shines. The other players are almost universally friendly and tend not to take advantage of newbies. I have yet to come across an outright gronk. For new players and those wanting to play against the masters (although they tend to stick to themselves with a few exceptions), there is always the option of player handicaps to help rebalance the game, so don't be shy about setting up a match with a handicap or asking for one. There are enough regular players that I normally have thirty games (in and around my level of competence) going simultaneously, so there are almost always a few Action Rounds for me to play when I log in and someone often turns up for synchronous play while I'm going through the back log. 

I could crap on a lot more about the details and may come back and edit this review. Basically, if you love turn based games, despite the lack of support from Playdek and some of the shit talk about bugs etc, just buy it. Almost all of the complaints about the game are from people who don't understand the rules properly. A close reading of the cards usually clears things up. This game is not "broken" and there are very few bugs, all of which I consider to be inconsequential, particularly once known.  

Warning: this game is highly addictive. Daily play is not uncommon. For the time poor, it is posssible to adjust game timer settings during game set up, so that an individual game can stretch out for three months (45 day set up) and get by on several minutes of play per day per game. I tend to favour a week per player (i.e. a maximum of two weeks for the game) with most games playing out in 3-4 days. A single game takes between just under an hour for fast decision makers to just over two to three hours for those that like to take their time considering their moves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632016', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5916, 'last_played': 1698212351}

author: {'steamid': '76561198394150048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2303, 'last_played': 1671771913}
review:
Based on popular GMT board wargame, 'Twilight Struggle' on steam just manages to fit into the giant shoes left behind by the tabletop version of the game. Although, there are bugs with the game, they don't really effect play in the core game, (the DLC, however, is another matter entirely.) But all the niggles and complaints aside, this game still functions, works and delivers what the tabletop version does (expect for the obvious shifting of pieces and rolling of dice by hand.)
Twilight Struggle on steam is a hit for me. If you can't find an opponent, don't have the space, or even the time, then the steam version fills these criteria. The AI sometimes does a weird move, but mostly proves to be a capable opponent.
Overall, this game on steam is not perfect: There are a lot of problems, but if the attraction of the board wargame is there for you, get this game. 

6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994699656', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 20802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2220, 'last_played': 1706103007}
review:
Очень качественная компьютерная версия классической настольной стратегии 2005 года. Даже сейчас, спустя 12 лет со дня своего выхода Twilight Struggle остаётся непревзойдённым эталоном своего жанра - card driven area control game. Некоторые её элементы сейчас могут показаться старомодными. Например, использование кубиков для определения результатов действий. Но даже современные тяжеловесные компьютерные стратегии не показывают динамику длительного многоуровневого, идеологического и геополитического конфликта так же удачно, как это делает TS. Это игра не про постройку армий или исследование технологий. Это игра про тонкое манипулирование неумолимыми историческими реалиями, про управление рисками и принятие сложных решений в неблагоприятных ситуациях.
Лучшая игра на тему холодной войны.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053247392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1650039136}
review:
喜欢玩的一款桌游，看到电子版马上入了，反正价格便宜。
玩起来比实体方便多了，也不会规则出错了，但是AI有点傻。。。  中期能让我直接欧洲记分牌胜利。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198015017512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1514845567}
review:
If I could rate this game as neutral I would as the game itself is OK but the implementation, in my view, has a few unforgivable flaws which die hard enthusiasts will see through but I think is inexcusable. I got a refund because nearly half of the steam achievements are broken and unachievable, there are bugs in both the base game and DLC and there are broken promises from years ago with regards to text translations. A serious developer for a board game port would fix the issues: in a board game the rules are pretty important! I dont see enough evidence of support for this game let alone long term fixes. When a games most popular guide is a guide about how to get around bugs you know there's a issue somewhere.

As for the game itself, yes it is popular on boardgamegeek but does that make for a great game? I'm not convinced. It is a OK game for sure but the basis is playing cards and seeing for each country whether a number is higher or lower than the opponent. The game has a lot of not obvious or sensible restrictions in which countries can revolt etc. The whole World is a goal, with objectives specifically focusing on achieving control of Battleground Countries. The game can be quite drawn out and after a while on PC becomes a little dull. The AI spins round cards at lightning pace after a timer has counted thethdownm down making it hard to read let alone comprehend what is going on. The AI has mixed reports on its ability. I think this game is best left bug free and on the tabletop. There are better card based games available, better war games available. I have yet to find a good Cold War game.

If the game had no bugs and all achievements worked I would have kept it, but as it is I got a refund and my game rating is no more than 5/10. 50%: give it a try if you feel like it and you will know after 2 hours of tutorial if you like it. If you miss it, it's not a huge loss. The physical board game is probably better than this PC/Android copy. GMT should not have given their excellent reputation via licence to such shoddy developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007426352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6193, 'last_played': 1704426447}
review:
If you are like me, you love political science and are annoyed how few games seem to properly get the feel of geopolitics right (without being massively inaccessible). 

There is Twilight Struggle for you. 

Do not be turned off by the learning curve which isn't nearly as large as it might seem initially. Do not worry about the fact it is a board game and not a video game. Trust me, I've played crazy complex games before, this is not one of them. 

If you pass over the concerns I just described your reward will be an experience more immersive than games with budgets hundreds of times as large as this one.  TS nails the Cold War theme, I feel like I am actually making decisions similar to that of the superpowers of the era every single move. It is also a blast to play and will keep you on the edge of your seat the whole time. 

If you are even tangetially interested in the subject matter, you owe it to yourself to play this. A masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036313343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1523, 'last_played': 1709524617}
review:
Embarrasing.

Playing games for decades. If it's new I was into it or at least knew about it. Tactics II (original), wood block Diplomacy, white box D&D, from SoS (original) to Catan (orginal) to Alpha MTG to Android: Netrunner, all have come and gone through my hands because: I Game. 

So how on earth have I spent the past almost 20 years knowing nothing about Twilight Struggle?!?

Read other reviews for the nuts and bolts; this one just says if you're a gamer Buy This. You'll regret the time wasted if you don't and discover the game when you're old!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010985634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3281, 'last_played': 1610117548}
review:
I bought the boardgame, decided I couldn't be bothered reading its centimetre thick rule book, so I bought this too. Never a better decision was made. Such a great way to learn the game.

If you love Risk, Stratego, Diplomacy and other strategy-based boardgames ... get it right now .. it's probably one of the best out there for what it does. Lots of well-researched and applied history too. It's about as close to a Cold War similator that you're likely to find for it's price and playability.

Don't buy this if you've got a short attention span and like lots of graphics. It's a thinking game.
