author: {'steamid': '76561198299044372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10226, 'last_played': 1510200258}
review:
If Chess,Poker a pair of dice and the Cold War had an orgy in a hotel room,this would be that messy hotel room the morning after.

A wonderful boardgame!!!

I had no prior experience with the game,so I started playing vs the AI. At first he was beating me,but 15-20 games in (as the USA) and I slowly started winning. After a while you'll notice that the AI is pretty weak and thats when I recomend you jump into the online mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108343113', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2461, 'last_played': 1573335835}
review:
很经典的老桌游了，以前只能和同学线下玩或者上BGG等平台，这次移植steam，感觉做得很用心，比以前BGG等平台的版本看起来舒服了不少。
另外有AI好评。而且对初学者来说还算有点强度。
目前玩家对战暂时没发现什么bug。

不过，个人还是希望官方能除了这个简单AI（simple AI）外，再并行地做个高级AI(advanced AI)，现在TS自带的这个AI完全就是“简单电脑”，喜欢硬塞、喜欢乱偷分不顾局势什么的就不细说了（毕竟不是alphago）,但有时会把自己的好牌丢太空啊（扶额），而且有时我(USA)发华约/去斯大林后AI（USSR）完全不放点啊，让我免费打个华约/去斯大林太迷了点吧。靠steam版+AI入坑的初学者会被带坏的呀。
(我现在每天让AI10点和AI玩→_→)

A better AI plz!

author: {'steamid': '76561198298412891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1533126554}
review: TS出了官方正版还是挺不错的，但AI智商太低，急需提高。游戏经常卡住，尤其古巴导弹危机移点时必卡，这些BUG急待修复。希望出个观战系统，就可以观战TS比赛了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010990363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1467590384}
review:
I was one of the people who helped kickstarter this game a while back and opted for the ps4 version. I couldn't pass up the chance to buy it at a huge discount on steam though.

So after some hours of playing this I can easily say that I suck at it. lol 

Even on max handicap I was only able to take control of Central/South America, Southeast Asia/Asia and most of Europe. I lost when the computer played the Score Middle East and Africa cards and utterly decimated me with victory points.

All in all I believe the game has a moderate learning curb and eventually everyone can become very talented at it. May just be me but it seems as though the soviets have cards with much better effects than the americans but that just might be me not knowing about their overall weaknesses. I do solidly enjoy the game because it makes you think ahead when placing cards and trying to take strategic countries.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993089461', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1673, 'last_played': 1691706004}
review:
Really good port of the board game.
Is the AI poor? yes, but its purpose is to introduce new players to the game without being steamrolled by a veteran plater.
I bought this game to play against human opponents, so the AI doesn't bother me, and I really recommend this game.

EDIT: I still recommend this game, but I want to warn everyone; as every games with cards/dice involved the ratio luck/strategy is 50/50.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997529678', 'num_games_owned': 3000, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1605100419}
review:
If you like the board game, this unquestionably is a worthwhile purchase especially as a timesaver for all the rule calculations.  This board game conversion is very well done if you play against human opponents.  The developer is active and working out the bugs for some of the wierder card interactions, but since release, this game as of early July is 98% correct for the card rules.  The AI still needs some work.

The late game variant is programmed in as well.

I kind of wish there was a mode to turn off the warnings (the board game does not warn you that coups at low level are game losing or not playing score cards on time is game losing.)  I do like the compromise to 'take bad' moves that are reversible and do not provide actionable intelligence.

Multiplayer mode 

A couple of things about the offline against the AI:
1.  The AI not only acts omniscent about the cards that are in your hand, but specifically acts in ways that it shouldn't have known, I have a couple of save games where there is NO way the AI should be doing the turn events.
2.  That being said , the AI acts completely suicidal at times in ways humans wouldn't:
  a.  Russian AI globally focused with you focusing on Europe (it's defense of Europe isn't priortized well)
  b.  On either side, the AI runs DEFCON much lower than it should in early and mid-game, particularly with the cards that force the other to coup.
  c.  US AI not playing the Americas in late game and not having a particularly coherent strategy about frustrating the human Russian.

I think besides the DEFCON thinking problem, the Russian AI works pretty well.  The American AI still needs a lot of work.  Yes, the game is designed with Russians having the early advantage, but the US really dominates late game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064141618', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1677420869}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980194897', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1581416181}
review:
Un juego algo complejo de entender al principio, pero a la que vas jugando y lo entiendes, es cuando luce en su máximo esplendor. El juego te deja escoger entre las dos grandes potencias que se enfrentaron en la guerra fría, un choque entre ideologías que casi lleva al mundo a su destrucción. Para desgracia de la clase trabajadora ya sabemos como acabó la contienda pero eso no viene al caso ahora.

El juego usa un sistema de cartas bastante complejo donde la idea principal es tratar de minimizar los efectos negativos que puede causar la carta que estás a punto de emplear, suena extraño, pero en este juego la estrategia es lidiar con los efectos colaterales que causan tus cartas. 

Si te gusta la estrategia por turnos, la historia (en especial el periodo de la guerra fría) este juego te gustará. Las cartas vienen representando periodos historicos y clichés de ambos bandos, de vez en cuando se pueden oír discursos de los personajes históricos que la protagonizaron, como Stalin o Kennedy, y la tensión que produce ver bajar el nivel DEFCON cada vez más hace que jugar merezca la pena.

review: The game is great, the implementation is fine. I'd love to be able to zoom the map out a bit more, and the AI could be better. Generally a more minimalist interface would be welcome. But the game is just so amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010303040', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 20216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1600, 'last_played': 1689828373}
review: Awesome game. It captures the tense atmosphere of the Cold War in a simple board game format. It's the type of game where I'll start playing it for what I think is 10 minutes, but when I check the time 2 hours have passed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212808659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4497, 'last_played': 1709620557}
review:
One of my absolute favorite board games finally comes to Steam! The game itself is pretty close to perfect, though I do have a few minor problems with it. First, the AI can be very random. A lot of times it is going to go for the continents that haven't scored yet, but occasionally it will just start trying to take over Africa or one of the Americas in the early war. What the hell? Also, it tends to get stuck in a oneupsmanship contest if it's trying to take over one of your countries that it has the scoring card for. Overall, the AI is very predictable, and while it can squeek out a win here and there, experienced players are going to have no problems with it.

Second, I do wish that you had a little more control on being able to take back your plays once you've set them into motion. They've done a pretty good job at addressing this, but during the Headline Phase, for instance, I wish that you could change cards up until your opponent has chosen one.

Finally, try to avoid playing the card, De-Stalinization, while playing as the USA. It can sometimes take upwards of 5 minutes for your opponent to figure out how they're going to use the card, which is some ridiciulous downtime.

Overall though, an excellent adaptation, and one that I've already gotten 70+ hours out of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298420695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5963, 'last_played': 1672296979}
review:
I saw this game being played at an anime convention. I normally don't get into board games but this one looked interesting. When I found out it was based on the Cold War I immediately said, "Show me how to play this!" I was given the basic rules and was hooked.

Well balanced and the gameplay is more about PREVENTING the other player from using their powerful cards rather than open aggression. Playing as the USSR is nore aggressive but you still need to plan your moves carefully.

The degree of random card draws keep things interesting as well as the almost seemingly predicability of what cards and plan your oppponet has.

Modified rules also keep things interesting and challegning.

And cards like "Kitchen Debates" and "Wargames" add a bit of humor to the gameplay!

The AI seems to be broken at times. As of this review's writing, I've won as the US a few times with the AI USSR player holding score cards. That's just silly since it's a basic rule to play score cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031089987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1724, 'last_played': 1614161148}
review:
Hands down one of the best, if not [i]the[/i] best board games I've ever had the pleasure of playing. The mechanics of this game are superb and perfectly encapsulate the feeling of brinksmanship in the Cold War, in a manner I would not have thought possible by a board game.

A two player game, players start the game as either the USA or USSR, both of whom have their unique set of cards that are shuffled into a universal deck. Players draw from the deck up to a full hand, and then take turns making moves on the board, divided into turns and phases with the USSR always going first. Cards can be played for their events, or used as resources (Ops) to place influence, stage a coup or make a realignment roll in foreign countries. As both players draw from a universal deck, you will inevitably draw many of your opponent's cards during a game. This creates a very interesting dynamics whenever you use your opponent's card for Ops, the event of their card is triggered as well. A key part of the strategy in Twilight Struggle is knowing when to trigger opponent events and controlling the damage done by them while you have them in your hand.

Twilight Struggle is full of interesting little design choices such as this, the DEFCON meter is another example. DEFCON starts as 5, and increases by 1 at the start of each new turn. Every time a coup takes place, or some specific cards are played; the DEFCON meter drops by 1, bringing the world closer to nuclear war. With each successive DEFCON drop, players become more and more limited in their actions (DEFCON 4 locks out coups and realignment in Europe, 3 in Asia, 2 in the Middle East). If the DEFCON level ever drops to 1, the game immediately ends and the player that triggered the drop loses the game.

What I love most about Twilight Struggle is how thematic the game is, the tension of the cold war looms heavily over the player as the DEFCON level draws lower and lower, and your hand is thinning out until you have nothing but your opponent's cards in your hand. You're going to have to make plenty of extremely tough choices in every game you play and the music and art direction of the game makes it feel all the more immersive.

I only bought this game a few days ago and I've already been recommending it to everyone I know. If you play a lot of board games, have been looking to get into a board game, or just love the Cold War, Twilight Struggle is the game for you. I've already dumped 20 hours into it as of the time of writing but I'm only scratching the surface of this amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971691194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1892, 'last_played': 1503803201}
review:
One of the best board games I've ever played.

A little hardcore with letting you suicide if you get distracted (you shouldn't be allowed to trivially "put yourself in check" in a friendly game) but other than that, one of the most enjoyable designs I've played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135608091', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1736, 'last_played': 1631074895}
review: While I have not played the boardgame, I do know the game's reputation.  The presentation is fantastic and it seems to faithfully implent the table top rules.  It also does a good job vistually explaining the odds of a course of action, using dice rolls, of course.  But the level of tension playing this game, even against the AI, rivals a good game of chess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024118928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1584893863}

author: {'steamid': '76561198313509350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1585471029}
review: Excellent portage de ce bijou de jeu de stratégie

author: {'steamid': '76561198025604634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 24148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1703368231}
review:
I really wish there were more options for Steam reviews than just recommend/not reccomend, because this isn't a bad game at all, it is a decent game, but it can be disappointed as some of the hype needs to be diffused. 

Biggest plus: it is hard to find any other game that fits this niche. It takes you through the intrigue spanning the entire Cold War. Finding a game that involves either real or fictitious Cold War combat is easy enough, but not one with a focus on bringing your side through the Cold War alive, but preferably on top. 

Biggest weakness: some balance points are really odd. For example, whomever plays the card that leads to Defcon  automatically loses the game. Not only does this not make sense from the perspective of nuclear war directly being proposed from the side that was ahead, when they were ahead, but it also leads to some odd situations where if you play cards like"Olympic Games," if your opponent boycotts the Olympics at Defcon 2, you lose, because "corrupt" you wanted to host the Olympics. There are others, and though they are fair in the context that the game remains balanced for both sides, it breaks the immersion greatly and can be quite a nuissance. 

The rest of the game is satisfactory. Not amazing, but not bad either, save the tutorial which is mediocre. 

I don't want to make this game sound too bad, but a lot of the good things about this game have already been mentioned. It is good, but I am marking "Not Recommended" because the hype is more than a bit much. It is a decent game.

Now, as an adaptation of a boardgame, this is amazing. I have not played the boardgame, but my comments are in referance to the boardgame. If you have played it, you know what to expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298409717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1568356115}

author: {'steamid': '76561198145000742', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1676269394}
review: “此刻，嘹亮的号角再次召唤着我们，不是召唤我们拿起武器，虽然我们必须武装自己；不是召唤我们奔赴战场，虽然我们已经严阵以待-但绝对是号召我们要肩负起漫长黑暗斗争的使命，以待黎明的曙光”- 约翰·肯尼迪     当你进入这个游戏的时候  你就不在是你个人  而是全世界新闻的核心 你的每一次行动都代表着地区 大洲乃至世界格局的变动你亲历着历史世界  你推动者历史进程 你改变了世界的命运  这一切都掌握在你的手里    当然 你对面那个邪恶帝国总是在阻挠你 反对你 甚至不惜将世界推到毁灭的边缘  而你 在此刻将如何反应？  冷静下来何谈  还是按下那个致命的按钮？“总统先生  莫斯科午夜时候来的电报”

author: {'steamid': '76561197993886321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1654363221}
review:
Amazing PC-adaption of boardgame classics - kudos to devs, who obviously took their time polishing the final product. AI maybe not a genius, but smart enough not to make plain stupid things and punishes you for mistakes regularly. 
Worth every dollar spent!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960450616', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1559360312}
review:
Wow, this game is awesome!
I never had the chance to play the board game but I've wanted to given its reputation.  Glad to say, it lives up to that reputation.  Everything about this version is done well.  The UI is incredibly intuitive - something that is not necessarily easy to do on board game ports.  The audio is top notch and full of political leaders giving historic speeches.  The AI is probably not that great, but it's an enormous task to create a great AI for a complex game.  It's been fun, I've won a few games against the AI and gotten my money's worth out of it.  Haven't tried playing against a human yet, but I will give it a go soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056466698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1617398262}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999387222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1678567034}
review:
This is one of my very favorite board games.  That being said, while the board game is insanely fun, there is a ton of set-up and tear-down involved as well as a minimum of 2 hours committed to it.  This version takes care of all the nitty gritty and lets you get a game in against the AI in less than an hour.  Or, you're welcome to game online with friends.

This game has been great to explore and now with this convenient application I'll be playing it indefinitely!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058646112', 'num_games_owned': 1586, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1467028846}
review:
냉전시대를 배경으로 미국과 소련이 각자 배후에서 영향력을 발휘하며 실제 역사 이벤트를 기초로 구성한 카드 등을 통해 20점의 점수를 먼저 얻으면 이기는 게임입니다.  보드게임긱 평가 1위였는데 지금은 2위라고 들었습니다.

보드게임을 좋아해서 매우 만족스럽습니다. 나오자마자 샀는데 후회가 없네요! 음악도 좋구요.

원작 보드게임은 사놓기만 하고 상대가 없어서 못했는데.. 그나마 CPU와 대전할 수 있어 기쁩니다. 초반에 소련이 유리한 건 어쩔 수 없지 싶네요. 실제 역사에서도 냉전 초반에는 붉은 광풍이 불었다 할 수 있으니..

굉장히 이식이 잘 된 것 같아요. 보드게임이나 카드게임 좋아하시면 강추하고 싶습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084745544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2114, 'last_played': 1557654939}
review: AI far too weak

author: {'steamid': '76561198014503705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1568414668}
review:
냉전시대를 베이스로 삼은 지역관리형 워게임인 황혼의 투쟁 입니다.
초기-중기-후기로 이루어진 게임구성과 역사에 기반한 카드들,
상대방에게 득이 될 수있는 카드(=역사적사건)을 강제적으로 발동시켜야
하는 선택의 고민과 수싸움까지, 매우 훌륭한 게임입니다.

이는 오리지널 보드게임이 가지고 있는 강점이고, 이를 PC버젼도 충실히 보여주고 있습니다.

단 이를 제외한, PC버젼만의 강점이 되었어야 할 비쥬얼이나 UI/UX는 매우 좋지 못합니다.
타블렛버젼을 고려한 큼지막하고 다중 depth로 이루어진 UX는 한 화면에 다 보여줄수 있는데
굳이 버튼을 여러번 누르는 수고를 겪게 하며, 상대 카드사용같은 로그도 가독성이 썩 좋진 못합니다.

맵비쥬얼이나 메뉴아이콘들은 기존 보드게임 컴포넌트를 지나치게 의식하여 그 스타일을 그대로 따르고 있고,
이게 기존 보드게임 팬들에겐 익숙하겠다만 아닌 유저들에겐 좀 세련되지 못한다는 기분이 들게됩니다.

룰북같은 유저 초기 적응에 관계될만한 부분에 있어서도 좋다곤 못하겠네요.

이런 문제점이 있음에도 익숙해진뒤의 핵심적인 게임플레이는 확실한 매력이 있으므로 추천하는 바입니다.
특히 장고를 고려한 비실시간 멀티플레이는 맘에 드네요.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
킥스타터 스트레치 골이었던 다국어번역 다 생깐상황 ㅋㅋㅋ

author: {'steamid': '76561198076420347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1564703624}
review:
This is an awesome board game, especially if you happen to be a big history fan. As the description says, this is a board game that goes over several incidents that occured over the 45 years of cold war. Some of the events include the Cuban Missle Crisis, the formation of NATO, and the "We Will Bury You" speech. They also include a few events based off of a few movies such as "How I Learned To Stop Worrying" from "Dr. Strangelove" and "War Games" from the movie of the same name.
The main trick to the game is to spread as much influence of your superpower to other nations, especially battleground nations. As the game moves on, certain regional scoring cards will enter player's hands that must be played by the end of the turn or that player will "accidentally" start a nuclear war, thus ending the game.
There are several ways to spread influence in the game. Some cards have events that allow players to place influence on certain countries. They can either do what the card states or use its operation's value to place influence on or agacent to countries that have their influence. They also could use the cards to attempt realignments in other countries or coups. Coups are the most ideal way of removing opponent's influence while possibly placing your own afterwards. This is also a great way of performing necessary military operations to prevent loss of points at the end of a turn. But whenever a coup is performed in a battleground country, the defcon level will be decreased by one, adding limitations to both players as well as bringing the world closer to a potential nuclear war.
Although I do have some dislikes with the A.I. at some times, this is still a very great adaptation of the board game, especially since there are almost always people to play with online. I'd strongly suggest this to any big fans of board games or any big cold war historians.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030864926', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1678471987}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035445715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1657085229}
review:
Have you played the board game? If yes, then you will love this version. 
Have you ever wanted to play the board game? Buy the board game.

The strength of this version is the speed. No setup time, no dealing and reshuffling cards, no bickering over dice results, no placing tiles. This is AWESOME for experienced players. However... doing all those little things TEACHES you the game. For example, reshuffles are a critical element of the game and actually doing it with your own two hands shows you why. A milisecond of image on a screen doesn't have the same effect. 

Aside from this, there are some graphical changes that could clear things up, but it's a fantastic game nonetheless. 

9/10 for Veterans. 
7/10 for Newbies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057436025', 'num_games_owned': 3760, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1464851522}
review:
[h1]Twilight Struggle 冷战热斗[/h1]

先谈谈电子版本身的情况吧。
分辨率和UI都可以说是相当一般。音乐方面相当不错，但是也撑不住太久。
游戏的AI稍微显得有点简单，有些战略选择会显得非常奇怪。
但是整体的联机还是可以的，如果你愿意和各路老手在这个平台上用很长时间间隔的方法玩一盘的话，还是值得一买的。
说到这里，按照英文评测的说法，开发商还因为要推广这个游戏禁掉了一个爱好者平台。而目前来看这个电子版还不如爱好者版本。
所以，还是看个人的想法吧。

------------------------------------------------------------------
常年位居BGG #1的传奇桌游冷战热斗，也总算是出了一个比较现代的电子版。我也总算能体验一下这款桌游的，嗯...，气氛？
就和那些在冷战泥潭中挣扎的决策者一样，面对着处处有坑的地图，注定会发生的那些事件，你只能尝试着将不利的”现状“用不同的战术去挽回。某一片的劣势得要用另外一边来挽回。在游戏行进中，我感觉到的是相对压抑的气氛，和不得不打出对方好牌的无奈，我个人是感觉有点闷。

但是不得不说，对于地缘政治价值的模拟，冷战热斗用连线地图给出的诠释实在厉害。虽然游戏并没有唯一解，但是通过事件和地图本身的导引，你在策略上的选择确实是基于世界的现状。
这点比RISK GAME之流的控制会精准很多，游戏选择的成分比起寻找解决方法的成分要大很多。
当然，游戏的过程中也少不了运气。一次扔骰子可能会对整个战局产生很大的变化。

总的来说，冷战热斗作为游戏而言，确实有很多值得学习借鉴的地方。#1这个东西毕竟不是浪得虚名。

author: {'steamid': '76561198105222182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1702266560}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970717922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1576728101}
review:
Excellent port of an amazing board game. Feels exactly like playing at a board game cafe without spending so much time placing the pieces to get started. I love this game. It has a steep learning curve, but it\'s definitely rewarding.
I absolutely love the idea of creating playing cards based on historical events, and the tug-o-war victory mechanic makes for a much intriguing playthrough. 
If you enjoyed the board game, get this game. If you\'re interested in political intrigue and don\'t mind steep-learning curves (Paradox games come to mind), get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000967923', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1672380583}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003025074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1571864311}
review:
This game, as a boardgame, was my absolute No.1 favorite....much to the surprise of my husband.  Out of all the games we own this one is my pride and joy.  I love it.

The other day my husband pointed out that it was now available on Steam.....he tells me this on a sunday..when I have an entire week of work coming up...so.... I bought it immediately and we played a LOT of games over the course of the day :D  Cannot wait for this weekend.

The major difference between the PC version and the boardgame version is that it's a lot faster on the PC...no having to check rule books or spend ages pondering moves..I can view the entire board a lot more easily on the screen rather than when it's all laid out in front of me on the table...faster games mean a lot more play throughs...I think I played around 4 or 5 hours on sunday but that was quite a few games worth in those hours.  If you loved the boardgame then I see no reason why you wouldn't enjoy this version. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030817499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1541485287}
review:
The game concept is good but it is poorly implemented. In single player the game appears to cheat. I guess this is so the AI can have a better chance but it is annoying. The opponent seems to know what cards you have in your hand and plays accordingly. The opponent also seems to know what card you play for the headline phase. I played a card that would cancel  the card the AI played in the headline phase. Guess what happened? It played a useless card. Hence, I got not advantage. Why would the AI play the card unless it knew what I played? As the rest of the turn played out, I saw the AI play cards that would have been much more appropriate to play in the headline round.

I started reading comments from other players. One person said he must be the unluckiest person in the world because of the rolls the soviets were getting. I decided to watch the die rolls during a game. My die rolls averaged to 3.3 which is slighly low but reasonable. My opponent's die rolls average 5.0. This is way beyond chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018676791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1483075674}
review:
This was a very disappointing game.  I backed the KS for the first round, then again for the Playdek version, so I was predisposed to accept lots of faults.  I wasn't even interested in a good AI, as you get to play other people.  Unfortunately, the interface is so BAD that I can not even get past the first turn.  The map is terrible, the functions are terrible, visually its a mess, and the interface is terrible.    

Is that game good?  I don't know, can't get far enough into it to say, but the boardgame is fantastic.  GMT really let down its loyal customers with this one.  And shame on them if they ever use playdek again for anything.  The company is unresponsive, uncommunicative and out of its depth with anything beyond simple tablet games.

Don't waste your time or money on this pile of rubish, go get the board game instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299126163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1687926878}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123069794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1680969845}
review: Horrible interface that is totally unusable and simply not fun. I stopped playing on the third action round and will never touch this again. Too bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007605514', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1463800231}
review:
As someone who absolutely loves the board game, I requested a refund after an hour of playing.

The AI is just so bad.  For example, I was playing as the US; the USSR plays US/Japan Mutual Defense Act, which gives me control of Japan.  THe AI then proceeds to use 2 ops to break my control of Japan-- it could have simply placed influence first and then activated the event but either way it was probably a bad move.  I shrugged it off, retook control the next action round.  Immediately thereafter, the USSR uses two ops AGAIn to break my control of Japan.  

At that point I rage-quit and asked for my money back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067411176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 25287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4205, 'last_played': 1586748993}
review: Very well done version of an incredibly good board game. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213078484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3615, 'last_played': 1672725507}
review: Ive had the boardgame version of this for years and its predecessors, Paths of Glory, Hannibal, We the people, for the People etc GMT puts out superb games that lends themselves to computer play. This one is almost flawless, its hard to win and you dont always. Itys great

author: {'steamid': '76561197964092201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1630, 'last_played': 1479920987}
review:
Good implementation of an outstanding board game. I found that the tutorial was a bit lacking; it failed to point out a few minor details in the rules. It took a number of playthroughs on my own (with some trial and error) to figure out all of the nuances. Reading the rulebook also helps. I do wish that there was a better in-game help system.

But overall, the game is great. As a beginner, I felt that the AI was very challenging. I started out losing every game I played but over time found myself winning more and more. I'd say that now I'm around the 50% mark. I've heard some comlpain about the AI being too easy, but I find it to be just right for a non-expert like me.

Despite the semi-lacking tutorial, I did find this to be a great way to learn the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007858295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1463747612}
review:
Great conversion from board to pc. Moves are sometimes hard to follow but you can always look at the bottom to see what happened during the last move of a player.
Don't buy it for the AI though because its just dumb. For example as USSR just wait for the blockade card and conquer Europe without resistance, turn 2 win every time. 
The turorial is also a little short so steep learning curve if you have never played the game before. 

Luckily it comes with online multiplayer so you can play it against quality players almost all the time! (you can set timers to 30 minutes, 1 hour, 4 hours, 1 3 7 21 45 days,  per player. So you know how long a game can max last)

If you know the board game and want to play it more often / all the time than this conversion is great for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025317690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1601952016}
review:
In short, Twilight Struggle is the best board game ever created.  Not only do the mechanics work without a hitch, but Twilight Struggle also perfectly captures the historical accuracy and intensity of the Cold War time period.  From spreading political influence, to launching coups, and playing out actual historical events, Twilight Struggle has everything!  But be warned: this is a DIFFICULT game and will hurt your brain the first two or three games.  But after a couple games you will get a feel for the mechanics and theme of the game and you'll have fun.

If you are looking for the perfect board game, then stop reading this and buy Twilight Struggle!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050545309', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1538351304}
review:
It is a good Cold War game with historically accurate events that can be used by both sides (with potential consequences). The game is kinda confusing at first but you get mostly used to it (however I am still baffled at the luck aspect of the game in which I lost 4 dominated countries in a single turn due to "luck" realignment by the US...)

Overall pretty good if you dont mind being frustrated every once and a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107977646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1706972916}
review:
이분들에게 추천

1) 보드게임으로 황혼의 투쟁을 해봤다로 끝나면 안됩니다. 룰을 거의 완전히 숙지해야합니다.
데프콘1이 된다고 알려주지 않습니다. 핵전쟁이 터질수도 있습니다.

2) 영어가 되어야합니다.
한글화가 (아직?)되어있지 않아서 액션카드 텍스트 내용을 이미 알고있는분에게만 추천합니다.

3) 룰 숙지가 다 되어있는분에게는 추천합니다. AI도 굉장히 똑똑합니다.
가끔가다 이해할수없는 행동을 하긴하지만요. 혼자서 게임을 즐기기에도 좋습니다.


단점이 있다면,

1) 32비트 지원 X, XP지원 X.
2) 의외로 많이 잡아먹는 고성능요구
3) 튜토리얼로는 감당하기 힘든 게임 자체
4) 몇개의 남아있는 (물론 고쳐나가겠지만) 버그

author: {'steamid': '76561198090233242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1608914626}
review:
Ok, it's a good adaptation of the cardboard game.
It could have better graphics and I hope a patch will come soon...

One thing needed urgently is an automatic victory if you opponent do nothing for a certain time, for exemple 5 or 10 minutes.
For my first day online, 4 games played but in two of them my opponent disapeared and I had the message "Waiting for Opponent to decide..." and as I think you can have only an instance at time, you have to wait to gain the game.
Please hurry :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042958260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1407, 'last_played': 1570121614}
review:
보드게임보다 플탐이 절반으로 줄어듭니다ㅎㅎ
어서 로컬 2인플이 지원됐으면 좋겠군요

author: {'steamid': '76561198262420619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 25527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12748, 'last_played': 1706759835}
review:
This is a game about inflicting horrible situations on yourself, and using the meager resources from those crises to balance out the damage. It's a game where nucular armageddon is a viable winning strategy, as long as you trick your opponent into burning the world first. It embodies Cold War fears and all the best propaganda has to offer. 

Some people resent how much luck has to do with winning this game, but that's ultimately only a small part of the strategy. Rolling for coups and realignments requires careful planning and well-placed risks, and luck can be overcome by persistence and hand management.

Edit (9/25/2017): While I still recommend the game, I want to write in again to express my confusion over how the AI handles DEFCON and European Control. Simply put, the AI can't respond to these strategies very well. About a third of my wins against the AI are to these strategies, almost all unforced errors and bizzare, suicidal plays by the AI.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970561875', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1612221953}
review:
A great implementation of an amazing boardgame.  

For those that already know and love Twilight Struggle, Playdek has done a great job creating an easy-to-use and smooth interface.  Matchmaking has been smooth, and I have never had trouble finding a game.  Since time to play is a scarse resource for me, I love the asychronous multiplayer -- a can play my move whenever I have time, and I get an email when it is time for my next turn.  AI is compenent and perfectly adequate for learning the game and picking up a game when I have a little time to kill but not enough to play a whole game in one sitting.  The best part is that I have been able to introduce friends from around the country to this awesome game.

For those that haven't played the boardgame, I can only describe it as an incredibly tense, highly thoughtful and incredibly strategic chess-like game, which perfectly reflects the back-and-forth and brinksmanship of the Cold War.  This is a thinking-person's game, and takes at least two or three games to really understand how all of the mechanics fit together.   If you are at all into thoughtful strategy games, then I cannot recommend this enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213905568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1631188393}
review:
한글 번역판이 아니라 시작이 어렵네요. 규칙만 잘 알게되면 재미있게 할 수 있을것 같습니다.
가격도 비싸지 않아 구입하고나서 가지고 있다가 심심할때 하면 좋을것 같습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007798475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1623563983}
review:
What a fantastic game!  I think the AI is really aggressive, but playing against another person is a blast.  For a casual game, play with a 7 day/player time limit, and really plan out your effort.

This game is a blast.  A must buy for cold-war strategists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033405369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1494542635}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041132390', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 27720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15146, 'last_played': 1699403530}
review:
Edited back to being Negative again, after returning to play after years of absence.

Why? Because the algorithm is a steaming pile of horse manure. Why is it that you seldom roll a 5-6 when rolling for coups, but often roll exactly that when in Beartrap or Quagmire? Only once in the physical version have I ever encountered a situation where Beartrap has completely flipped a game on its head. Never had to deal with such shite in Chantry, nor did I ever witness it in Vassal, but it seems to be commonplace in this joke of a "official" Playdek version that I've actually lost count - and that in itself is farcical. 

Well I may have lost count, but it least it gave me my f**king memory back. On the same day I decide to come back online, I get Quagmired all the way into the next turn (and then some), being instantly reminded why I stopping playing in the first place. You want a true online board game that doesn't rely on luck to sh*t on your head? Play chess because you won't find it here. You can strategise all you want but nothing will save you from the BULLSH*T die rolls. 


EDITED REVIEW TO TURN IT POSITIVE. I'm now so used to it that I've forgotten what Chantry is like. Plus it is quite a handy little game to have on your smartphone. Yes, I would recommend it on Google Play.

ORIGINAL REVIEW: 

Crappy digital version of a great board game. It's seriously killing my interest in Twilight Struggle. 

Chantry was free, much better, and it cut to the chase. The UI on this game is clunky, the tabs/map has poor choice of colouring, and you can tell this game was designed for a smartphone. It's good I haven't played it fullscreen, because I've heard the buttons don't actually work when doing so. Meanwhile, the buttons themselves look ugly, bulky, and they flash at you, along with the flying headlines that fly at you every time a round ends. They have too many confirmation processes which are unnecessary, such as the DEFCON reminder. Urgh. It's like they're marketing the game to 12 year olds. Just. URGH.

Additionally, the AI is terrible. It once gave Europe to me on a platter, then instead of preventing me from having more countries, it just wasted all of its points trying to break my controlled countries. I've read two accounts now where it chooses (on its first turn, on the first round) to coup the Philippines with the China card...what even...

Finally, considering they had a budget of nearly $400,000, I scratch my head to why this game only has 4 soundtracks (two of which are national anthems, they all loop every minute or less), which sound like they've been made on Guitar Pro 6? Seriously?

However, I will state the positives;
- I like the chance calculator for die rolls, and country counter for each continent. However, I don't even read these.
- The Game Log.
- The continent zoom buttons. Which I don't use either.
- I like how it keeps your W/L record.


Now, to speak of the online. Things the online is missing and requires;
- You can't watch other people's games. This needs to be available.
- You can't title the matches you create to describe what kind of game you wanna play. Infact the matchmaking interface looks fugly, and needs a rehaul; they can put it on the same page with the chatbox, for starters.
- They need to sort out its ranking system. I thought it was neat at the start, but then I realise it's not a real ranking system, and is unbalanced (not even depending who you lose to).
- They need a 'hardcore' mode, which doesn't tell you of which cards are redundant, which doesn't tell you that you need to hand in your scoring cards two rounds before the end of the turn, which doesn't keep a track of every card used, and which doesn't ask you to confirm every decision you make.
- Perhaps add tournaments.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985911631', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 9962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5223, 'last_played': 1488000802}
review: I had a blast playing this game while watching the CNN Cold War documentary series.  You can probably play ten games of this in the time you could do one in real life.  The strategy is interesting, though the scoring card system is a little arbitrary.  There are some valid complaints about the AI, but I suspect it will improve, and I've still lost a bunch of games.  Really though, run the CNN cold war docs and fire this up with a cold war cocktail, and you've got a tasty little scene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262136130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1467984336}
review:
This implementation is very mediocre if not bad. Each of the free online implementations of this game that I've seen were better (and since shut down because of this one, which is fair).

Complaints
[list]
   [*] No way to access full help while in-game
   [*] Scrolling in the help window zoom the map behind it
   [*] Undo placement of starting influence removes ALL influence (not the most recently placed one)
   [*] When zoomed all the way out you can't see the whole map (either part of Asia or part of America is cut off) and you can't resize the game window
   [*] Can't scroll backwards in the game log
   [*] Animations for the other player's action are quite fast and can't be replayed
[/list]

In all, this is not worth the steep $15 price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994121840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 23118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5401, 'last_played': 1597004015}
review: One of the best wargames ever designed has received the best boardgame port I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015028007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1483902306}
review: I recommend this both for people who are interested in learning how to play and those who already have the board game and want to get better. The AI in the game is competant and allows you to play around with different positions and opening to get the experience. If you are like me and only have a few people who are able to play, you can quickly get to seeing people's preferences and this allows you to be more rounded in your play style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993211344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 23717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3453, 'last_played': 1640247100}
review:
Nice implementation of the boardgame, with a good online match up system and "chess-clock" style play ranging from blitz games to 45 days each.

Gripes:
The AI is useless for anyone except a total beginner, but with a game this complex what else can be expected? It's actually still a nice feature to have, even if can't win.
There are still a few obscure bugs as of this review (exchanged Missile Envy playable in headline, Rule 6.1.1 not being applied to Iron Lady, Late War variant win condition...). Developers appear to be actively squashing bugs though, so hopefully these won't last long.
The game lacks an easy way of referencing which cards are potentially in your opponent's hand. For asynchronous long-term play this means you currently have to keep notes outside the game itself, which is cumbersome. I've been assured this situation will be improved in a future patch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025396221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4016, 'last_played': 1683760542}
review:
This is a very nice reproduction of the board game. I rarely get to play the physical game anymore, so I've been looking forward to this version for a while. The visual/audio flourishes are a nice touch, and the UI is very clear so you always know what's happening. 

My main gripe is with the AI. For any veteran of the game, the current AI is pretty much a punching bag. For example, I always give them the maximum handicap of 10 influence, and I usually end the game with Domination/Control of all regions without much effort. It's really that bad. While it's understandable that the AI has to cater towards new players, getting to play against a skillful AI was a big draw for me. I hope that Playdek gets the AI to a point where we can choose the difficulty level of solo play. 

Overall: Good production, but AI needs serious work. As much as I would like to recommend this game, I can't do it until the AI has improved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042036592', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3196, 'last_played': 1564335765}
review:
Настоящее пособие по мировой политике без скучных описаний из учебников по истории: перевороты, войны, борьба за влияние и космическая гонка — ключевые эпизоды холодной войны как часть большого плана, разработчиком которого являетесь вы! Приведите мир к коммунистической утопии или опутайте его капиталистическими сетями свободной торговли и демократии: так или иначе, без борьбы не обойтись. 

Одна из самых глубоких настольных стратегических игр при переходе в цифру только улучшилась: красивый и удобный интерфейс, обучающий режим и рейтинговая онлайн-система, позволяющая меряться собственным стратегическим гением с игроками по всему миру. 

Впрочем, любить холодную войну или даже настольные игры вовсе не обязательно: огромная реиграбельность и глубина понравятся всем любителям стратегий. 

Из недостатков отмечу отсутствие возможности наблюдать партии других игроков и куцые возможности таймера, ограничивающего ваше время на ходы: если вы новый игрок, часа или получаса на все действия может не хватить, а по 4 часа почти никто не играет (у опытных игроков средняя партия длится полтора-два часа). Другой момент: очень бедный саундтрек, что, впрочем, нивелируется возможностью играть в оконном режиме и включить фоном свой саундтрек. 

В любом случае, игра очень достойная и своих денег стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971414823', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1514913943}
review:
Increíble el juego la verdad, la implementación es bestial y no pierde nada respecto a la versión de juego de mesa.

Para el jugador de nivel bajo y medio la IA esta bastante lograda la verdad, y si empiezas ahora con el jugo te llevará bastante poder ganarla.

Espero que GMT se anime a habilitar el workshop para poder cambiar el diseño horrible de las cartas (que es el mismo que la edición original) y poder cambiarlo por el de las nuevas ediciones que estan mucho mejor.

En cualquier caso lo recomiendo 100%, más con el precio mas que ajustado que tiene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073114791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1622772044}
review: Incredibly fun game that holds true to the original board game. A must have for any TS fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996123110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1703522183}
review: I already liked this as a Board Game (easily my favorite). The computer version makes for a fun way to kill some time against a computer or to play online. If you are willing to spend the money and want a fun brain teaser to pass some time give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069958636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 3119, 'last_played': 1711836687}
review:
I'm a huge fan of Twilight Struggle and really appreciate the makers for creating the game. That said, I cannot recommend purchasing the digital version of this game in its current incarnation.

First, the AI is truly awful, it presents no challenge to a veteran whatsoever. If there were multiple difficulty options and this AI was ranked Very Easy then that would be fine. This AI couped the Phillipines with the China Card on the first turn... it boggles the mind. Would it really be so difficult to tell the AI to coup Iran instead? Iran is a much higher priority than the Phillipines. The AI also has a strange tendency to headline India-Pakistan War/Nuclear Test Ban on the first turn... when both India and Pakistan are empty and Defcon is at 5. A stronger AI would certainly headline something like Socialist Governments/Red Scare instead and use Nuclear Test Ban for Operations. It feels like whoever programmed the AI had no real understanding of how to play the game.

Now this issue with weak AI would be fine if the online mode was good. It's much more fun to play against humans after all. Unfortunately each time I've played online my connection to the game's servers has been consistently failing every minute or two, which makes the game unplayably slow and wastes tremendous amounts of time. My connection to my ISP is fine, I can browse the web and play any other online games just fine, but for some reason Twilight Struggle just can't connect to my internet. It's hugely irritating. The fan-made version of Twilight Struggle (hosted for free on chantry-games.com) could connect to my internet but for some reason this official version cannot. A fix for this issue would make the game much better

Now onto the positives. The music is great and sets the tone very well, makes me feel tense just listening to it. The visual design of the game is very appealing too and it's very easy to navigate the UI. The quotes from US and Soviet leaders at the start of each turn is a nice touch, though it would be better if it wasn't always the same quote - I'd like to hear more randomised variety.

Also, a note to GMT games, please allow chantry-games.com to continue hosting their fan made version of the game. At least until you have fixed the bugs in the online mode of this version. Arry's version is just more user-friendly, you should have employed him

UPDATE: Moved from university to my parents house and the online mode works just fine now, worth buying and playing as long as you don't live at a university

author: {'steamid': '76561198006340065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2719, 'last_played': 1584288290}
review: Great game. UI recreates the original boardgame perfectly. AI is not smart as should be. When AI plays with USSR is a tough game, but if AI is the US opponent it has no chance. Some stupid decisions

author: {'steamid': '76561198030937485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1700885142}
review: I have loved Twilight Struggle as a board game and this version does not disappoint.  I have found the AI to be challenging and would recommend this game to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971799986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1501548544}
review: A faithful adaptation of the excellent board game.  The board game's mechanics are designed around the mindset of the political and military leadship during the Cold War.  You must work to contain your opponent influence from spreading across the world while extending yours as far as possible, match the military aggression of your opponent, and win the space race, all while playing a game of brinksmenship where you skirt the edge of nuclear war (causing a nuclear war results in an instant loss).  Each turn you are handed a set of cards containing historical events associated with you and/or your opponent.  These cards allow you to conduct operations, or allow the events on the card to occur, and the most important events can only be played once per game. If you play your opponents event for operations, the event fires, too.   In a sense, this means most events in the game will inevitably occur; your primary role is to influence the timing of these events to your benefit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972342084', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1460779343}
review:
This is a faithful adaptation of Twilight Struggle for the PC. If you like Twilight Stuggle, that's a good thing...

The only problem is... I really don't like Twilight Struggle. Having played Labyrinth: War on Terror, that game showed me the proper way to do these games. So why do I recommend it, because the game is stable, and a faithful adaptation, and I'd like to see MORE GMT products move to a digital arena.

My problems with Twilight Struggle itself have to do with the original design of the board game itself. Turn structure turns the game into a pointless slog where the two players basically just run in circles around each other. Card design is incredibly swingy, and depending on your hand you really don't have any choice about play order. You must play your hand in a way to mitigate how much the cards punch you in the nuts. They punch you in the nuts quite a lot, it's why my group calls in the nut punch game. Also, setup time while shorter than many games is still quite long, but this is obviously absent in the digital version. But if you like the feel it captures that fairly well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995192259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1462290618}
review: If you like the board game you'll like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111242814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1705089722}
review:
This game is faithful to the physical version, has a great interface, simple intuative controls and helpful auto-resolve features for events and scoring.
The AI can give you a hard fight and has taught me some useful lessons about how to use realignments. However, it can also be immensely stupid. It is very possible to win the game on round one via European control. The AI seems to be be oblivious to the fact that you are gunning for control - very odd! 
Hopefully the developers will train the AI to recognise strategies like the above - strategies which a human player would never fall for.
Overall, this game is great - and will get even greater if the AI is able to continually learn from its human opponents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074590586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1497577570}
review: Through two plays, the game seems very well done. AI is good (to a noobie). Struggled to run a bit on an older Macbook, but was fine on a newer Mac mini. Wish there was a way to call up card images from the log to review past actions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301780887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1585394500}
review:
The user interface of this implementation of Twilight Struggle is horribly ugly, with nasty colours, bizarre decisions to alter the order of things relative to the board-game (why is the DEFCON track backwards?), animated nonsense, and the glitzy blinking on and off of everything is driving me bonkers. This seriously hurts my eyes. Horrible, horrible, GUI.

I love Twilight Struggle but I have no idea whether the AI of this implementation is any good - I just wasted the cost price of this game because the nasty interface means I simply can't play this horror.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971985831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 18870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1699230400}
review:
This isn't a review of the game itself; there are plenty of extreamely indepth and well thought discussions on boardgamegeek.com

However, this videogame adaptation is fantastic. There were a couple of bugs shortly after the release but after a quickly released patch I havn't had any trouble. The ui is well put together and understandable, the ai is decent, and the multiplayer system works quite well.

Coming from someone who loves the physical boardgame, I highly recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971873609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1642, 'last_played': 1633779868}
review:
Pros: 
+ Оригинал - хорошая игра
+ Выглядит симпатично
+ Нормальный интерфейс
Cons:
- Слишком много багов, некоторые из них приводят к проигрышу.
- АИ - странный, играть за советы не интересно из-за того что АИ забивает на Европу.
Хочу играть но пока не поправят минусы смысла портить себе удовольствие не вижу.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141235197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1462081151}
review:
Fascinating game and this is a good implementation. The biggest failing is that you cannot save a game against the computer, and the board game on which this video game is based is a long game. I have yet to play all the way through before having to quit and at that point, you lose the state of your game.

The video game implementation should not let a learner like me lose the war by reducing DEFCON below 2. It should just say, "you can't do that, it would lead to thermonuclear war (DEFCON 1) and you would lose the game." Letting the players inadvertently kill themselves is always bad UI.

It's also unclear why you can't do things, even when you refer back to the manual. A popup explanation of why an action can't be taken in a region, like why a coup attempt can't be made in a particular country, would be *very* helpful to learning the game. I assume the game knows why an action is valid in a country or not... it should tell the player.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973122615', 'num_games_owned': 1081, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 7239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2272, 'last_played': 1697214618}
review:
This game wasn't the number one game on Board Game Geek for 10 years for nothing. While those who don't have much experience in hobby gaming might be a little put off at first, the game is actually pretty simple from a mechanics standpoint. You'll probably lose your first few games as you get a feel for the flow of the game and how to best play your cards. Eventually you'll settle into a crisis management mindset not unlike the actual Cold War. I haven't been playing this game for a terribly long time (I picked up the physical version of this game in January of 2016), but it has quickly proven its depth and lasting entertainment value.

This digital port is faithful to the board game and is pretty great overall. Some of the visual flourishes add some much needed flavor to the game (turn animations and voice clips at the start of each turn), but there are definitely some quirks. Cancelling an action will sometimes result in the replay of the entire round of the pervious player, and the AI definitely isn't the best. Also, this was a great chance to improve on the artwork and layout of the cards and absolutely nothing was done with them.

However, the asynchronous multiplayer is awesome if you can preserve your train of thought over several days (which I do have a bit of a problem with.) When the mobile ports come out it'll be awesome to be able to continue your game on the go. 

Definitely a great game overall!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047599702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2170, 'last_played': 1709956357}
review:
绝对的诚意之作，虽然跳票良久，但好歹终于将全球桌游排名第1（很遗憾，现在是第2了，第1请参见Pandemic Legacy）基本完美地带到了PC，冷战热斗一直以来无疑是许多兵棋和桌游爱好者的菜，对这款游戏的评价更多是对冷战热斗这款桌游的评价本身，但事实上对实体游戏本身没有任何评价的必要，因为1）冷战题材；2）卡牌驱动；3）世界排名前2。现在，PC版完美的解决了TS爱好者们的对战平台问题（此前的F14平台并不理想）。

游戏的各项细节都非常棒，操作直观简洁，界面高度友好，音乐、音效、讲话原声无一不将我们代入到美苏争霸的时代。

目前有一些可以改善的地方：
1、	加入复盘系统，将游戏记录导出研究，导入精彩对战研习；
2、	多人在线对战加入观战模式；
3、	AI反映慢，出牌速度需要大幅优化（强烈建议）；
4、   AI没有分级，目前只有easy级别，对于经验玩家来说挑战不足；开发更有挑战的AI无疑是开发者花费更大精力，但是值得（强烈建议）；
5、	可以想见，TS是一个触屏友好的游戏，移动端相比PC端更加友好，现在仅可以在Surface上体验，希望制作公司争取早日完成IOS和Android版的开发，扩大市场和用户人群，甚至主打移动端（强烈建议）。
6、   中文支持。其实牌面的英文不难，现阶段而言，对于有英文障碍的玩家建议通过中文实体牌来辅助学习，但长期的市场拓展还是需要本地化的支持。这个并不难，牌面的翻译已经有了，只是官方是否采用。目前没有其他主要语言的支持，官方应该有这样一个多语种的计划。

最后建议，如果你是桌游爱好者，如果你是兵棋爱好者，如果你是策略游戏爱好者，如果你是政治军事历史爱好者，不要犹豫，一手入实体牌，一手入steam版。

____________

大概在6月中旬，Playdek进行了一次非常低调的更新，游戏新闻上没有任何信息。但是，这次更新真的非常不错。原因如下：
1、	现在可以支持热座模式了，只要选择player vs player，就可以进行热座了，不用担心对手看不到你的动作，所有的对方动作都会在你的回合予以回放。
2、	现在，每一张对手	牌的用途可以看的清清楚楚，无论是影响力，事件，还是XX。
3、	对于会导致核爆的出牌，系统会给出提示，这个功能很贴心，对于新手来说，也不至于那么莫名其妙了。
4、	增加了许多历史原声资料，例如红场大阅兵等等，音像资料更加丰富动人了。
5、	AI出牌慢的问题在一定程度上得到了优化，但还是不快。
6、	更重要的是，IOS版已经同步推出了，50元。有兴趣的朋友可以购入，在iPad上的体验非常不错。PC玩家也得以和IOS玩家一同对战。

最后，不是广告，强烈建议iPad玩家入IOS版。

author: {'steamid': '76561197975130845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 52, 'playtime_at_review': 2258, 'last_played': 1711504492}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970498030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1461289147}
review: Captures the board game perfectly. Multiplayer matchmaking is a little sparse but its there. AI is quite good. Great way to try out one of the top 3 games of all time without having to become and expert on the rules or convince someone else to commit to the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963829391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1557586663}
review:
I love this game. I never heard of it before I read a test on a blog for games. I instantly bought it and I enjoyed right away. I managed to understand the rules by reading the manual and then playing the tutorial, which is really well done for beginners.
Although I'm still not anywhere near mastery of the game, I am able to beat the A.I. However the A.I. still beats me often enough. In the next time I will play online against human opponents by using the Playtek matchmaking system. After creating an account you can easily find games in-game. 
I can really recommend this game and I am going to buy the table top version of it too. Sadly, it is really expensive compared to the computer game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171040175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 67709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2067, 'last_played': 1710642059}
review:
Like the majority of players here, I have enjoyed this board game for years. 

As a child of the 80's and a history buff, it really was made for me.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197975907173', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1680643942}
review: I never played the board game version of this, and I really regret that. This is an amazing game of strategy, deception, and just the right amount of luck. The game is complicated, but if you play the tutorial the rules are fairly easy to pick up. I saw a few other people complaining about the AI turn length, but it's really only about 5-10 seconds. If you don't have the patience to wait that long, this probably isn't the game for you anyway. This is one of those few games I will never uninstall and will still be playing many years from now. Great game 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027208327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1861, 'last_played': 1461951964}
review:
Terrible. Just terrible.

Inability to take back some headline plays (but not others!), inconsistent AI competency, and the long-ass "AI is thinking" times make this game almost unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965703690', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1608, 'last_played': 1675484426}
review:
Do you know and love this boardgame?  Congratulations, you can now play it without having to fiddle / argue with the rules, online, instantly, with anyone in the world.

For everyone else, uh...good luck?

I've invested a ton of time already into this game, with no intention of slowing down.  The only thing I could ask for, is for GMT to start looking into a Steam version of Labyrinth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014967518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1550800240}
review:
Unplayable in its current state. Buttons don't work on fullscreen mode, and various functionalities(like re-alignment rolls) stop working after a few rounds with no discernible way to avoid the bug. I will edit this review if it becomes workable, but currently it's worse than a beta.

Edit: Its been over a month, this game is still unplayable. The controls simply stop working after round three. I wanted to like this game, I love the board game version, one of the best out there. How this game is positively rated is beyond. In all my years on steam I have never once sought a refund. I will for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982429518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1461676727}
review: At least it is not the $44 the board game costs so I did not waist that much money. Unfortunately, I tried to play this game one last time and now I am at three hours and cannot get a refund.

review:
Well I refunded this game because I don't like luck of the draw, card based strategy games (that was a lot of adjectives). I feel since so much of the game depends on the cards drawn it removes a lot of strategy from the game as well I straight up don't like the mechanics. It wasn't grand strategy like I thought. It is just a family board game. (also I encountered a never ending turn bug just fyi)

Not my cup of tea/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198205276852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1489443001}
review:
One of my all-time favorite boardgames by GMT has offically ported over to the PC. I couldn't be happier at the transition.

First, I love the topic: The Cold War. Not only does this version utilize all of the orignal images found on the playing cards from the boardgame (historical photos, propaganda, etc.), but it also includes soundbites of famous speeches from the period, unsettling music, war noise, rallies.

Second, talk about choices! Will you spread your ideological thinking and influence across the world, attempt coups, trigger historical events, or sink time and energy into the space race? Will you sink the world closer to war as the Defcon number drops?

I've played a few games now of this version, more than I ever played of the boardgame, and I love how it has encapsulated the rules and dice rolls behind the scenes. Unlike the table top version, you don't have to double-check the rulebook to make sure you're adjusting influence or commiting a coup properly. And if you do have a rules question, simply click on the ? mark on the screen and it will pop-up a page with what you need to know based specifically on what you're trying to do.

Both GMT and Playdek have turned a remarkable table top boardgame into a wonderful PC version.

Now, if I could only win...

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198072624968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2236, 'last_played': 1654437036}
review: The game  is a wonderful digital interpetation of the outstanding boardgame. The experience is very much that of playing a boardgame with cards and pieces. The developers have already cleaned up the UI and some basic flaws that showed up in the initial release, which demonstates great support and commitment to the game.  I think the AI plays a very good game, and it continues to beat me regularly. I'm a veteran wargamer and it gives me a great fight each and every time.  If you are, like myself, someone who always wanted to try the highest rated boardgame on Boardgame Geek but couldn't find time or an opponent, this game is for you.  The learning curve in terms of playing is not steep, but the strategy curve (is that a term?) is *very* steep.  What seems basic at first is in fact quite nuanced and the more you play the more you realize what a tremendously challenging battle of wits this game is.  Finally, it has that greatest sought after qualtiy of a good game, of just wanting to play one more turn, or get a re-match so you don't make the same mistake (only to make new mistakes as you learn!).  Like the boardgame it gives a great feel for the Cold War and weaves a lot of history into the game.  Wonderful experience, highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006514160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1617571483}
review:
As a Twillight Struggle veteran this game is decent in solo mode. The AI is not very sharp(plays defcon suicide cards all the time) but it will take many many games before a new player can match it.

Thing is the multiplayer sucks. Plain and simple. For a fan who wanted to get a decent platform to play this game online this release is sad.

The matchmaking system is not trying to establish a community around the game. It's useful only if you got friends who also got the game.

Last but not least the game does not try to repair the few but existant problems (balancing without extra IP options, countries that exist but nobody in his right mind ever placed a single IP, like Sweden or Finland that seems like good idea but is never used) of the original game.

All in all the price is really low and the solo mode can be really entertaining for a new player, still I cannot reccomend a game that I paid but have no interest in playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067904596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1634985785}
review:
Ok, I'm a fan of the original board game Twilight Struggle and this is why I bought this game. But I have to admit that, as a computer game is really poor. It is true that it keeps all the flavour of being playing the board game, but it has some important design flaws.  

So, it is a nice game, it is playable, but being honest, the design could be far better and usability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232811476', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1685086719}
review:
各种政变和调整，有数值提示。还是蛮贴心的。暂时也没发现什么BUG。
头条还有各种背景音很有FEEL。
最重要的是：可 以 打 电 脑 。。打发时间利器。
另外想吐槽一下，老外建房间，设置的苏联一方从不让点。果然菜鸡居多。。当然我也就强一点点而已。。

这游戏大概没有不会玩的新手会买。真有的话，请打AI一百把先。。如果打AI能稳定在5到6回合时就获胜，上线吊打那些菜鸡玩家绝对没问题。

author: {'steamid': '76561197999771333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 63912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 451, 'playtime_at_review': 11908, 'last_played': 1712435679}
review:
Twilight Struggle is often considered the best board game ever. I'm glad to have sponsored this well done adaption for the PC on Kickstarter.
The AI performs bettter than I expected. But the game is of course best enjoyed against a human opponent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275108288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1581795925}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985114798', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1884, 'last_played': 1665365447}
review: Rock solid implementation of the best board game ever made.  Get it now.
