author: {'steamid': '76561197981027175', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 7082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5401, 'last_played': 1690318244}
review:
Edited 9/29/18 to reflect current state of the game:

*********************************************
It has been over two years and the Turn Zero expansion is still completely bug-ridden, and likely abandoned. To make matters worse they released the first update since 2017 this week and it broke core functionality, like the music changing with the DEFCON levels. I don't understand how something so paramount to the tension of the game can slip by simple Q&A.

It started as a great game but I can't recommend it anymore based on the fact that it essentially (especially Turn Zero) is unfinished. And the once-a-year patches seem to break more than they fix, then you have to wait 6+ months for another patch. Stay away, or you'll likely find a game you really enjoy but get frustrated at what it becomes.

*********************************************

Excellent translation of the boardgame. The AI could use a little work, but otherwise I have found no bugs. If you're like me and own the boardgame but have no one to play it with, the digital version is a godsend. PlayDek is pretty good about updating their titles as they do on mobile. I'm sure the AI will get some updates.

Don't get me wrong, the AI is definitely not a pushover, and you can always adjust it before playing with a slight handicap (just like you'd do if teaching someone to play the physical version).

I can't wait until they officially port this to Android, it's one of my favorite games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053212817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1703537901}
review:
This game has the same tension as the original boardgame. What it lacks in a real physical board, it makes up with some good tension music. 

Some things to note that I am not a super-fan of.

The buttons are spread out all over the board, giving the menu a slightly scattered feeling. However, it kind of makes sense as you get used to it, and I presume this is to make it easier for the developers to make the game work across more platforms without changing to much.

Dice-rolls. Actually, I would like some kind of animation. I dont know why, and it will most likely take up time. But I would like them, since an animation would catch your eye. 

Cards in play have their OPs value hidden. No biggie, and you can enlarge the card as well, showing the entire cardface. 

AI seems to provide some resitance, but most likely needs some more polish. Also, all of the setups I have done this far, the soviet AI starts the same way, perhaps the best way, but gets kind of old. 

Upsides. 

Zoomable map, and regions are easily accessible using buttons. 

The little guide that helps you count the likelyhood of a success of a coup for instance, and the outcomes of each die result. Not that it is super-needed, but it provides some transparency to what happens, and is most likely a good aid to new players.

The board overall, that shows what you need to know in a concentrated fashion (even if I somewhat miss the scoreboard). And the way you can click something like the score or turn to reveal alot of more useful information. 

Game well made. 10 / 10 would recomend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981282826', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1558742860}
review:
Bottom Line: An excellent implementation of an amazing board game.

Twilight Struggle itself is a beautifully crafted card-driven wargame, with the Cold War theme being wonderfully brought out through the palpable tension created by seemingly no-win situations due to the deal.

Playdek has done a great job creating a digital implementation of the game. They managed to retain the look and feel of the board game, to where it it doesn’t feel like “video game”, but a board game. However, they have managed to streamline the interface to where you can play the game without worrying about playing it right: Action Rounds are tracked, military operations are recorded, points are scored, and Events are removed from the game all seamlessly and flawlessly.

Needless to say, TS is a 10, and so is this digital edition. Personally, I cannot wait for the mobile version to be released, and I already plan on getting at least two more copies: One for my Android phone, and one for my wife’s iPad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110765455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1463543685}
review: Very fun game. As a new player, I wish it had warnings before you play a DEFCON suicide card. I've accidentally done that twice and had interesting games end in easily avoidable ways. It warns you very clearly about the need to play your scoring cards, so why not a warning against playing Olympic Games when the DEFCON is at 2?

author: {'steamid': '76561198030729986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 42461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1686330795}
review: So far it seems well worth the wait. One of the greatest board games of all time and it's a faithful and good translation to a computer game. The AI is better than I expected, but an experienced TS  player will be able to handle it easily. I like the tutorial for new players, but this is one of those games that looks more complicated to learn than it actually is - a few games against the computer AI should get the average strategy gamer up to speed. The card/board mechanics that the game is actually based on are as good as ever; you must manage cards representing historical events that help one side or the other, and often to make a play you have to hand your opponent an 'event' that helps his efforts. That results in a real feeling of historical progression through the cold war and creates all kinds of problems for each side as they move through the game. At 15 bucks this is an excellent value for a game that never fails to absorb me every time I play it. Hoping a lot of new players are brought into the TS fold thanks to this well-designed PC version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004177898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1691611132}
review: Great game. Faithful to the original. I've played four full games now as US. No undo if you accidentally trigger nuclear war after two hours of play is frustrating if playing for "fun". I'd played the board game a few times as both US & USSR but playing as US I found the AI to be a decent challenge. At first I thought it was buggy and there does seem to be a problem in Windowed mode on MAC. However, now I've familiarised myself with the interface and reacquainted myself with some of the more subtle rules, I realise that my initial frustrations  were not bugs but rule enforcement. The layout & interface works a dream once you've got used to it, with ability to sort cards, review each card played impact etc,. I would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970281251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 3788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1315, 'last_played': 1469240232}
review:
Twilight Struggle is an excellent board game - a wonderful mix of history, strategy, and unpredictability.

This implementation is solid, the atmosphere is pleasant (the music and voice clips hit just the right tone) and the game progresses efficiently.  There could be a little more help for new players to get going (eg. stuff like a message box explaining why you're not allowed to coup the country you clicked on or whatever) - but its easy enough to pick up through a few AI games.  The AI is capable of giving you a game, but is not particularly strong; I'd love to see them add a hard AI here, as playing against an AI is very covenient.

In any case, this is a great game; if you enjoy turn based strategy, this is a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996402126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1588807045}
review:
TL;DR: this game needs a bit of patching to be considered a final product but the board game is absolutely great and with a good amount of work this PC release can be as well.

I recommend this release with reservations. Unless they patch it, players will get tired of the glitches really fast.

=====

I've been a fan of the board game since forever and it was a great surprise to see this release. The board game is fantastic, the best designed I've ever played. It's clear to me that this PC release has the potential to get many people hooked up badly. 

Unfortunatelly, it needs a lot of work to get there. I was hoping it was at least better executed than the old Vassal Engine we used to play TS online but in many aspects it isn't. All the problems with this game (as of 21.04.2016) are fixable. We need patches for:

1. FULLSCREEN GLITCHES
The buttons don't work on fullscreen. Some get misplaced but others, like the "confirm action" simply don't work at all. This is absolutely shocking because it shows poor testing.

2. INFORMATION PLACEMENT
Things are badly placed on the screen. To fit everything into a notebook screen you sacrifice the ability to read the country labels (which is a problem for new players). This could've been partially solved by placing scores and logs in a way that uses the holes left by the map (e.g. both sides of the south Pacific, over the Soviet Union, south Atlantic), pretty much like the real board game does. Instead, what they did was squeeze the map between the top and bottom menu layers. Information isn't well distributed, that's what I mean. Bad design.

3. SOUNDTRACK
The soundtrack is terrible. I used to play the real board game with the DEFCON soundtrack and the match was perfect. I was expecting something like that but unfortunatelly the soundtrack is terribly annoying. Most of the sound effects are equally poor. All the little noises at the click of every button remind us more of Farmville than of Twilight Struggle Deluxe Edition.

Positive things:

A. AI IS GOOD
I've played a match as United States vs the AI and it seems to be as good as you could ask for. It (unfortunatelly) doesn't punish you very hard for mistakes but doesn't make many mistakes of its own either. That's where they must have focused most of their testing and it has paid off. Maybe playing as Soviet Union changes it a bit, the strategies are very different for both sides but my first impression is good.

B. DICE OUTCOMES CALCULATED
Great addition. It's good to see the probabilities and outcomes of specific rolls. You'd have the trouble of calculating them anyway. Having them figured out for you gives it a nice touch. 

C. SIMPLE CONTROLS
You can play it with a mouse and nothing more. I'll probably play it on my TV (read section 2 for explanation). Can't wait for the PS4 release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993175874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1804, 'last_played': 1570183513}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969629457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1575288570}
review: After a long wait it's finally here! A great digital implementation of the amazing board game Twilight Struggle. This digital conversion stays close to the board game format and for Twilight Struggle this is important because it's all about that big world map where the two superpowers are dueling for world domination. A few digital improvements are added and having played the game myself I'm actually learning new things from the digital version, the AI has thought me some great clarifications of the rules so to say :) For the price and features you get and just being able to play some solo matches to learn the game this is well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033453695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 125, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1711952690}
review:
I really have loved this game since it was boardgame. It is finest wargame on existence. 
However there are bugs. It took more than 15 minutes to get certification email and my friend got forefieted since he couldn't play his turn while time was going. I do get that it is quite a job to fix every bug. So I sincerely hope that  bugs got fixed as soon as they get reported.
And I really love it when it gets more visual notification of opponet's play. Which card he played and how and where he used its influences. And you barely notice chatting when opponent send one.
I really recommend this game for boardgame but I shall wait to recommend this steam version to others until it gets its bugs fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971660043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1461778945}
review:
Really nice! Love the board game and the pc port is implemented fine. I didn't ran into the problems others have here, so my only negative points are these ones:

-AI might act sometimes too slow
-Its hard to find out which card the opponent has played (description of the card, not the title which you can look up in the bottom history line). Maybe there is an easier way to look it up. I do it over the history, and than search it in the discarded or removed pile. Is there a way which is not that complicated?
- .... hmm i think thats it

Except that it makes really fun.
Ah, the tutorial is also wonderful. If you buy the board game and really dont like reading manuals... the tutorial is excellent. Learns you the game in a couple of minutes and makes definitly more fun :) Also good for refreshing the memory, if your last game is long in the past.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985317120', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1473133923}
review:
This is the digital version of a boardgame that has been at the top of BoardGameGeek's overall list for around a decade now. But buyer beware, this game is very difficult to pick up. Though the rules are actually quite simple, and the tutorial does a great job in getting your feet wet, it will take time and many matches to draw out the potential of this game.

Are you willing to:


1) Lose repeatedly until you have a grasp on how particular cards will affect the game?
2) Go online and search for information on various openings, game states, or plays? (cough) twilightstrategy.com (cough)
3) Agonize over whether you should start a Coup in Iran or prepare for an inevitable thrust into South America?

If you answer yes to all of these, you will be treated to one on the most engaging, tense, thought-provoking strategy games out there, digital or otherwise!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065387060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1498937161}
review:
I'm a big fan of the physical boardgame. I love it.
The PC version however is a tragedy wrapped in a disaster served with a side of screw you.
The bugs are so horrible that actually playing the game is impossible.
Constant nuclear wars because the AI is too dumb to see that we're at DEFCON 2 is bad enough, but being told that the AI won when starting a nuclear war takes the glowing cake.

Right now the game is akin to masturbating with a cheese grater, should be fun but it hurts like hell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073207967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1570481174}
review:
Really nice implementation of the best board game, it has many little nice things like extracts from speeches from leaders of the time at the beginning of each turn, an alarm sound when the defcon changes or allowing you to view past movements.

The part that I was worried about is the AI and have to say I'm more than satisfied. Sometimes it's a bit too obvious or stubborn but doesn't do anything stupid. Plays better than most people I have met online on websites and if you find it easy to beat it's very easy to give yourself a handicap at the beginning.

I play on Windows and only offline so far but I haven't seen any of the glitches or crashes people talk about.

I highly recommend it especially with such a reasonable pricetag

author: {'steamid': '76561198012877724', 'num_games_owned': 994, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 25431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5924, 'last_played': 1703969588}
review:
Absolutely fantastic. I'd only played the physical game once, about a year ago, but it wedged its way in my mind and I was very pleased to see it adapted as a video game.

Having beaten the AI for the first time, I've encountered a few typos but no bugs. It's graphically well-implemented and clearly well-suited to touchscreen devices (with iOS and Android releases about a month away, I've heard), so if that comes out similarly polished, go for it! PC meanwhile offers the advantage of a bigger screen to examine the whole board.

The gameplay is ridiculously compelling and suspenseful across its whole (not insignificant) game time. This release marks not only an adaptation of an outstanding board game, but a fantastic video game in its own right for any strategy fan.

Edit: Obviously I've played it a lot more now. Incredible game. Love playing online.
My only big complaint is there really needs to be more options for the chess clock, such as 90 mins. It would also be nice if players could vote to extend the clock, as it's satisfying for neither the forfeiter or the winner when the game ends by the clock.
The lobby could do with some work as well, maybe a pop-up when someone joins your game, as currently the only way to be notified is to have exited the game beforehand. Otherwise, you're stuck staring at your game list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044267644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2009, 'last_played': 1585079215}
review:
Come one ppl. So MUCH BUG. Can not finhish single game. Crashed on turn 9. VERY FRUSTATED. Plaese fix this annoyance. Will change opinion when (or if) this impoves. Also SO MUCH CPU usage. I don't this this AI is HAL 9000, please people optimize.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007134206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1462307049}
review:
Twilight Struggle like Poker: few minutes to learn, a lifetime to master.

TO NEWBIES / PPLS THAT NEVER PLAYED THE GAME:

Twilight Struggle is not the easiest game to catch and play, you won't enjoy it until you've an idea of what you'are doing considering the main strategy course.
My suggestion are:
* Play vs IA a lot, and ignore the result of the game.
* Read documentation and strategy on Internet.
* Prefer USSR in your first games, and give NO additional influence to US (+1 US is the actual standard indeed).

During the match:
* Play for the points - Always think which area will be scored. If Europe scoring is gone, don't overfocus yourself on Europe. If you have a scoring card of a region where you are weak and you reasonably think your oppo can overwhelm you there, headline it for limiting his score.
* Do your best for using your event cards as Operation instead of events - They'll be back in reshuffle hopefully flooding opponent hand.
* Consider when play an oppo event - You'll have to do it, just decide when is the best moment for eliminate from the game that card minimizing the effects.
* Consider space race an emergency option - you will not place influence but neither activate the oppo event, but it will be back sooner or later.

Time after time you'll understand that there are some etabilished standards:
* Luck and Unluck with dices and draws are almost ininfluent - you must plan a strategy simulating you'll fail premium rolls, and then enjoy every improvement. Do something "desperate" only if you have no other options. And if you have no other options, you've probably had some misplay before.
* USSR will be aggressive and advantaged in Early War, US will be very strong in Late.
* USSR will try to end game at +20 pts in Mid War, US will close the game in Late War or Turn 10 end scoring.
* USSR Turn1, ActionRound 1 will be on 90% of times: Coup Iran , with a 3 or 4 op card. Generically USSR appreciate Coup every turn as 1st action to degrade and keep Defcon 2 for prohibiting USA Coups in Battlegrounds: logically USSR will avoid to have Non-Battleground cheap countries, so USA will be pressed by Lack of Military OPS.
* You'll play for points but also a step forward - you'll spend some, if able, for take advantage for later scoring, and for later event (i.e.: USSR will "Always" be interested in Middle East due to OPEC Card effect) having a better vision of the game.
* You'll thing about creative tactics like Coup Italy instead of Iran, if you have proper cards to Red-Color Europe; you'll understood that Thailand will be an hot place, that having Pakistan and India in the same time without having their war card in hand can be a problem, and many many many other considerations.
* In the meanwhile have some games playing US, to see the other side of the game and have a deep, complete view of the game, and unlocking it's way to play with clear ideas.

If you are a gamer that stay on-pause thinking about what to do, Twilight Struggle will be like sitting in front of a fire tasting a good Armagnac. And you'll never have a game like the previous one.

Ah, don't forget to play versus human opponents during your learning curve - IA will NEVER be smart, insidious and challenging as another TS player.

If you'll be enough patient and appassionate to appreciate the game, your €/£/$ will be very well repaid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032033828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1584382858}
review: TS è un gioco di carte per due giocatori (o un giocatore contro il bot), ogni giocatore sceglie una fazione USA o URSS. All'inizio di ogni turno è necessario scegliere una carta che verrà usata solo come evento, da lì in poi si potranno giocare le carte come eventi o punti operazione per modificare l'influenza ed il controllo delle varie nazioni del mondo. I punti vittoria si fanno usando le carte "punteggio" relative ai vari continenti, che se giocate al momento giusto possono sbilanciare l'ago dei punti vittoria a favore della vostra fazione. La strategia in questo gioco è altissima e lo consiglio soprattutto agli amanti di questo periodo storico. Questa versione del gioco è solo in inglese, ma non è difficile capire il significato delle frasi sulle carte. Tecnicamente il gioco rende bene l'atmosfera del gioco da tavolo, l'interfaccia è abbastanza pulita, unico neo lo storico delle carte giocate è un po ostico e secondo me è da migliorare. l'IA del gioco è molto valida, non stupida. Per chi volesse leggersi le regole prima dell'acquisto, visiti il sito di Asterionpress e si scarichi il regolamento italiano.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991814374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1804, 'last_played': 1549804921}
review:
OK, I never play complex board games. I dislike the time consuming nature of them,

This game provides you the opportunity to enjoy the fun and challenge of a proper turn based strategy board game, without the hassle of organizing a play date, arguing about rules and fiddling with pieces. At a very cheap price!

Online match making is also very easy and highly recommended.

If you are a 'thinking' gamer, do yourself a favor and pick this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960287650', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 6629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1570062364}
review:
Is Twilight Struggle a Good Game??

Twilight Struggle is a good game, if you haven't played it before then the only thing you really should know is it takes a few games to memorise a few important cards and their ramifications to truly understand how to play. Even if you get a hand full of cards that trigger good events for your enemy, they likely have a hand of events that trigger your events, and having the optionto choose when your opponent events trigger is more powerful than it seems at first.

 There is a palatable tension for both players as you try to figure out what your opponent is doing, which often leads to bluffing maneuvers and domino effects. The USSR player starts strong but weakens towards the end game. Despite this, the game is balanced well.



Is this a good application??

It allows you to play Twilight Struggle online, and doesn't do anything else spectacular. There are a few UI bugs such as setting resolution while in full-screen mode, but I was not prevented from changing any options after some fiddling.

The tutorial works but misses one or two key points. Annoyingly, if you try to make an illegal move, the game won't tell you why. You have to go read the played card to figure out what you're doing wrong.

The AI is smart enough to win the game in some interesting ways, but will occasionally do some really bad/non-sensical moves. In one game vs. the AI it didn't even play a card that would automatically lose them the game if held onto. Apparently it will improve later, but for now  I wouldn't treat the AI as anything but a way to learn the game before playing online.

Since there is nothing stopping you from playing Twilight Struggle on VASSAL essentially for free, the only reason to buy this is if you want to trade VASSAL's quirks for the official game (and it's quirks), nicer graphics and be able to find games easier.


TL;DR: Read the paragraph above, recommended because the game is good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096376469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1461008018}
review:
一款经久不衰的战棋类桌游的电子版
其实我早就听说过冷战热斗的名号，可惜，身边找来找去也没有可以和我一起玩的人，毕竟一局游戏两个小时起在这个快餐游戏的时代确实显得有点不合时宜，再加上传说中厚的一笔的规则书，这款桌游可以说是让我望而却步的。
但是，电子版的出现可以说解决了很多原来存在的问题，比如因为不需要收拾卡片、摆放指示物等，游戏时间减少了不少，而且网络匹配解决了找不到人的问题。所以我就第一时间入了这款游戏。
花了一个小时仔细的把TUT打了一遍，又开了一把人机，总体来讲TUT已经能教给你最基本的规则了，不过更加进阶的技巧还要自己摸索。
总的来说，作为一款桌游的电子版，冷战热斗是合格的，如果你是桌游粉或者对策略战棋有点兴趣的，可以试着入手。

author: {'steamid': '76561197968851498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1485708569}

The graphics update so quickly it is hard to tell so I have to click the card the AI played to see what they did. But for the initial version, two thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004983439', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 5504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1568776724}
review:
First time into war board games...

pros:
- at the moment in which you learn the mechanics, the game is very fun and addictive.
-excellent strategy for those who like to think
- nice tutorial everything you need...
-one of the best stretegy games if not the best

cons:
-poor menu (seems like the game was made for tablet or phones) lot to improve here..
-music is ok but it can be boring after 2 hours of play, the game needs more animations and sound effects but its ok...
-language (only English so you are losing a lot of player base..)

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198073601978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2105, 'last_played': 1642309553}
review:
Creo que la conversión por parte de Playdek del fabuloso juego de mesa Twilight Struggle merece un notable alto, ha habido que esperar mucho para que este proyecto por fin llegase a buen puerto, porque el retraso ha sido enorme, pero parece que el resultado final va a merecer la pena.

Por supùesto quedan algunas cosas que implementar prometidas en la campaña de Kickstarter, por ejemplo la traducción al español, pero esperemos que poco a poco, en sucesivas actualizaciones, se complete.

El apartado gráfico, una vez que te acostumbras, es muy bueno, y al final encuentras todo a mano.

La IA todavía no la he probado a fondo, estoy más interesado en el juego con contrincantes humanos, pero creo que junto con el tutorial, ayudará a coger algo de experiencia a los jugadores novatos, Twilight Struggle es un juego lleno de matices.

Tal vez por sacar algún pero, seguir los movimientos de la IA resulta algo complicado, pero mirando el log se soluciona.

En definitiva, contento porque es un gran juego y con margen de mejora cuando lo pulan definitivamente, espero que la comunidad de jugadores crezca sin parar. Muy recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561198035303725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 5824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1725, 'last_played': 1650066537}
review:
A fantastic version of the best board game ever made. I notice that most, if not all, of the negative reviews are because of bugs and I can honestly say that I've only encountered one bug in over 10 hours of play and the game fits the screen like a glove both in fullscreen and windowed mode. The AI isn't very good either but the developers are apparently gathering data from players to improve it. I'm sure that all the bugs will be dealt with in the near future.

Regarding the game itself it is a 1on1 strategy/war board game where players control the USSR and the US during the Cold War. The cards that the players get to play are based on real historical events meaning that if one is a history buff it will heighten the enjoyment. It's a fairly complex game and I doubt that anyone will feel truly comfortable and confident until game four or so but that goes to show how deep and wonderful it is. Another great thing is that skill truly matters way more than luck. Sure it's possible to lose the game because of poor die rolls if it's extremely tight but usually the better player will prevail. A single game will take approximately 30-120 mins which is great because you won't be forced to dedicate a whole evening to a single game.

If you love board games then purchasing this for 15$ or less is a no-brainer. 

10/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045134818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1584512459}
review:
Very good game, reccomended to me by a friend. The mechanics are complex enough to be challenging, but simple enough to learn on a curve.

However my one complaint, me being a woman, and seeing this is a digital release. I simply request that the "player" pronouns be switched to gender nuetral. I won't give a bad review because I like the game, it's just annoying since I've always felt excluded in my interest in military history. This would be a simple and harmless gesture, and it doesn't even require reprinting paper cards.

I'm still trying to find a way to contact the developer about this. But beyond that, I still love and reccomend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970563120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1475661263}
review:
"The Cold War isn't thawing; it is burning with a deadly heat. Communism isn't sleeping; it is, as always, plotting, scheming, working, fighting."

This is a solid digital version of a superb boardgame. If you like the original you will like to play this version online against distant friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280269152', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 19271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14691, 'last_played': 1591110986}
review:
Actualización noviembre 2017. Se ha ido solucionando y vuelve a estar bien.
----
Actualización 09/01/2017: He jugado unas 120 horas sin la actualizacción y nunca se me ha bloqueado. Desde la actualización SE BLOQUEA TODO EL TIEMPO y es necesario reiniciarlo. POr lo general se congela una vez o dos cada vez que intento jugar un turno... La música nueva también deja bastante que desear. Es una pena, estaba perfecto.
----
Está genial para aprenderlo y jugar online. He tenido que hacer el tutorial un par de veces, pero luego le vas pillando en tema y bueno, acabas ganado fácilmente a la IA. Creo que esto es lo único que no me acaba de gustar, la IA hace cosas bastante tontunas, juega poco los eventos y se centra demasiado en hacer movimientos militares con los puntos de las cartas. Suele dejar de lado la carrera espacial también.

Estoy contentísimo de haber aprendido, ahora podré jugar con amigos el juego de mesa y eso para mí no tiene precio. Jugar al juego de mesa, requiere mucho esfuerzo por parte de un amigo dispuesto a enseñarte por horas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091857649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1708959133}
review:
Good game but full of bugs.
For example If you dont use certain resolution in the full screen mode, you may unable to click every button unless you move the mouse to someplace near the button you want to click.

It's Twilight Struggle, so positive. But for this implementation itself, I cant say its good enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007317366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2189, 'last_played': 1692099160}
review: A faithful adaptation of the best board game of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006438234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1535593457}
review:
I really like this game as a board game, but as a video game, it removes all the fiddly and remembers the few rules I get wrong in the physical version. This game is intense. AS the USSR, you need to pummel the US into submission within the first few turns before the USA gets their legs. USA has to do damage control before the USSR wrecks them and then turn the tide when they get the right moment. This game will make you cry and feel like the whole world is crashing down around you as make good hard heartwrenching decisions that hopefully keeps you alive to fight another round.

This is the Cold War in a box. I cannot wait to play more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983778541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1065, 'last_played': 1654166627}
review:
This game is the digital training tool for the board game of the same name. I am learning loads of tricks. Even if I still play against a limited AI, the gain of experience is invaluable by getting used to the complete deck of cards and worthwile strategies.

MP is possible, cross-platform was also announced, release for iOS and android to be expected soon...

author: {'steamid': '76561197992662173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1631591142}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035718607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1435, 'last_played': 1668628059}
review:
Polecę grę tylko wiernym fanom planszówki. AI aż takie najgorsze nie jest. Po paru grach np. zaczęło mi blokować kraj przyległy do mocarstwa gdy "zauważyło", że go zajmowałem w poprzednich grach. Więc coś tam się uczy. Superłatwo i lajtowo nie jest. Ale z drugiej strony przeważnie wygrywam a nie jestem tuzem TS. A wybierałem specjalnie USA ;).
No ale lipa z paroma bugami. Trzeba pogrzebać czasem w ustawieniach rozdzielczości bo gra może się sama z siebie tak odpalić, że nie da się dosięgnąć wszędzie kursorem. No ale to da się załatwić. 
Gorzej, że np. czasem nagle zwyczajna karta nie da się wystrzelić w kosmos. No i przy grze offline nie działa karta punktująca wykładana jako wydarzenie dekady.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030201204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1524421033}
review:
If you're familiar with the board game, this is an excellent implementation. The rules are the same, the cards work the same, and the AI is decent enough for practicing against. 

My only complaints about it are that the interface is a bit crowded and samey for some of the bars, so it takes a few plays to understand how to read the abbreviated DEFCON and Space Race bars, and it's annoying that you can't see all of the map at once (stupid Argentina and South Africa being out of view!). But it's such a faithful implementation and works so well otherwise that I would still highly recommend buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963635066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1613751167}
review:
I really don't understand the positive reviews. The board game is great, and an online implementation of it would be great, but this is just a mess. Rampant and super-obvious "did they even playtest this?" bugs make it nearly unplayable, and the interface is needlessly clunky and confusing. I can't imagine trying to learn the game from this heap of junk, and I doubt this is going to appeal to anyone that isn't already a fan of the board game. Nothing is intuitive and simply playing a card feels like a chore. 

It's a shame because this could have introduced a ton of people to a really great game and the general hobby of board-gaming. But instead it will just scare them away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981551334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1580560785}
review:
Twilight Struggle está entre los mejores juegos de tablero jamás creados si no el mejor. Lamentablemente juntar a gente alrededor de un tablero es muy difícil y las otras opciones para jugarlo online (vassal, acts, chantry...) todas tienen sus pegas y sobre todo no tienen IA...

Esta edición para pc incorpora de momento una IA, probablemente los que llevamos decenas de partidas a nuestras espaldas ésta nos parecerá algo endeble, pero hace un papel perfecto para iniciar en el juego a aquellos que no hayan tenido oportunidad de jugarlo demasiado, aunque los desarrolladores han prometido ir mejorándola, en cualquier caso un buen jugador al final tendrá que recurrir a pelearse contra otros jugadores si quiere un reto...

Y por supuesto luego hay diversas opciones para jugarlo online, con distintos plazos de tiempo para jugarlo a ritmos más o menos rápidos o totalmente asíncrono llegándote notificaciones al correo cuando te toca mover. Incorpora una suerte de puntuación tipo ELO para poder ver quien la tiene más larga :-)

El tablero, las cartas y los distintos marcadores están muy bien implementados, fáciles de seguir y te permiten llevar el pulso de la partida sin problema.

Hay algunos problemas con la resolución de la pantalla, por ejemplo, cuando pasas a pantalla completa tienes para que funcione correctamente verificar que tienes seleccionada la misma resolución que usas en el escritorio.

He leído que algunos han tenido algún problema con la conectividad durante la partida, a mi no me ha pasado pero bueno, ahí lo dejo.

En definitiva pequeños problemas que se irán solucionando con los sucesivos parches imagino.

Por mi parte lo que espero es que permitan la organización de torneos a través del propio juego y cosas así que le den más vida.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971529043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1842, 'last_played': 1689975233}
review:
This is simply a fantastic port of the boardgame. The AI is 'beginner' player level although it knows all the 'gotchas', if you avoid those, you'll beat it every time. I instead challenge myself to win earlier and earlier in the game. It's still fun, very well done in terms of interface etc. and hopefully they improve the AI, which I believe is a clearly stated aim from the developers for future patches. 

I've not noticed any bugs, after about 20 games.

Now - how about doing Paths of Glory next??? :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028275583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1682617124}
review:
En mi modesta opinión, creo que es una conversión excelente del famoso juego de mesa. Hemos esperado mucho tiempo pero, al final, ha valido la pena. PlayDek ha hecho un gran trabajo, así que... ¡FELICIDADES! :-)

Confieso que no soy un buen jugador de "Twilight Struggle", así que el nivel de la I.A. es más que suficiente para mí (por ahora...). Quizás cuando mejore mi nivel me aburriré, así que entonces buscaré contrincantes humanos  ;-) 
Por ahora he jugado tres partidas (sin contar con el tutorial) y he obtenido dos derrotas por provocar Guerra Nuclear en mi ronda (despistes que tiene uno... ¡ay!...). La victoria que logré fue llevando a los USA y la alcancé en el turno 8 por 21 Puntos de Victoria. Para ganar tienes que estar concentrado al 100%, sino estás muerto. "Twilight Struggle" es un maratón mental que dura dos o tres horas y en el que el cerebro te echará humo pensando qué decisión tomar. Tendrás más opciones de victoria si te aprendes las cartas del juego, si sabes cuándo salen, si llevas un conteo de las mismas, si logras aprender cuándo utilizarlas (una carta o un combo de ellas durante un turno en un momento clave) y conociendo cuáles son los puntos clave a dominar en el mapa con Puntos de Influencia. Hay un porcentaje de suerte, pero este es mínimo.

Creo que los grandes maestros de "Twilight Struggle" encontraran la I.A. floja. Pero para un jugador de nivel medio-bajo como yo, la I.A. está muy bien y supone un reto jugar contra ella. Además, es una manera muy agradable y cómoda de aprender a jugar y de estudiarte las cartas. No es como jugar contra un humano en el tablero físico, claro está, pero esta implementación está muy lograda.

La parte estética de esta versión digital me gusta muchísimo. PlayDek ha hecho un trabajo excelente. Los efectos de sonido los tengo a un volumen bajo, pero le dan una atmósfera temática muy lograda. El sonido no es importante en este tipo de juegos, pero en este caso le da un toque maestro muy bueno porque está muy bien hecho. Hay muchos pequeños detalles que me gustan, como los fragmentos de voz que se escuchan entre turno y turno, o el sonido cuando el nivel de DEFCON baja, o cuando suena el himno del bando ganador al final de la partida... Como digo, todos estos detalles le dan una atmósfera al conjunto muy chula.
   
También creo que visualmente es una maravilla, ya que todo se muestra de manera clara. Debo decir que la interfaz es muy cómoda e intuitiva. 

Quizás por mi parte cambiaría la manera de representar el nivel de "Carrera Espacial" y la de "Operaciones Militares" (no la veo demasiada clara...), pero no es nada serio: te acostumbras y ya está (es fácil). También arreglaría la velocidad con la que el adversario ejecuta sus movimientos, ya que hasta que no compruebas el LOG (registro de movimientos) no sabes qué ha pasado.

Aún no he probado el modo multijugador, pero lo haré. De todas maneras, como digo, la I.A. es competente (aunque a veces toma decisiones extrañas, sobre todo a la hora de colocar Puntos de Influencia...) y, en definitiva, estoy muy satisfecho con este "Twilight Struggle Digital Edition". Este producto de PlayDek llegó tarde, tuvimos que esperar mucho tiempo sobre el plazo previsto, pero ha valido la pena. Es una buena versión y funciona perfectamente (aún no he encontrado ningún bug ni nada parecido...), así que estoy muy contento.

¡Saludos!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968747699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1585463190}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972709619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1638595799}
review:
Twilight Struggle is a digital version of the highly esteemed board game of the same name.   I'll break down my review into sections.

The Game Itself --
Twilight Struggle is widely considered one of the best strategy board games of all time.  It sat at the #1 spot at BoardGameGeek for years before it recently was bumped to #2.       The game itself is dripping with theme, delving you right into the mentality of the Cold War complete with actions striaght out of the headlines.

The game is not a simple one.  The rules are fairly complex and full of "do this, unless it is Tuesday and the moon is full" and the rulebook can sometimes look like a legal document with things like "Refer to Rule 47 subsection A paragraph 3".     However, once you get over the learning curve, the game is quite in depth and rewarding.

Playdek's Implementation --
Implementing a digital version of Twilight Struggle is quite a feat and the result is fairly impressive.   Some UI elements seem a bit disjointed (especially along the bar at the top) and the screen can tend to get a little bit busy at times, but in all the digitial implementation is faithful to the board game.    It also has the great advantage that the game itself takes care of all those niggling rules details for you and offers helpful hints and reminders along the way (for example, the game warns you when you haven't played enough MilOps this turn)

The tutorial is fantastic.   If you haven't played Twilight Struggle before (or its been a long time), the tutorial gets you through the meat of the game and brings you up to playable speed less than 20 minutes.

The AI is slooooow, but that's to be expected for a game of this complexity.   The fact that a decent AI was built at all is somewat of an impressive feat in and of itself.   However, there are times that I'd wish the computer would think a little faster.    The AI is certainly a capable player, however, it is sometimes like playing poker against the computer in that you miss out on the psychological manipulation that's inherent to the game.

The sound is one place where the game really stands out.   The music and clips of political speeches echoing in the background really adds to the ambiance of the Cold War setting.

In all I would give this game an 8 out of 10:   An excellent implementation of a venerated board game whose only detractions are a bit of UI clunkiness in places and a slow AI.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021898698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 22008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15460, 'last_played': 1674227797}
review:
[h1]Личные впечатления[/h1]
[code]Мы имеем врагов внутренних. Мы имеем врагов внешних. 
Об этом нельзя забывать, товарищи, ни на одну минуту.
Иосиф Виссарионович Сталин[/code]
У меня лежит коробка с этой игрой. И знаете, она лежит уже давно нетронутой. Потому что слишком долгие партии, потому что "это не про эльфов с понями", много еще почему. Зато теперь, к черту всех, я могу поиграть всласть в эту замечательную игру(меня просто распирает от того какая она классная). Я могу переиграть историю мира, и знаете я проживаю каждый миг, каждый значимый шаг в игре.

[h1]Техническая сторона[/h1]
Я не знаю на что все тут жалуются, но у меня на компе "неизвестно сколько-летней давности" (core2duo, geforce 9600) все отлично работает.
Как я понял разработчики очень быстро делают патчи, которые устраняют критичные недоработки.

Интерфейс довольно понятный, хотя и требует небольшого привыкания. У меня это заняло минут 10.

Мультиплеер пока без нареканий. Единственно хотелось больше функций по просмотру. Смотреть игры других игроков. Смотреть статистику человека создавшего игру. Хочется чтобы, как-то более наглядно, можно было посмотреть опции в созданной игре.(Пришлось создавать самому игру с разными вариантами, чтобы понять что значат все эти иконки)

Надеюсь, разработчики будут держать руку на пульсе и прислушаются к пожеланиям игроков.


[h1]Итог[/h1]
Отличная игра, отличные возможности. Ждем русский язык. Нужно больше русскоязычных игроков для комфортной игры.(с иностранцем играл до 7-ми утра, чтобы партия не расстянулась на недели из-за временной разницы)

[code]Не спрашивай, что твоя страна сделала для тебя, спрашивай, 
что ты можешь сделать для своей страны.
Джон Фицджеральд Кеннеди[/code]

P.S. разработчики забили на развитие игры, не выполнили даже обещания данные на кикстартере. Позор, просто позор. Игра отличная но разработчикам просто минус в карму.
P.S.S. Игра могла развиваться, энтузиасты регулярно проводят чемпионаты по этой игре, которые могли быть(и по словам разработчика должны были) реализованы в самой игре, но к сожалению нет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049949381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1487295488}

A good game that was taken from the table to the computer with excellent skill.

The AI is tough and not dumb.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025542690', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1584908717}
review:
The physical version of Twilight Struggle is, without a doubt, my favourite boardgame. The reason for this is a simple but resolutive one: it is a thrilling game. No other game has got me grinding my teeth in agonising tension about what card to play, where to invest my resources, trying to outguess my adversary. Twilight Struggle is not a game, it's an experience. 

The PC game takes the elements of the game to the electronic format and does a fair job in the technical aspects. The important thing, however, is that the game itself remains the same: choose a side (or not) and vie for global domination against the other superpower. You do that by using the cards in your hand, which reflect historical events of the Cold War such as 'the Cuban Missile Crisis', the foundation of the 'NATO', the establishment of the 'Warsaw Pact', etc. However, each card has also an associated point value that you may use to place direct influence on the countries, roll for realignments to change the influence balance in countries, or to throw a 'coup' to try to displace the enemy altogether. 

Influence in the countries is key to score victory points (VPs): once you reach or surpass an influence threshold you get to control that country; control of countries reflects presence, dominance or control of a region, such as Europe, Asia, the Middle East or Africa and entitles each player to a certain ammount of VPs. But here's the thing: the scoring of regions happens through cards just as those of the events, so you never can be really sure when a certain region will be scored and must keep alert at all times. 

The game has a steep learning curve at the start, since the players must get to know the cards in the deck to be prepared to face what may come. That may sound a bit appalling but it's the base of its mastery. I can only recommend this game as a matter of principle: you will like it if you like tension, unpredictability, second-guessing, and managing chaos. This is a game of starting fires that your adversary must put out while you try to put out the ones they start. It is a game of long term strategies and short term reactions. It is a game that rewards patience and resilience. It is a game that puts you under pressure and you better like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960575648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1474068113}
review:
Great recreation of the physical board game.
The AI is good, and makes decent decisions.
I haven't tried the online yet, so I cannot comment on that.
If you are like me, who love strategy games but are surrounded by people who would rather do something else.
This is a Godsend. Get it, you will not regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047285492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 5834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4961, 'last_played': 1676036325}
review:
The game itself - the boardgame - is awesome, one of the best ever. There were many bugs and instability at first, some that made me not recommend. It seems they fixed that.
Important to point out that I got no response from support, so I rate the service as very bad.
Now I would recommend. it is THE boardgame for those who like strategy, who like to deal with crisis and choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969331975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1603050273}
review: Fantastic adaptation of the Twilight Struggle board game. If you've always been interested in the boardgame twilight struggle but never wanted to stump up £40 for it, this is the perfect solution, you can get two copies for half that price and play with a friend, alternatively just pick up one copy and play with people online or against the AI (The AI isn't perfect, and the joy of this game really is in adversarial play). It runs on pretty much anything, the person I play with has a toaster masquerading as a laptop and it works fine on there.

Great Implementation, with everything you need to play TS against AI or friends. I loved to see very detailed cards description! It's like having the boardgame (and I have it) but without all the burden to prepare everything.
Great job developers. Now I am waiting for different AI players!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031021635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 98613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 27, 'playtime_at_review': 15009, 'last_played': 1712406305}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996781368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 15090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1391, 'playtime_at_review': 2421, 'last_played': 1712124623}
review:
Highly recommended. Fantastic adaptation of the board game. Frankly, I would almost prefer this to playing it in person since it handles all the trackers automatically. There are several UI features that help you understand how the game works, and you have the option of taking back moves as long as the move didn't include a decision by your opponent or a dice roll (ie it doesn't let you cheat), and it has you confirm your moves.  The learning curve for the game itself is moderate, but for the strategy it's pretty high, but you will still have fun losing. 

The game log tells you everything that has happened, but there are some minor issues where you play a card that give your opponent some influence to place, and if you weren't paying attention you may not know because the gamelog won't tell you until after you end your turn.  

There are some very minor bugs where the influence markers don't populate on the board right away, or the AI might "hang" while making a decision, but moving the map usually fixes it for some reason.  My only other complaints are that some of the UI and HUD are difficult to access or see because of other parts overlapping, and the AI feels like it takes an eternity to play sometimes. This is rarely a problem, though, because I'm thinking out my next move. So far I haven't encountered anything that breaks or diminishes the game.  The AI is pretty damn good, and overall its a slick looking game and a fantastic adaptation. I can't wait for it to come out on Android in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095969846', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1529, 'last_played': 1559640846}
review: 经典桌游冷战热斗，BGG长年排行第二（现在第三），电子版完美实现原作，而且避免了玩实体经常忘记计分计错分的问题。单人模式带的AI不错，有一定挑战性，即使找不到小伙伴也能愉快游戏。推荐喜欢桌游和回合策略的同学购买。10/10推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561197992860654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1496032575}
review:
If you know TS, this is a no-brainer: it's very polished and 100% faithful to the board game. I have backed it in Kickstarter and played the beta. The game was constantly improved and they did a great job.

If you don't know this and like strategy games, don't miss out on the greatest board game of all time. Fairly easy to pick up, addictive and occasionally nerve-wrecking. The board game was co-designed by Ananda Gupta, main designer for XCOM: Enemy Within

author: {'steamid': '76561198029247941', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1586065035}
review:
Отличная реализация отличной настольной игры.

Несколько необычный ИИ, не всегда ясно почему он делает некотороые вещи, но как я понял, со временем он обучится от людей.
Думаю позже стот прикрутить ему настройи.

9/10. После пары изменений от разработчиков будет 10/10.

Покупайте не задумываясь.

Выяснилось что будут релизы на мобильные платформы - сразу стали ясны некоторые особенности интерфейса. На таче это все должно быть вполне удобно. Надеюсь что после релзов попилят ПК версию на предмет мелочей удобства

author: {'steamid': '76561198029174927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 666, 'playtime_at_review': 1620, 'last_played': 1712191940}
review:
EDIT: 4/26/16

They fixed the bug I was concerned about, so there are no problems with bugs now.

ORIGINAL:

Twilight Struggle is a highly revered board game in the niche community of avid board gamers, and so I and many other board gamers were excited when we heard the game was coming to Steam. For those new to Twilight Struggle, it's a board game that masterfully captures the suspense of the Cold War, and allows for many strategic choices. Thankfully, it's a decent port.

Pros:
Excellent board game
Good online functionality
Timeframe options allow for asynchronus multiplayer (Think a chess clock: each player can get 30 minutes, an hour, etc. all the way up to 45 days to make moves)
Internal friends list functionality with multiplayer
Tutorial is pretty good, and can allow the uninitiated to ease themselves into the game's rules
Competent AI for offline multiplayer
Elo systme for ranking multiplayer players

Cons:
UI has some small bugs, which will likely be worked out in future patches (nothing game-breaking)
Makes you make a 3rd party account, though this account is unintrusive in the game (not as bad as UPlay)
Games are somewhat long, though you can alter time settings to make this a non-issue

author: {'steamid': '76561198057854903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1460840331}
review:
Ok I NEVER write reviews for games but this game...
A game where you choose to play Online or with the Computer either as the USSR or the US in a struggle for World Domination through real life events. Athough there are some slight kinks in the game it's still high up there.

You must be cautious about many things at once e.g Influence, past plays of both you and your opponant, and sacrifices you've made. Now I've only played (at the time of writing this) about an hour and a half of the game and i can say firmly that I AM ADDICTED! If you love history like i do and geo-political games, THIS GAME IS FOR YOU! 

If you are still unsure about this game keep reading.

Starting the 16th of April I will be doing a stream of JUST this game on Twitch, Saturday-Wednesday all starting at 3pm US central time. These streams will be for those that want to see more gameplay from an (below) average player of the game in order to see if the game is worth the money.  https://www.twitch.tv/kodysmithson  Join if you are unsure, curious, or if you just want to see a noob play this game. Thanks for reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004656310', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 12052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1579523340}
review: The highest rated boardgame now on Steam! I've been waiting for this to happen and it is finally here and it (almost) perfect. Put aside a few glitches (but nothing game breaking so far) it is great. If you love the boardgame you will love this too. if you are new to it, the AI is good place to start, before moving to the real salt and pepper of TS - the online multiplayer! Just don't give up - it takes at least a couple of games to wrap your head around the rules and at least a few more to get the hang of it. 9/10 for me!

review: This is a phenomenal board game, and and excellent port to online network play. The only snag is that it should be possible to zoom all the way out to see 100% of the map rather than 90% (and have to drag/move around), but other than that, no complaints. If you haven't played Twilight Struggle at a table before, do yourself a favor and learn it through the tutorial here. It is an outstanding strategic exercise and a very fulfilling game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972906174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1574063568}
review:
I love this game in the original physical version and I really questioned how they were going to get an AI to understand the complexities of it.  WIth a little over eleven hours of play under my belt now, I'm pretty sure I know how they did it.... the AI cheats like a mofo.  Rest assured, if you have a scoring card in your hand, it knows exactly which one(s) you have and it's every move will be aimed at thwarting you.

I'm giving this game a cautious recommendation only because there is really nothing out there quite like it and it's possible I might be mistaken and the price isn't too high, but you should be prepared to be very frustrated.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970638624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1520801311}
review:
TWILIGHT STRUGGLE was the number-one-rated board game on boardgamegeek for something like eight years until it was dethroned by Pandemic: Legacy last year. Now it is number 2.

It is a game of Cold War brinksmanship and high strategy for two players or one player vs a pretty decent AI. You take the role of either the United States or the Soviet Union and the game begins in 1945, with the battle lines drawn between the liberal capitalist Western Europe and the Communist Eastern Europe and Asia. The goal is to use world events, coups, and political realignments to shift the governments of a region toward one bloc or the other. Controlling a region nets victory points; earning 20 victory points at any time, or having the most VPs at the end, wins you the game.

If you start Global Thermonuclear War, you lose. But sometimes there are immense temptations to walk right up to the razor's edge. It's a one-of-a-kind experience that puts you right into the fucked-up brain of a Cold War strategist, making choices that are completely logical and rational from a game theory point of view but are horrific when you stop to think about what they mean in the real world.

Will you change history? Or will you be buried by it? That's up to you.

The gameplay of the original boardgame is imported basically seamlessly into this adaptation. Like the Sentinels of the Multiverse adaptation, there are a few areas where you can kind of tell this was developed to work on touchscreen devices as well as PC - lots of big buttons and dragging things into highlighted areas - but Twilight Struggle's support for the PC interface feels a little bit more robust. You CAN play cards by dragging them around the screen or you can just click them and then click the menu option for what to do with them.

The interface is polished enough for a small-scale game. It's not bare-bones. There are fun little aesthetic touches, like the tap-tap-tap of Morse code when it comes time to confirm your turn, or audio clips made from famous speeches by Stalin, Truman etc when new turns begin. Eveyrthing seems to work so far.

I haven't tried the multiplayer yet, but the single-player works well. The AI isn't stupid; it's not like playing some kind of cosmic genius expert at the game, but it doesn't do obviously stupid things and it's a great way for beginners to learn the ropes. Also, the developers have apparently committed to constantly refining the AI based on the outcomes of games played out in the real world, so we can expect it to get harder and better as time goes on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003878875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1686935869}
review:
My overall score for this game is at least 7/10. 

The bad things are like, the AI likes to place influence in my already controlled country, which is not great since I can use 1 point to fix AI's 2 points; Also sometimes AI does weird decision, like it chooses to coup Libya when I'm going to score an Africa control. But I'm not very experienced in this game, so my points might be wrong.

Also the bugs could be annoying; The discard list can be empty sometimes. Looks like it happens when I switch from Player Hand to Discards or Removed cards constantly. Reload the game can fix this.

Anyway I hope Playdek can fix the bugs and train a more powerful AI! Thanks for making such a great game! The credit is amazing since there are very few programmers, you guys must be very mighty!

P.S. Also hope that Playdek can fix the bug of Agricola, which AI could enter infinite loop sometimes, I think the reason is like others said, the AI can't end thinking when there are improvement cards with plantable fields.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073411206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1505646233}
review:
もともとはGMT社のボードゲームです。
カードドリブンと呼ばれるゲームシステムをうまく冷戦に落とし込んでいる名作です。

元のボードゲーム持ってたら絶対に買い。
英語がわからなくてもBGGから日本語訳をダウンロードすれば遊べます
（そして根本的なルールは簡単なので覚えるのも早いです）

基本的にボードウォーゲームのジャンルは、ゲームシチュエーションの非対称性をベースにゲームシステムを作るためなかなかとっつきにくいものですが、このゲームは非対称でありながらその部分をうまくシステムに盛り込んでいるため、非常に競技性が高く、対戦相手さえ不足しなければゲームに飽きがくることはほとんどないと思います。

定価以上は遊びこめると思います

author: {'steamid': '76561198065025120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1485689474}
review:
[h1]ОБ ИГРЕ[/h1]
Блеф, гамбиты, азарт - все здесь есть. Тематика Холодной войны  подходит как нельзя лучше! Чувствуешь себя главой сверхдержавы: оказывая влияния на другие страны путем реальных (!) военных конфликтов и дипломатических миссий, пытаешься привести свой народ к мировому господству. Главное - не начать Атомную войну!

[h1]О ВОПЛОЩЕНИИ[/h1]
Довольно удобный интерфейс. Есть внятное обучение. Удобный момент: перед тем как условия карты выполнятся - можно увидеть примерные результаты, что удобно при планировании. Озвучка и арт довольно простые, но мне понравилось: все выдержанно. AI показался довольно сильным (возможно, у меня просто нет опыта в этой игре). Мультиплеер пока не опробовал.

[h1]О ЛОКАЛИЗАЦИИ[/h1]
Судя по обсуждениям на "тесере", русская локализация должна появиться. А пока те, кому мешает языковой барьер - на том же сайте могут скачать русский перевод правил и карт.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002173392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1460709415}
review:
This is an interesting 1v1 game with a pretty steep learning curve. The rules and cards aren't hard to comprehend - it's just that there are lots of them to memorize, and games are pretty long with lots to keep track of.

The games are decided by 3 things: skill (most of which is experience/memorization), card-drawing luck, and dice-rolling luck.

This game is less about strategy/simulation and more about probability-based calculation that relies on memorizing lots of events. The computer does help you see the probability distributions and visualize moves before committing to them so that finding good moves is easier. The interface is better as a result, but the actual game is still held back by being a board game.

The optimal move has little to do with analyzing the situation and making a decision based on strategy - it's about minimizing your vulnerability to predetermined events that will happen in the future based on fixed event cards.
For example, you have to avoid spending your moves building up a presence in Romania because there's a card that removes all your influence in Romania and gives it to your opponent. What makes Romania different from Bulgaria or Hungary? Nothing that actually matters in the gameplay rules or the map geography, and nothing that has to do with strategy or what the game is trying to simulate.

The basic problem is that the event cards are completely predetermined (seemingly inspired by actual historical events). When you make moves that seem like they should exploit a weakness or create different opportunities, the game doesn't generate new or different event cards. The game doesn't recognize that the situations which allowed those historical events to happen might not exist in your game. It's just a digital version of a board game that has hard-coded events.

Once you have memorized all those events, you can plan better and the game becomes more interesting. But there's still a huge luck component that will make the experience less rewarding and unnecessarily slow down the process of learning/improving.

I'm not sure how balanced the two sides are. There are some options to handicap one of the sides, so there's probably a workaround for potential imbalance.

It was a few hours of fun, so I'll "recommend" it assuming the multiplayer works well, but the AI doesn't seem to understand how to play for victory. I might play it more if the AI gets better, but I'm not convinced that multiplayer is worth the time to really learn.

The computer version could have fixed the luck-based aspect and the hard-coded events with something better, but for matches that are as long as the ones in this game, I'd rather play something that's more skill-based. Maybe they did the best they could for a board game, but it's not the best option for a PC game that claims to be about strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988092362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1710252801}
review:
This game was so long 1st place in world boardgame rating. And... it is awesome.

Twilight Struggle is a Tension from big T
Twilight Struggle is when you sit and think about how to move
Twilight Struggle is when each decision can be critical
Twilight Struggle is when you try to manage crises
Twilight Struggle is when you try to attack while defending, and try to defend while attacking
Twilight Struggle is when luck can help you win
Twilight Struggle is when you can win despite unluck
Twilight Struggle is when you must predict your opponent
Twilight Struggle is... best boardgame ever. And i can't get tired of it.
developer_response: Good afternoon MT.  I think this may have been the most simple yet detailed and therefore favorite review I've read today.  Thank you.  We are glad you are enjoying the game. Happy Gaming to you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030755099', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1504564287}
review:
TL;DR: You are getting one of the best strategy games of all time for $15 or less, when the normal board game version costs $40, and takes much longer to play than the digital version. If you like history even a little bit, or strategy games at all, I would highly recommend this game.


Twilight Struggle is an incredible game where every move feels like it could be your last, every mistake is paid for dearly, and every minor victory feels so, so rewarding. This game features a 1v1 tactical deathmatch between the US and USSR during the Cold War, and each side tries to best the other by spreading their influence throughout the world. Play is mostly card based, and each player must decide which cards to play each turn to destroy their opponent: but not all cards are helpful to you, and the threat of global nuclear warfare constantly looms over you. This is probably the most intense and fun strategy board game I have played, and seeing it finally brought to Steam is a blessing.

PROS:
- One of the best startegy games ever
- I find the interface to be fairly good, save for a few hiccups
- There is a pretty good tutorial for any newcomers
- You can play online multiplayer or offline against an AI
- The game gives you several options for modifying the base game, if that's your style
- Atmoshpere, music, etc. is the best I could possibly imagine it to be for a Cold War strategy game like this
- Tons of historical references for any history nerds out there
- Considering the physical board game version of this is usually more than $40, and THAT price is worth it, $15 is pretty damn cheap
- Taking over the world and nuclear warfare are ALWAYS fun

CONS:
- This game has a pretty big learning curve, in my opinion. The tutorial is good, but you may have to play several games before you get the hang of things
- I have noticed several minor glitches, usually when trying to get past a certain screen or when trying to click something, but I have found none of these to be game-ruining
- May have to nag your friends to buy a copy if you want to play with someone you actually know
- The AI takes a bit of time to make moves

NEUTRAL:
- Not sure if I just suck, but the AI seems to be pretty brutally difficult. Some people may like this, others not
- This game does involve chance: picking up cards and rolling dice. Some people may like this in strategy games, other people might not


Overall, I would definitely recommend this game. 10/10 board game, 10/10 strategy game, 7/10 video game. You will have a lot of fun spreading freedom as Murica, and a lot of fun killing capitalist pig-dogs as the commies. I think the asking price isn't bad, and I would definitiely pick this game up on sale.

(Edited to fix spelling errors)
